recent.comments: We booked the entire Courtland Farm for a week in August to get out of DC for a bit.  We had about 10 people and 5 children.  The setting was incredible.  It was super private with amazing views (especially the sunsets from the patio/gazebo).  The house was huge, and there was plenty of room for everyone to have their own space but also lots of room to socialize. It's really a great venue for a family gathering or reunion. We really enjoyed our stay and would consider going back next year.

items.comments: We booked the entire Courtland Farm for a week in August to get out of DC for a bit.  We had about 10 people and 5 children.  The setting was incredible.  It was super private with amazing views (especially the sunsets from the patio/gazebo).  The house was huge, and there was plenty of room for everyone to have their own space but also lots of room to socialize. It's really a great venue for a family gathering or reunion. We really enjoyed our stay and would consider going back next year.

description.summary: Our 1,300 sq. ft. Presidential Suite offers a all-inclusive, elegant, luxurious, relaxing experience. Room rental includes: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner * Super King Size Bed * Jacuzzi bath Tub * Shower System * Private Balcony with Mountain View and Private Smoking area * Private access to the pool * His/her Walk-in Closets * In-room Dining. Sofa couch. Perfect for a romantic getaway.
description.space:
The Manor at Courtland Farm is located in the heart of Virginia's Horse and Wine Country; 10 minutes outside of Middleburg, Virginia. Our Venue is ideal for wedding planners in search of the perfect blank canvas on which to paint their vision, private musical events, executive teams seeking a corporate retreat destination for strategic planning, or film companies seeking the idea location of luxury in a scenic country setting. We now offer elegant, luxury rooms in a farm setting.

The Manor sits on a highly visible 100-acre site, features more than 15,000 square feet of space. Our private property is gated and has controlled access. Call for "Event" pricing and packages.
description.access: The property can ONLY be entered from route 15 in Aldie. The Watson Road entrance in Leesburg is closed.
description.notes: Once your reservation is confirmed, we will provide further details.
description.neighborhood: Rural, Farmland
description.transit: walk, bicycle, drive. Unlimited Parking
description.interaction: The property is fully gated/fenced and has closed circuit cameras in the common areas for 24 hour monitoring.

name: Grace Cottage, Unique Restored Church in Waterford
title: Waterford, Virginia

gallery.caption: Built in 1877 as a Methodist Church, the building was restored by the President of the National Trust for Historic Preservation.
A full library created by the President Emerita of the Journey Through Hallowed Ground National Heritage Area.
A dinner for two, or invite friends
A comfy, quiet, peaceful place to relax.

hosts.about: I fellow AirBnb owner from Waterford, Virginia and an avid traveler. My past times are good books, hiking, and storytelling!

recent.comments: Third time staying in the cottage, definitely one of my favorite Airbnb’s! Such a charming town and beautiful surroundings, and the cottage itself is amazing. Will stay again!

items.comments: Third time staying in the cottage, definitely one of my favorite Airbnb’s! Such a charming town and beautiful surroundings, and the cottage itself is amazing. Will stay again!

Pros:
- Very cool space, especially the wall of books and ladder 
- Cute little town, even if not good for walking around (few sidewalks)
- Super comfortable bed 
- Thoughtful touches like eggs, granola, and almond milk provided 

Cons:
- Very low water pressure in shower
- No coffee machine (there is an espresso machine)
- Floors are very creaky (but historic and beautiful)

Grace Cottage is such an amazing and unique spot. The home has curated goods from all over that make you feel at home. It is peaceful and has such good energy - you can tell it has a refreshing and restorative quality to it. Cat is also so wonderful, very responsive and helpful in all ways. I would love to stay again.

Cat was the perfect host. Beautifully appointed, Grace cottage was a relaxing retreat. The bed was so comfortable and the coffee machine even had a latte setting.  The cottage offered a magnificent library on nearly every topic you can imagine.  Set in the heart of scenic Waterford, this little treasure is everything you could ask for! We highly recommend this fantastic Airbnb.

My spouse and I visited Waterford to celebrate our wedding at a nearby venue. Cat's place was the perfect location to return for the evening. She kindly provided us with fruits, coffee, eggs, and more! The airbnb is on a quiet road near to many wineries, restaurants, and absolutely beautiful surroundings. The space itself is unique and simply charming to marvel at. With all the running around for wedding activities, we did not get a chance to spend more time in the space or explore Cat's recommended list of things to do so we would love to come back. And certainly recommend to others looking for a unique stay in a beautiful location.

Beautiful Grace Cottage was the perfect setting for a light-filled, peaceful retreat. Cat was very responsive, before my arrival and throughout my stay. She reached out ahead of my visit to share some information and ask what type of milk I preferred. The day of my planned arrival, she messaged to let me know the cottage was ready (early!). She had also stocked the well-equipped kitchen with much-appreciated eggs, butter, milk, granola, juice, and fruit, in addition to coffee,  tea, and a tray of condiments and spices. The cottage was very comfortable, and I felt at home immediately. It's location also made it very easy to explore parts of Waterford on foot. I highly recommend and look forward to returning!
Grace’s Cottage was cozy and elegant.  We spent three nights there and felt right at home. We enjoyed the piano, the books, and the peaceful village setting.

description.summary: Grace Cottage has been expertly re-designed to be a unique studio-style living space. It has one California king bed, a living area, large library, dining area and a fully-stocked kitchen space with a stove (no oven). There are also two sofa beds and a grand piano ~ a wonderful place to explore Waterford, the surrounding vineyards, and an opportunity to stay in one of the village's beautifully preserved properties.
description.space: There is a dining area that seats and is equipped with service for 6. The kitchen has everything but an oven and is fully equipped for cooking and making coffee & cappuccino, pasta, and a glorious breakfast. The ceilings are 15' high and the bathroom has new fixtures and a glass door shower. There is central air and heat. There are two sitting areas and a desk, as well as about 1,000 books to choose from!
description.access:
Guests are given the entire use of Grace Cottage. 

Unfortunately, due to the pandemic, we can only allow registered guests on the property. If you have someone who may visit but not spend the night, please be sure to include them in your guest count.
description.notes: The Village of Waterford is 1 of only 2 places in the America where the entire village is listed as a National Historic Landmarks, for good reason. You will know it when you arrive, until then, check out "Waterford Village . org" (all one word, the site hides URLs).
description.neighborhood: A complete walking guide through Waterford, a National Historic Landmark, is left for you in Grace Cottage. For a fabulous hike to a charming little waterfall within the village, look no further than Phillips Farm ~ a gorgeous walk through preserved lands surrounding the Village, ending in a beautiful waterfall. Grace Cottage is a 5 minute walk to Village Winery which makes lovely wine and the very best Elderberry and Aronia non-alcholic juices. There is a neighborhood pool on Clarks Gap Road, on the way out of the village. Anyone can swim for a guest fee of $5/person. There is also a farm stand with organic fruits and veggies, freshly baked bread and eggs, in front of the Waterford Market on Second Street every Saturday from 9-11am during spring, Summer and Fall.
description.transit: There are two (if creative 3) parking spots on the property for guests.  If additional parking is necessary please let me know as street parking along Main Street is respectfully reserved for home owners by village residents. Many will kindly offer up their space if requested, but I will need to request their indulgence.
description.interaction: I am happy to offer recommendations for places to visit, dine and hike nearby, and answer any questions at any time during your stay.
description.house_rules:
Please leave the Cottage the way you found it. Please don't move the furniture - unless using the pullout beds,  in which case, please be mindful of the antique pieces as well as the original wood floors as they scratch quite easily and we take note of their condition before guest arrival.

Though we have a wood fire stove in the Cottage, unfortunately a previous guest nearly set the home on fire by abusing the right to set a fire in my wood stove, and sadly, my insurance company required that I now have to dis-allow use. However. the air conditioning and heat work perfectly, just be sure to reset the thermostat to 70 degrees upon your departure.

As a reminder, your rate covers 2 guests but Grace Cottage can accommodate a maximum number of 6 guests for the additional fee per guest. Unfortunately, due to the pandemic we can only allow registered guests on the property. If you have someone who may visit but not spend the night, please be sure to include them in your guest count.

name: Ballenger Farm
title: Hamilton, Virginia

gallery.caption: The white painted section on the left was added in the 70s and is occupied year round by my folks. The stone section on the right, courtyard, and deck are for you! This photo and the interior photos were taken by David Andrews.
The courtyard's little pond has a few sweet fishies in it.
Look at our cute ducks! I promise more photos of our farm animals if you keep looking.
After you enter through the mudroom you reach the kitchen.
The doors allow easy access to the deck.
This table is awesome- both sides fold down. We picked this up from Nostalgia in Purcellville!
In the winter you can use the fireplace.
The first room is yellow. We don't have a name for it yet, I'm thinking of naming it the "rhymes with jello" room.
This room has a lot of ship pictures and its own full bath.
Jelly bean shaped desk is pretty crucial.
This little room is cute but also stately. Just look at that lamp. It's very serious.
That cute room just got an upgraded bed! Two people can be very snug in there now :)
This room has its own staircase, oo lala!
Spooky staircase :) Note: little ones love these spiral stairs, but we suggest they use the main staircase because this set can be difficult to use for kiddos.
Nighttime at the farm + some goats
People fall in love here. It just happens.
Chickens, goats, and a small human all living in harmony!
Our most interestingly colored bathroom is situated upstairs for easy access by guests staying in the green room and the red room.
This bathroom is attached to the blue master bedroom.
Lil blue, the downstairs half bath.
This is a downstairs bathroom. People in the yellow bedroom use it the most.

You can have little fires here! This is actually a huge cooking pit that’s 5 feet deep and for SERIOUS cooking (sometimes we rent it out for cooking whole animals), but it’s mainly just a hang out spot for s’mores making :)
Look at this genuine beer garten table! You can put all kinds of things on it!
You can fish in the ponds!
Our goats like people! These baby goats are friends with human babies!
This goat is named Cinnamon. She is naughty, and we love her. She likes to park on cars that are parked near the house, which is why we park in the back field (about 25 meters from the house).
Look at our cute sign! (But ignore the date - the first section was built in 1753.)
Ps. A mile of trail to walk on the property if you need extra nature time :)

hosts.about:
Check out more at #ballengerfarm, theballengerfarm on insta.
I am living my best life working on Ballenger Farm and helping it achieve its full potential. This old farm is my passion!
 I live in Leesburg with my sweet daughter, so I’m not always at the farm.

recent.comments: Very cool place to spend the weekend!

items.comments: Very cool place to spend the weekend!
Had a wonderful stay. Really enjoyed being here.
We absolutely love your time at Ballenger Farm! Can't recommend it enough!

We had a wonderful stay at Ballinger Farm.  The house is historic and really well preserved.  The farm is awesome- we loved the goats, chickens, and Peter Pan (our guard cat)!  We dealt primarily with David, who is a co-host, and he was very attentive and helpful with anything we needed or wanted to know.  We had a hiccup with the AC and David was there immediately to get everything working and keep it that way.  He even delivered us farm-fresh eggs one morning!  
Such a unique home and wonderful area - I’d be happy to go back anytime.

Elizabeth’s farm stay was one the best experiences we had with family and friends. Groceries and restaurants are in walking distance. Hosts were Elizabeth’s parents; David and his wife were so good and kind to us. It was perfect farmhouse experience with goats, chickens, ducks, fishes, ponds, bon fire and awesome landscape. Although it was raining most of the time, but we did had fun. My two-year daughter along with other kids thought David was Old MacDonald and they were enjoying moments like petting and feeding animals and birds. 

We thought of cookout but because of weather we had to cook inside, kitchen was well equipped. We had everything we need. David and his wife were awesome hosts. We would like to come back and also recommend this to others.
Loved their place. Would go back!
Great place! Would come back!

description.summary: Quaker colonial (circa 1753) on small farm with free range goats, chickens, ducks, rabbits, and other animals.  Ballenger farm is close to wineries, breweries, horse and hunt country, the WD&O bike trail, and the Appalachian trail.
description.space:
The farm is accessed via a private natural road. The property includes a barn, spring house, corn crib, and several streams and ponds. Outside, you can roam the property and visit ducks, chickens, rabbits, and fainting goats; take in the view from the deck;  enjoy the fish ponds (fishing allowed); and walk several trails. Looking to grill? Go back in time with an old fashion fire pit, wood fired grill, and five foot deep in-ground oven.

Inside, the vibe is very "East meets West mid 1700s" with a mix of classy antiques, funky vintage finds, and East Asian pieces.  In addition to the bathrooms and bedrooms, there is a living room. piano room that looks into the courtyard, dining room that sits up to 12, large kitchen with two ovens and six burner gas cook top, laundry/mud room, and special toy room accessed by a winding stair.
description.access:
The home includes an original stone section first started in the mid-1700s with a brick section added later. The entire stone section is open to guests, and has it's own private entry. 

Ballenger Farm is a working hobby farm. We raise chickens, ducks, rabbits, and goats. Feel free to roam the property - there is a mile of trails for walking. However, not all the buildings have been fully restored so they are not safe for adventuring in, especially for children.
description.notes:
> Ballenger Farm has no check-out Airbnb chores.  Enjoy your stay!

> The goats and other farm animals are friendly and like to investigate new folks. You can toss the chickens and ducks all kinds of snacks and feed the goats out of your hand :).  Please encourage children to move slowly as quick movements can frighten the animals.

> Cars should be parked behind the barns. When cars are parked near the house (which is the goats favorite space) the goats like to play king of the mountain on top of them. 

> Stays at Ballenger are limited to eight adults plus several children under 10 years.

> Per Airbnb policy, we do not host parties, events, or other gatherings via the Airbnb platform.

> Please note: my parents live and work on the farm in the brick section that is attached to the main stone house in which you will be staying. There are no shared entrances or indoor spaces. 

> Some guests have said that they think that Ballenger has ghosts. We have not seen or heard any. Instead, we think that after 270 years, any house can  be forgiven its quirks and creaks. :)

> Airbnb AI claims that this property is a '10 minute walk from a lake'. There are no lakes of any size in the entire county. Hosts can not change this. Airbnb suggested that I add this note to this listing until they can fix the bug.
description.neighborhood:
Ballenger Lane is an 18th century natural road with only two other houses and neither are visible from the property giving Ballenger Farm exceptional privacy for the area.

Horse and Hunt Country, the Appalachian Trail, the Shenandoah and Potomac Rivers, Harper's Ferry, and dozens of wineries and breweries are within a 10 to 30 minute radius.

Purcellville is next door. It has quaint shops with vintage goods as well as convenient grocery stores and resturants.

A walking path connects Ballenger Farm to Patrick Henry College. If you have relatives, friends, or business there, it makes it a very quick commute!
description.transit:
A DC commuter bus departs from a free parking lot 8 minutes away.

Dulles Airport is about 30 minutes away.

Lyft and Uber are available, but wait times can be a bit longer than in urban areas. Limos are popular for wine tours, but make sure to book in advance.

Metro's Silver Line is 40 minutes away, but opening much closer in 2023.
description.interaction: In Covid times you’re able to stay here free of any interaction with me and my cohost parents. You can reach us by phone if you need anything! Also, since the farm is owned by my darling parents you might see us working outside- and we'll probably give a little wave.
description.house_rules:
Please,  no additional overnight guests. The overnight accommodations are for eight adults/children (additional infants and toddlers that sleep in bassinets or pack n plays are most welcome!).

The speed limit on Ballenger Lane is 5 mph. It used to be the main North/South road in Western Loudoun back when Ballenger Farm was first established 270 years ago. And now it's in the same condition as it was then! A one lane natural road with washes and pot holes! Please drive carefully and all will be OK.

name: Hobson Hall - A Poshabodes Luxury Property
title: Alexandria, Virginia

recent.comments: We had a wonderful stay with our family. Everyone was comfortable and happy with the accommodations and experience in the home. Cooking was a breeze with a fully equipped kitchen. The first impression when opening the door was fabulous with fresh flowers and they even had fresh donuts. What great touches to a gorgeous home. We would definitely stay again. Close to a lot of shops and King St. Highly recommend the home.

items.comments: We had a wonderful stay with our family. Everyone was comfortable and happy with the accommodations and experience in the home. Cooking was a breeze with a fully equipped kitchen. The first impression when opening the door was fabulous with fresh flowers and they even had fresh donuts. What great touches to a gorgeous home. We would definitely stay again. Close to a lot of shops and King St. Highly recommend the home.
Absolutely fabulous.  Perfect to accommodate large family as well as visiting guests.  Love Old Town and this made it even better.

This home is absolutely beautiful ans the best air and b experience I’ve had. Most everything is brand new and the hosts have thought about everything you’d ever need to be completely « at home. » Hosts are also very thoughtful with nice surprises upon arrival. I would definitely recommend and very much look forward to coming back next time I’m in the area!

What a perfect house for my family. I will stay here any time I have business or pleasure in the DC area. The house has charm and grace but it is spotless and modern. The house sits next door to a museum that has a lovely garden so there is a feeling of urban privacy. The hosts have really thought about the details - any kitchen gadget we could want for, loads of fluffy towels and wine glasses, lovely air conditioning, the music was playing when we arrived and gorgeous flowers sprinkled about. My family were in town to attend my fathers funeral, so it was a difficult and emotional week, but the house gave us refuge and space to meet with relatives and friends we hadn't seen in many years. My mother had a private suite where she could rest away from the family. This helped her face the week greatly. We are just in awe of the house design and the thoughtfulness of our hosts (even fresh donuts under glass...). The upgraded tech was greatly appreciated. I love PoshAbodes!!

My husband and I stayed in this house with our 4 children.   It was an excellent experience for many reasons.   It is a beautiful home in a great location with private parking.   Alexandria is a beautiful area and also so close to DC and Mount Vernon.  The little extras are abundant and appreciated.   From fresh flowers to a literally endless supply of giant fluffy white towels and bath robes, we simply felt well taken care of.   The kitchen is well stocked and every room is well lit - great lighting.  Family room is cozy and primary bed is very comfortable.  The front office is an amazing space if you need to work - desk with USB's, outlets and a view.
Great supply of the basics that we don't find in every rental home such as garbage bags, ziplock bags, toilet paper, Q tips and toiletries - stocked like a 5 star hotel.  These little things mean ALOT when traveling.   When I asked the kids about their favorite part of the trip to DC (we toured 1-2 things daily), they said:  The house!!

I don’t typically write reviews, but I really can’t stop raving enough about Hobson Hall! It was absolutely beautiful, exceptionally clean, and in a great location. Check in was easy-- quiet, private parking spots, remote keyless entry, and even champagne! The historical architectural features, the décor, the high quality furniture, and the original artwork are really above and beyond-- some days we didn’t even want to leave the house! We were also able to spread out in the various rooms comfortably. The kitchen had professional grade appliances and anything we could need to prepare a meal. The master bedroom was large, with a very comfortable bed and bedding, and the blackout curtains and location on the next door private garden afforded us excellent sleep-- not something I usually can count on while traveling! The master bathroom was perfect-- large dressing room, huge shower and separate bath made dressing easy-- and fluffy towels upon extra fluffy towels! We will definitely return!

My friends were so amazed and happy with their stay at this property.  Everything was in perfect condition from the comfy robes to the well equipped kitchen.  The player baby grand piano was the highlight of their stay....a concert while you are having dinner!  What more could we ask for.
Thank you once again PoshAbodes!

description.summary:
Delight in every sumptuous detail at Hobson Hall, a truly unique four-bedroom, 3.5-bathroom stunner, comprising more than 3,600 square feet of space. One of the few remaining Richardsonian Romanesque houses left in Alexandria, Hobson Hall is located adjacent to Lee-Fendall House Museum & Gardens, an elegant event venue and popular setting for weddings. Settle in and enjoy a one-of-a-kind dwelling imbued with historic charm and ultra-luxe amenities. When you’re ready to venture out, all of Old Town Alexandria’s renowned shops, museums, and dining establishments are just steps away.   
  
Equipped to accommodate up to 12 guests, Hobson Hall boasts so much more than your average vacation rental, such as two living rooms, a luxe master suite, gas fireplaces, and a chic parlor complete with a baby grand piano. It’s ideal for events, celebrations, holidays, and reunions.   
  
Built circa 1896, this home underwent a major renovation overseen by local architect James Palmer, yet it still retains many of its original architectural elements, such as doors, hardware, arched entry doors, fireplaces and their tilework and mantels, and all the windows visible from Washington Street. Hobson Hall is owned by a local artist who was recently awarded a residency at the Torpedo Factory Art Center in Alexandria. You’ll see many of her beautiful original paintings on display throughout the home.   
  
About this Property  
Architect Henry Hobson Richardson pioneered the Richardson Romanesque Revival Style, which incorporates 11th and 12th-century southern French, Spanish and Italian Romanesque characteristics. You’ll find charming details around every corner, from the dramatic arched doors in the vestibule to the brick adorning several fireplaces.   
  
As you enter Hobson Hall, you’ll be greeted by this home’s elegant living spaces. Beautiful marble tile makes a dramatic statement in the vestibule. After entering through arched double doors, you’ll find the home’s formal living spaces nearby — a formal living room, an intimate parlor, and a study. The study features sophisticated dark colors and views onto Washington Street, and comes complete with a desk and printer.  
  
Head down the hallway boasting beautiful hardwood floors to reach the gourmet open kitchen and its adjacent living spaces, including a large family room and dining area, all of which can be closed off from the front of the house thanks to a large pocket door. The chef’s kitchen is equipped with a professional, eight-burner gas range with double ovens and a pot filler, as well as a large island with waterfall countertop. A stylish wet bar with a wine fridge adds convenience.   
  
Step out onto the lovely brick patio to enjoy views of the impressive gardens of Lee-Fendall House Museum & Gardens. Outfitted with patio furniture, a fire table, and a gas grill, this is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the vistas.   
  
Head to the second level to discover four richly appointed bedrooms. The luxurious master bedroom features crown molding, sophisticated lighting, a large walk-in closet, and an ensuite bathroom with a tiled shower, separate soaking tub, and double sinks. In the king guest bedroom, you’ll find a gorgeous bay window, as well as chic décor blending neutrals with pops of vibrant color. The third guest bedroom boasts a canopy bed, a soothing color scheme, and its own ensuite bathroom. And finally, in the fourth bedroom, there’s a queen bed along with a twin trundle bed, plus private entrance to the hallway bathroom. Each guest room features high-end bedding, bedside USB ports, TVs, and eye-catching touches that make you feel at home.   
  
Why Choose This Alexandria Vacation Home   
• Unbeatable location just four blocks from Old Town’s King Street and six blocks to the waterfront  
• Adjacent to the historic Lee-Fendall House Museum & Garden  
• Two dedicated off-street parking spaces  
• Close to a wide array of restaurants, shops, parks, landmarks, and museums  
• Historic abode with modern comforts  
• Brand-new full-sized washer and dryer  
• Impressive amenities, luxe touches, and high-tech features  
• Walkability score of 95  
• Poshabodes’ rigorous COVID-19 cleaning and disinfection protocols

description.access: Guests will have access to the entire home.
description.neighborhood:
Old Town Alexandria  
With a history spanning more than 250 years, this delightful town still bears many hallmarks of its fascinating past. Old Town is packed with museums and landmarks that make you feel like you’ve stepped aboard a time machine. Its narrow, cobblestone streets are lined with centuries-old row homes, and European-inspired storefronts along main thoroughfares such as King Street are a treat for the eyes. Dine in locally owned eateries and shop at independent retailers — the choices are seemingly endless. There’s no better time to experience the magic of Old Town than during the holidays, when buildings are decked out in glittering lights and seasonal décor.  
  
Washington, DC  
The nation’s capital is the cultural and historic heartbeat of the nation, and with around 70 museums, it’s a prime spot for curious, knowledge-seeking travelers. After a visit to the Washington or Lincoln monuments, explore buzzy neighborhoods like Capitol Hill, H Street Corridor, or Dupont Circle, where eateries and bars bring together the local crowd. Performance venues and arts organizations scattered throughout town showcase American art and music in all its forms. To appreciate natural beauty, head to one of the many parks dotting the landscape, including Rock Creek Park and Glover Archbold Park, or settle in near Georgetown Waterfront Park overlooking the Potomac River.
description.transit: Hobson Hall has a walk score of 95!  So, you can easily get around Old Town on foot. However, when needed, there is plenty of public transportation, including buses and the metro. There is a free trolley that goes up and down King St to the King St metro station. Uber and Lyft are also readily available.
description.house_rules:
We hope you have lots of laughter and fun times during your vacation! However, we ask that you’re mindful of the Property and please adhere to our house rules, as specified below.  And, don't hesitate to reach out to your Poshconcierge with ANY questions/concerns.  Thank you!
 
•	Please try to avoid making any loud noise between 10 pm and 8 am to allow neighbors a peaceful night’s sleep.
•	If any neighboring residents report excessive noise or unruly behavior, we may have to evict you from our Property and terminate the Rental Agreement. This could result in loss of security deposit and 100% of rental charges.
•	In case of any disputes or neighbor complaints, it’s your duty to notify us as soon as reasonably practicable.
•	Events and parties are only permitted with express permission of the homeowner.
•	No more than the maximum number of guests as specified in the listing description
•	Please treat our house with the same respect as you would your own home. We’ve put a lot of effort into making this into a lovely space to be enjoyed by our guests.
•	There shall be no smoking or tobacco use inside the Property. Smoking is permitted 15 feet away from the house or upon the patio or deck, if available. All cigarettes and cigars shall be completely extinguished and properly disposed.
•	No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the Property, unless approved by the homeowner

We want you to enjoy your vacation and time at our home to the maximum, but we do have to set some restrictions on visitor numbers for safety reasons. As part of our Rental Agreement, we require the names and details of each member of your traveling party as well as a copy of the driver’s license or passport of the primary renter. In addition, please respect the maximum visitors and rules regarding visitors as set out below.
•	Guests are allowed a maximum of 6 visitors at any time during their stay.
•	Guests are responsible for ensuring that any visitors comply with all Property Rules.
•	Any additional overnight Guests must be approved in advance and are subject to an additional fee as noted in our rates.
•	Parties and large gatherings of any kind are strictly prohibited at our home. Any small gathering must comply with our other house rules regarding noise, the neighborhood and visitor numbers.
•	Guests are to allow homeowner or service access to the property for purposes of repair and inspection. The homeowner will exercise this right of access in a reasonable manner and advise beforehand when possible.

We try to keep our Property as child-friendly as possible. That said, parents always have the final responsibility of ensuring their children’s safety at all times. If you find anything to be unsafe or that requires revision at our Property, please contact us at your earliest convenience so we can address the issue. To maintain our Property, we ask that you:
•	Never leave children unsupervised at our Property without any adults.
•	Our Property is suitable for children of all ages
•	Guests are fully responsible for the safety and security of their children at all times, as well as any disturbance caused to other residents in the neighborhood.
•	Please do not use glasses outside or in the children’s play area for safety reasons.

Please ensure you read and fully understand the Property Rules at the beginning of your stay. If anything is unclear, please contact us so we can explain in further detail to avoid any misunderstandings.

Have fun! This is your vacation time and we hope you make the most of our home, its amenities and your opportunity to relax and visit the surrounding area.

recent.comments:
My sister and I had a wonderful trip to Chesapeake city while staying here. 
We loved everything about the house. 
Elizabeth did an outstanding job  decorating and choosing all the right furnishings and appliances. It’s so beautifully and we felt at home and so comfy. 
By far one of my favorite Airbnb’s that I be stayed at. 
We loved being able to walk just a few steps to everything this little town had to offer. We met a lot of really great people and the weather was wonderful.
We would definitely come visit again. 
Thank you Elizabeth 💖

items.comments:
My sister and I had a wonderful trip to Chesapeake city while staying here. 
We loved everything about the house. 
Elizabeth did an outstanding job  decorating and choosing all the right furnishings and appliances. It’s so beautifully and we felt at home and so comfy. 
By far one of my favorite Airbnb’s that I be stayed at. 
We loved being able to walk just a few steps to everything this little town had to offer. We met a lot of really great people and the weather was wonderful.

This was my second time staying at Elizabeth’s. I love, love, love everything about the place. The location is beautiful. The front porch is the best spot in the house. Had my coffee out there every morning. The house is well appointed; I had everything I needed. Elizabeth is very responsive and a wonderful host- truly a gem! Book this place- you won’t be disappointed

I can't say enough about Elizabeth's gem of a place in adorable Chesapeake City.   Wonderful, cozy accommodations, one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in, well-stocked with absolutely everything thought of and available for a comfortable stay.  Impeccably clean.  Perfect location in the middle of it all for walking to restaurants, the marina, the canal & just for people watching from the front porch.  My son plays piano and absolutely loved the opportunity to play on the baby grand every day.   I appreciated the nice work space too.  Great wi-fi and wide range of streaming options too.  I would highly recommend the Bohemia Bungalow.  :)

We loved the Bohemia Bungalow! Super clean and the host had thought of everything. We were there for a boating event at the Inn down the street. It was so nice to be able to have the quick walk down the street. Cute shops in the area (good chocolate across the street ;). We loved the space so much we just showed the photos of the Bungalow to our interior decorator. We would like to incorporate some of the feel of this into our own home. Just to mention again we give A++ on cleanliness. We also loved the journal of notes from the guests. Elizabeth was great and so responsive!  If we go back to this event we will defiantly be rebooking the  Bohemia Bungalow!
Fantastic time and the house was so cozy. 10/10 would stay again.
This place was so cute! We loved it so much!!! Great place to stay and love the area!
We had a great stay. Loved this place and host, would definitely recommend!

description.summary:
Experience this charming 1940's cottage nestled on bustling Bohemia Avenue in the heart of picturesque Chesapeake City.  Enjoy porch-sitting "on the Avenue", or visit numerous local eclectic shops, restaurants, a brew pub, and even a yoga studio, all only steps away.  Marvel at massive cargo ships navigating the C&D Canal, just a 2-minute walk from your doorstep.
Private off street parking for 2 cars.
description.space: Master bedroom with a queen bed.
description.access: Guest have access from rear entrance and front entrance using a key pads.
description.interaction: Text or call if you have questions or concerns.

Quiet time after 10:00pm weekdays

name: Castle Loft - Private Room in the Egyptian House
title: New Castle, Delaware

gallery.caption:
Aspen guards the home and welcomes guests - 
"Beware of Dog Kisses" Aspen has free range of the common areas in the home. Aspen lives at this home with Co-host John.
Proceed up the foyer stairs to your room, the Castle Loft.
Great Room Dining Area & Piano, with sunken Living Room and Sofa Bed in the foreground.
Great Room to Queen's Bedroom and Bathroom
Great Room to King's Chamber and Queen's Bathroom
Egyptian House Estates Exterior Left Side
Egyptian House Estates  Exterior Right Side

hosts.about:
Just a short note before you book... Recently we have made some hosting changes due to co hosting changes. We have gone back to having myself and John cohost. My sister is also helping us. We have found our more mature ages to work better in caring for our listings. We have removed all non family or younger co hosts  in an effort to better serve our guests. 
Bare with us we are in the midst of a spruce up in two locations. We are painting and updating. Please be patient some times its a bit messy with building materials. We are almost done with our changes.
  PLEASE note there is a three hour time difference between West coast and East coast. We are three hours ahead of you please be advised if you inquire at 10 pm western time we are asleep on the east coast. Europe is six hours ahead of us respectfully. Please be aware you will wake me up, keeping that in mind its important when inquiring to do it before 11 eastern standard time. I'm not trying to be rude just a reminder.
I want to welcome each guest either in person, by text or over the phone. I work out of state but I try to get down to beach listing several times per week. My son lives in our home in Felton all the time. His name is Julian. He's the typical game loving 21 year old. We are improving the house a little at a time by ourselves. I'm a designer and work in interior sales. We keep our dog with us all the time. We are dog people, animal lovers. We allow people the ability to stay and travel with pets. Our Dog lives on the farm up north where we work so no dogs live in the house in Felton. There are always dogs at Greenwood street. We keep stuff at our homes. We ask guests to read our house rules because I feel we live such busy lives its a necessity so our guests understand our reasons for what we expect. We are doing Airbnb to offer alternatives to hotels. We are simple unadorned folks. If you book with us there will be clean towels,  sheets and soap. 
 Nothing fancy. If your looking for fancy that's not us. 
We are available on What's AP for international communication.
Retired Air Force, college student, AirBnB co-host.
Delaware native love music and baseball.  I have been a driver for over 20 years and love meeting new people.

recent.comments: Great as usual!

items.comments: Great as usual!
Great place to stay, quiet and safe area. The dog is amazing and owners are very accommodating and friendly as well.
My second stay and we'll definitely be back, if we can. John and Aspen are super hosts and made us feel very comfortable, welcome and safe. If you love dogs, I highly recommend!
Nice stay, clean, easy to check in, good amenities. It nicely located being under 10 min drive from Christina mall and about 15min drive from Wilmington town centre.

We loved our stay so much that we've already booked another stay! John was helpful and communicated well. Aspen the super host was everything I read, extremely well behaved, sweet and friendly. 

If you love dogs and are looking for a quiet stay, I highly recommend the Egyptian House.
excellent stay!
My stay was awesome. Very clean and very quiet. John was very helpful. I would stay again anytime and I appreciate it.

description.summary: The Castle Loft is a cozy space up a short flight of stairs from the entry hall.  It is the only room on the second floor and like the rest of the house has been recently renovated. While the room is not visible from the first floor, it does not have a door. When not relaxing in the Castle Loft enjoy the open floor plan of the first floor with sunken living room. dining room. large kitchen. 2 full shared bathrooms, washer and dryer, and large yard.
description.space: Private room in the famous Egyptian house - features full size bed with memory foam mattress classic furnishings ceiling fan, dedicated heater/air conditioner, hardwood floors, a small desk (upon request) and a 32" TV connected via wifi services (Netflix provided). The house is equipped with high speed internet and cable TV in the living room.
description.access: Guests may use the kitchen, dining, living and bath rooms inside. Cupboard and/or counter space in the kitchen, as well as refrigerator space will be provided as needed and available. Gentle use of the grand piano is welcome during the day, with consideration for other guests as appropriate. Outside the back patio and yard may be enjoyed. The driveway and parking spots are shared with the live-in co-host and other guests.
description.notes:
This home also has 2 other room listings available for booking: King's Chamber and Castle Loft. We often have multiple guests staying with us in this shared home. Also on the property are 2 private, one-bedroom apartments: Blue Tranquility & Green Sanctuary.

This home is appropriate for travelers, business trips, short term living needs, and work-from-home/online work from your room. This home is not appropriate for romantic getaways, group business meetings, parties, events, or photo-shoots. 

This property is also not appropriate for booking as an address simply to receive packages and other deliveries, nor to establish an official residency address and/or receive government documents for such purposes; it is a place for overnight rest/sleep.

We allow smoking outside only - legal tobacco products or vaping. Recreational cannabis use is illegal in Delaware. We don't allow cannabis on the property. We don't allow medical-use cannabis here either, since we don't have the privacy required by law - we are a public space. Discreet use of alcoholic beverages is allowed, but drunkenness is not welcome.
description.neighborhood: Our neighborhood is a mixture of residential and business. It is quiet and peaceful here as the property is surrounding on 2 sides by a farm and sits back from the road. There is plenty of off street parking and public transportation runs on our street. A car, however is preferable to best enjoy the area. We are close to major roads and the interstate, historic sites, Christiana Mall, University of Delaware, Wilmington and Philadelphia airports.
description.transit: We have a big driveway and plenty of off street parking. Public transportation runs on our street but a car is preferable to best enjoy the area. We are 5 minutes from Route 13, Route 1 and I95.
description.interaction: John and his dog Aspen are on site to make your stay comfortable.
description.house_rules:
No noise after 10 pm. 
No cannabis on the property. 
Not a place for romantic get-aways.
No mail or package delivery.

hosts.about: Welcome to our booking site for the Historic Arthur Willis Feeser Estate. We currently have 3 rooms that are able to be booked. We hope to see you soon!

recent.comments: Fantastic as ever! My go to place to stay in the area.

items.comments: Fantastic as ever! My go to place to stay in the area.
The house is gorgeous and interesting. The room was comfortable. Jonathan was kind and helpful when I needed it.

The home is lovely and Jonathan and Tim are equally as lovely.  They provide a comfortable and safe location.  I reached out to them regarding local recommendations and they were able to provide many.  We are repeat guests and I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a stay in the Gettysburg area.  I look forward to future stays with them.  It was a 5 star experience all the way around!

Jonathan and Timothy were wonderful hosts. Their home is beautiful and they are so welcoming. My room was warm and very comfortable. (Especially the bed!) 
I enjoyed sitting outside by the fire talking with not only the hosts but another guest.  I felt as if we were old friends.  It was wonderful and I will definitely stay there again.   Thank you!

I loved staying in this bed and breakfast. There were smart features everywhere, making it easy to check in/out, turn on/off the lights, etc. The house was full of antiques with descriptive plaquards. There was a large backyard entertaining area. Everything that we needed was provided up front, so we didn't have to go to the trouble of asking the hosts for help during the stay.

Very friendly and welcoming hosts! Beautiful old house, nicely renovated, with fresh homemade baked goods for breakfast. This is definitely my #1 choice for staying in the area and look forward to coming back.
We enjoyed our stay in this beautiful home very much. The hospitality is outstanding. Highly recommended.

description.summary:
Built as a manor house for the Feeser Canning Company in 1920, Arthur Willis Feeser spared no expense in the many architectural gems shown throughout the house. Minutes away from downtown Westminster and only a short 20-minute drive to Historic Gettysburg PA.

Please note: After booking, you will receive an email with a short rental agreement, this must be signed before you arrive. Also there are pets that live in the owner's suite. Do not book if you dislike or are allergic to Cats or Dogs.
description.house_rules:
Booking is not fully confirmed until our rental agreement has been signed. You will not gain access to the property without it signed. 
We are happy to accommodate small dogs and cats as long as proof of vaccinations are provided and copied upon checkin, they are not destructive, and they must be kept in the private bedroom.
Off Street parking is available, however the left garage stall must never be blocked.
First floor office as well as Room 1 and Room 4 on the second floor are for private use of homeowners only.
Smoking at the Estate is strictly prohibited unless located outside by the garage. 
Guest not on the Reservation may not enter the property unless given prior permission by homeowners.
No swimming is permitted in the fountain.
Guest who play piano are welcome to use the grand piano so long as they do so respectively. No children may use the piano. 
Upon Check in, please use the front door unless stated else wise prior to check-in. After Check-In, please use the back door as your main point of entrance. It is the only door that will have your access code.
Guest accept full liability while on the property.
Make sure to turn off the lights, air-conditioning, and any. electronics when you leave the house. Do not forget to close the windows and lock the door.
Report any damages or breakages in a reasonably timely manner. Damages exceeding the security deposit amount must be paid by guests and will be reported to Airbnb.
Obey all instructions given by the homeowners during your stay.

hosts.about:
We're Alex & Lara of Home Sweet City. We met in DC and now call this our home, after we hit hard times we started renting on Airbnb to make extra money and LOVED the experience. Home Sweet City was born and we now manage over 70 short term rentals in the District and enjoy meeting amazing travelers like you from all over the world. 
We know the city very well and so can give you lots of advice on what to do, how to get around and how to make the most of your stay - please just ask!
Whether you’re coming to the Nation’s Capital for business or vacation expect  a very warm welcome all the help you need to get the best out of your visit!

recent.comments:
Basement Flooded w/Raw Sewage in Beautiful D.C. Home

PROS: 
- great location
- walking distance to restaurants, boutiques, convenience stores, etc
- unique decor
- delayed responses, but always responded

CONS:
- home sleeps four comfortably, not six [as advertised]
- basement does not have central heat/air [as advertised]
- basement tv does not work [as advertised]
- garage is not available to guests [as advertised]
- thermostat does not get to set temp [overworked or undersized unit]
- basement flooded w/3+ inches of raw sewage

WOULD I STAY AGAIN?  No, but that is because of Airbnb, not the host.  The host was easy to communicate with, and did their best to get Airbnb involved.

TIP: Book the home for the main two floors [that sleeps four], and pretend the basement does not exist

description.summary: European accents & a welcoming grand piano create this beautiful zen space to unwind after enjoying the sights. Hard to believe that steps away you`re in the heart of Logan Circle’s hustle and bustle! An amazing historic home from which to explore D.C.!
description.space:
Every room is uniquely different lovingly designed each one distinguished from the last by original artwork, color and textures. 

Located in a boutique traditional row home on a tree-lined street, this Parisian inspired space boasts two stories, 2 bedrooms, a comfortable office, a cozy basement escape (with a sofa bed), beautiful original hardwood floors, stunning artwork, and a great chef’s kitchen on its first floor.

We can comfortably sleep 6 guests. The sophisticated and luxurious master bedroom boasts a comfortable Californian king sized bed. There’s also a TV with cable included. Enjoy the charming loveseat - perfect for people watching and unwinding after exploring the city resting outside your door. Mirrored furniture gleams in the natural sunlight, and curtains are included for additional privacy. 

Enjoy sweet dreams in the second bedroom; rest your head in the Victorian style full sized bed, and wake up feeling like royalty. 

There is a functional office for those traveling on business. Guests will have access to a laptop friendly workspace, excellent wifi, an additional TV with full cable channels. 

Downstairs, guests will find another living / sleeping space in the cozy den area. The large "suite" boasts a smart TV with cable, sofa bed with an incorporated inflatable double mattress, a veritable library of reading material, exposed brick and beams, a full bathroom and washer/dryer. 

The full kitchen is ideal for those hoping to don their chef`s hat, but with dining options galore, chances are you may not even use it!  
Prepare dinner, or simply decompress after sight seeing beside the grand piano (players encouraged but please - no sticky fingers), or enjoy a true rarity in the city; Your very own spacious, private patio - perfect for enjoying morning coffee or an evening glass of wine, complete with furniture and fire pit.

The elegant dining room is an ideal communal space to enjoy meals, and eachother`s company. Modern light fixtures and original artwork surround the space creating a feast for the eyes. The space is perfect for savoring some local flavor or a home cooked meal, and is also condusive for brain storming sessions for those traveling on business, or just planning tomorrow`s activities!

No matter the season; our stately Parisian inspired home permits guests to enjoy the best of D.C., all year round. 

High-speed wifi, private parking, and a washer/dryer is also included for guests to use.
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire unit. It is not shared.
description.notes:
Please note - there are 4 TV`s;
- 1 in basement (full movie & news package)
- 1 in office (cable service) 
- 1 in kitchen (basic service)
- 1 in master bedroom (full movie & news package)

~ We want you to make the most of your stay, so we've partnered with DC’s longest-running city tour company Old Town Trolley Tours to help ensure an amazing visit, at the best rate possible! Sit back and relax as the finest, most highly-trained and knowledgeable guides take you through the city, to soak up the surrounding history. 

Feel free to give us a call to find out about the discounted rates we have secured; we can help answer any questions, and even book the tickets for you. (Ask us about the amazing Monuments By Moonlight tour, see DC at its best, lit up at night)!
description.neighborhood:
This timeless neighborhood is perfect for those to experience the city as a resident rather then a tourist - Logan Circle is undoubtedly the city`s best neighborhood for restaurants, bars, shops, and nightlife. The unit is directly off the Circle and is 1 block from the 14th street corridor: Whole Foods, Starbucks, CVS, and multiple bars/restaurants on every block. The city`s trendiest bars and restaurants have located along 14th Street and the U Street Corridor - both within easy walking distance - so it`s the perfect location for a nice dinner or to enjoy a night on the town. We include numerous recommendations in the house manual.

All of these amenities are only a short away, and so is the noise. This unit is located on a quiet residential street directly off Logan Circle.
description.transit:
Logan Circle is in the middle of all metro lines - access to the Red line, Orange/Blue/Silver, and Yellow/Green lines are located at 3 different stations all located within blocks of this unit, the closest being Shaw-Howard Metro Station. Dupont Circle metro is less then 20 minutes on foot from the home and offers some of the best restaurants and upscale retail locations in the city!
Several bus lines have stops located less than 1 block from the unit as well. Ubers are readily available (usually a 1-2 minute wait) and it costs around $6-10 or less to get anywhere in the city due to the convenient location.
description.interaction: We are always available for any questions or issues that may arise during your stay.
description.house_rules:
~ Strict NO party policy. Please note that smoking of any kind and drug use in or around the property is strictly prohibited (this includes outside spaces). If we do find evidence of illegal substances or marijuana use, the reservation will be automatically canceled with no refund. 
~ Strict NO pets policy. 
~ We insist that for group bookings renters are above the age of 25, unless agreed prior to making your reservation. (Families with children under 25 are very welcome). Due to fire code and insurance requirements the property has a maximum occupancy and additional guests must have our advance approval.
~ We may ask for additional proof of identity / address (passport / drivers license etc) and reason for stay such as work contracts or permits.
~ We may ask for an additional security deposit for larger groups or longer stays. 
~ Due to our tight cleaning schedules, charges apply for unannounced late check-outs. 
~ Exterior may be monitored by exterior cameras, there are no cameras indoors. 
~The neighborhood is a strong community and everyone looks out for each other, we ask that folks please be mindful of noise that could disturb in the early mornings and late at night. 
~ While luggage is expected, we strictly prohibit large items (including, but not limited to, bicycles and exercise equipment) being brought into the unit without prior approval.
~ If your booking spans 2 weeks or longer, we may require a “deep clean” following your check-out. 
~ Prior to you checking in, the property has been inspected to confirm there are no damages and everything is in working order.  If upon checking in, you discover something broken or not working, please let us know immediately.
~ Please be sure that ALL of the windows and doors are closed if the HVAC is running.
~ Please do NOT flush anything other than toilet paper down the toilets.

We thank you for your understanding!

name: Villamour: Riverside Garden Estate
title: Huntingtown, Maryland

hosts.about: Earthling

description.summary:
Inspired by the French villas of the Cote d'Azur, the property is located 40 miles from Washington D.C. in the beautiful rolling hills of Southern Maryland along the picturesque Patuxent river, and is our own slice of heaven on earth. The estate has been an ever-evolving work of love since 1977, and is now available for exclusive boutique family getaways. 

Swim in the heated pool year round. Bring your boat or jetski as we have a dock with shore power, and ramp access.
description.space: Architectural design, cathedral ceilings, and spectacular river views with unbelievable sunsets. Our kitchen is built to entertain with a Vulcan commercial range & a Sub Zero refrigerator, a dining room table with seating for 12. Enjoy the grotto, an indoor year-round heated pool with jacuzzi.
description.access: You will have full access to the property and exclusive use of the house minus our storage room. A caretaker will be available on the property at all times to help as needed.
description.notes: This house overlooks a rocky, steep cliff without guardrails. You and your guests must take precautions and are responsible for your own safety when staying at this location.
description.house_rules:
All guests must provide  their full name, legal address and age. 

Guests over the age of 18 must provide identification upon arrival, a copy of which will be taken and destroyed after a satisfactory inspection following the stay. 

We furthermore require each guest to sign an occupancy agreement on arrival, in order to explicitly acknowledge agreement of the rules and safe keeping of the property.

No shoes in the house.

Coasters must be placed beneath drinks placed on any woodwork.

hosts.about:
Hi, I’m Anthony 

I’m a fun and free-spirited entrepreneur and love meeting new people on my adventures. 

I have seen my fair share of hotels and Airbnb houses on my travels. As a host, I can’t wait to show fellow travelers the same great hospitality that I have had across the globe.

My property is conveniently located near all the essentials and less than 1/2 an hour away from the nation's capital. I'm easy to reach and always ready to answer your questions. I look forward to making your stay an unforgettable experience!

We had an amazing stay in the area over the winter break! And Jocelyn’s place was perfect for our needs - close to where our aging parents and extended family live in Gaithersburg and Rockville and very conveniently located walking distance to the Kentland shops - Whole Foods etc., The place was perfect for our needs as we had space for both of our families 1) parent and child in the downstairs apartment and 2) family of 4 and our nanny in the unit above. Both are very well connected and the layout of the house provided ample privacy yet plenty of space to hang out and catch up - play board games and have long simple meals over the holidays. Kids loved watching sports and movies in the living room and the grand piano was a fun festive addition. Jocelyn was an excellent host answering all of our questions about space and layout and being super responsive in addressing any minor issues that came up. We hope to come back for another extended stay when visiting family in the area.

We booked Jocelyn’s condo for my son and his groomsmen for a few days before his wedding. He and his groomsmen had a great time! Jocelyn’s place was clean and comfortable and spacious enough for everyone!

description.interaction: I am always be available to answer any inquiries my guests might have.
description.house_rules:
Additional rules
1. PARKING
You are designated 2 parking spaces in the house driveway. Additional parking may be arranged. Due to HOA strict rules and regulations, there are 2 restrictions on parking. 
1) The sidewalk cannot be blocked at anytime. 
2) The street in front of the house is not allowed at any time for parking. Otherwise, we will be fined $150 by the HOA, and we will charge you $150 for violation of HOA rules. Thank you in advance for your cooperation!  

2.
TRASH DAYS ARE MONDAYS & THURSDAYS.  
RECYCLING: FRIDAYS
Please put the trash in the trash bin and place it on the curbside by the tree in front of the house NO LATER THAN 7:00AM OR THE NIGHT BEFORE. 
****IMPORTANT! *****
  Please DO NOT  OVERFILL THE BIN so it can close completely. 
NO TRASH BAGS OUTSIDE THE TRASH BIN ARE ALLOWED BY THE HOA REGULATIONS. If you have an extra bag of trash that does not fit in the trash bin please leave it in THE SECOND TRASH BIN LOCATED ON THE DECK. Thank you for your cooperation!

3. PLEASE RESPECT QUIET TIME HOURS WHICH ARE FROM 9:00PM - 8:00AM. 
Disruption of quiet time hours may be a disturbance to other guests and neighbors in this family-friendly neighborhood.

4. Please be so kind as to NOT BRING UNAUTHORIZED GUESTS without notifying me beforehand. You may also register additional overnight guests at $10 per person. Every number of guest must be register in your reservation.

5. Before you check in everything should be in good shape. ANY DAMAGES that is FOUND must be reported WITHIN 1 HOUR of check in. 

6. If you wear tan lotion, I suggest bringing your own linen as any STAINED LINENS may incur EXTRA COST for you.


7. No parties or events allowed. 
. 

 IN THE CASE OF SIGNIFICANT AND GROSS VIOLATION OF HOUSE RULES, THE RESERVATION WILL BE IMMEDIATELY TERMINATED AND ALL FEES AND MONIES WILL BE FORFEITED. HOWEVER, I SINCERELY HOPE THAT THIS WILL NOT BE THE CASE AND I WILL DO MY BEST TO ACCOMMODATE YOU!

description.house_rules:
Hi! We can’t wait to be your hosts and hope you enjoy our property as much as we do. However, we do have to enforce some rules for the safety of our property. We love our neighbors and want to respect them, so we ask you to be respectful to our rules. Note: Guest booking must be 25+ years of age.
1.	All Pennsylvania Residents must communicate with the host BEFORE booking.
2.	The occupancy limit for this property is the same number of guests as your reservation at all times. Violation of this could lead to the immediate removal of all guests without refund. 
3.	No partied, no loud music, no boisterous behavior.
4.	Renters will respect and follow all rules as outlined in the House Rules section.
5.	Renters agree to not contact the host until they have read the Welcome Book. (Book can be found after arrival)
6.	Smoking is strictly prohibited and will result in an immediate $200/day penalty fee. ($200 for every day of the rental period)
7.	Unless previously agreed upon with host, there is a $50 late checkout fee for the first hour and a rate of $100/hr. for each hour thereafter.
8.	No pets allowed. $200 fine if rule is broken.
9.	If by your fault of breaking any house rules causes a scheduling conflict with other guests. You may be charged the amount owing to discount or refund, said guest.
10.	Repeated infractions of the house rules can result in dispatching of our security team for immediate eviction with no refund. This will result in a $500 penalty additional to any applicable fees.
11.	Booking your reservation is your confirmation that you have read and fully agree to the house rules.

hosts.about: Enjoy traveling and meeting new people! Looking forward to hosting you!

recent.comments: A great place to relax and spread out with a big group.

items.comments: A great place to relax and spread out with a big group.

This was the perfect place to celebrate my mom’s birthday. Not sure how it’s possible, but it is even more beautiful than the pictures. It’s in an incredibly scenic location, close to some hiking, wineries and breweries. The host was VERY helpful and responsive, answering all of my questions in a timely manner.  If you’re considering this, book it now! You will not regret it.

What a gem! The home and property are stunning, set in a beautiful, historic area. The home is well appointed and spacious which was perfect for our small family reunion. We loved the outdoor porch and firepit, and the kids enjoyed the outdoor swing and game room. Everyone enjoyed the interior movie room and spacious kitchen. All the beds were very comfortable and stylishly decorated. David is an incredible host who is clearly passionate about his property and ensuring guests enjoy all the amenities. We would be happy to return again!

We booked this home as the family of the groom for a wedding in the area. We could not have picked a more perfect place.

The house is enormous, pristine, and beautifully appointed, with ample room for guests to enjoy their privacy or time together in the numerous common areas, including a basement full of games and the largest home movie theater I've ever seen.

As beautiful as the house is on the inside, so are the views and grounds. On the same mountain, less than a mile away, there is a brewing company that is now possibly my favorite outdoor dining venue. The view to the east from there is breathtaking, attracting literally hundreds on any sunny day. Our home offered every bit as spectacular a view, but looking to the gorgeous valley and mountains to the west, and with the utmost of privacy. Almost too stunning to believe.

David is a kind and generous host who couldn't have been more helpful during our stay.

Book more days than you were planning if you can - you won't regret it!
Fantastic location!

My family gathered here to celebrate my mom's 70th birthday and it was absolutely perfect. It is a beautiful home - spacious, well laid out, meticulously maintained - with SO much to do in the home and around the property. 

There was something for everyone...a huge rope swing which was endlessly entertaining for the kids (plus foosball and ping pong indoors) and a fire pit with Adirondack chairs for the adults. The indoor movie theater was a hit for the entire crew. There is also a nice easy hiking trail on the property as well as a public trail just up the road which offers incredible views. Middleburg, VA is about 30 mins away and has lots of shops/restaurants and a great brewery (Lost Barrel) with tons of outdoor space - great for a day trip. 

The host, David, was such a pleasure to work with - very responsive, extremely knowledgable about the area, and immediately available for any questions that came up during our stay.

Our stay was amazing and we loved the beautiful home.  Lots of space and amenities.  We especially loved the media center to watch movies, etc. and just relax.  David is an awesome host and I rate him 5 stars across the board.

description.summary: Experience the BEST of Virginia at Mont Salvat! This privately owned homestead is soon to be your treasured memory. The estate sits atop the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of Northern Virginia. Picturesque landscape will surround you the minute you set eyes on the property.  The 10,000 sq ft house features 7 bedrooms, 6 full and 2 half bathrooms, grand dining room, amazing theater, game room, and even its own banquet hall!
description.space:
The outdoor space boasts sweeping westward views of the Shenandoah Valley. Sunsets are perfectly watched perched on the beautiful wrap around porch, from the hot tub, or one of the many natural rock gardens tucked within the landscape.

As if that isn’t enough, you can hike over acres of privately owned meadow and mountainside featuring rumbling creeks, natural springs, and gorgeous valley views. Walking along the revolutionary era stone walls will take you back in time. 

Evenings can be spent relaxing at one of the many local vineyards, breweries, or restaurants the area proudly hosts. Or, you can show off your gourmet cooking skills in the gourmet kitchen equipped with top-of-the-line appliances.

Mont Salvat is close to all that Northern Virginia and DC has to offer, with all the relaxation and beauty that a mountainside retreat provides. This homestead will fill your soul and bring joy to whatever your special occasion may be.

Perfect for family reunions, bridal groups, small group retreats, weekend getaways, company trainings and much more. The 1,000 sq ft Banquet Hall for special dinners (additional charge applies) is connected to the house, off of the kitchen area. 

The use of the property is available for registered guests. Parties and events are not allowed. We are not set up for events involving people that are not staying at the property. 

This is an active homestead.  The reservation is for the house, and the yard area around the house. Guests have access to walking trails on the property. There will be other homestead activity on the property by the owner, including use of the barn, which is a full time workshop. 

Mont Salvat is a place for peaceful getaways and respectful celebrations. It is not a place for parties, including excessive drinking and loud noise/music. All outdoor activity and conversation must be finished by 11 PM.

Master Bedroom suite - king, upper level, living area, mini bar, and a massive full bathroom with his and her toilets

Bedroom # 2 - queen, upper level, with full bathroom

Bedroom # 3 - queen, upper level, with full bathroom

Bedroom # 4 - queen, upper level, with full bathroom

Bedroom # 5- queen, main level, with full bathroom

Bedroom # 6 - two doubles, upper level

Bedroom # 7 - bunk room with two bunk beds (two twins and two doubles), lower level, with full bathroom


Fully stocked kitchen is perfect for preparing meals during your stay. Top of line appliances include a huge pro refrigerator, three Wolf brand ovens. There are many small appliances including coffee maker, separate ice-maker, bread machine, instant pot, slow cooker, food processor, rice maker etc.  There is also an outdoor Weber grill. 

High speed WiFi. 

The Smart TV in the game room can be connected to your streaming app subscriptions and your devices; the Smart TV also has an internet browser and LG Channels. The projector in the Theatre has a Roku device that can be connected to your streaming app subscriptions, a selection of DVDs, and an HDMI cable to connect to your devices. There is no cable TV. 

Security cameras located on outside doors.

HOUSE RULES AND EXPECTATIONS 

- Only registered guests are allowed on the property. Any additional guests must be pre-approved by the host, and will add the additional guest charge. No  other visitors without pre-approval.

- This home is a place for peaceful getaways and respectful celebrations. It is not a place for parties, including excessive drinking and loud noise/music.

- All outdoor activity and conversation must be finished by 11 PM. 

- There can be no outdoor music. Music cannot be heard outside of the house. 

- Check-in after 4:00PM
- Check-out before 11:00AM

- Must remove shoes upon entry. Shoes CANNOT be worn in the home. (Exception - indoor shoes may be worn for medical reasons)

- Furniture cannot be moved around. All indoor furniture must remain indoors. No additional furniture or equipment (tables, chairs, tents, etc) can be brought to the property. 

- The grand piano is for experienced players.

- No smoking of any kind (including vaping) in the house.

- No fires inside, bonfire only in the fire pit outside.

- No pets.

- There are beautiful cherry hardwood flooring, please do not drag anything across the floors.

- Please do not walk on the stone walls or stone columns.

- Please do not enter the barn, or closets that are locked.

- This property is located in a protected nature area, so you will get to enjoy lots of wildlife. Please stay on the paths and walking areas to avoid any disruptions.

- Area is not child-proof (cabinets, shelves, electronics, decorations, etc), and is designed for adults and children age 6 and older. Please monitor small children.

- Security cameras are mounted on outside entrances.

I would be happy to host you if you feel that your group can fit within these parameters.

name: Large Home Pocono/Jim Thorpe Retreat
title: Lehighton, Pennsylvania

gallery.caption: A photo of the pool and patio from our second floor window.  The plants and chairs vary in size and style from time to time.
More pool area featuring the pool lighting.  This makes all the work it takes to maintain it, worth it.
Kitchen area including large island, sink, new LP gas stove.
The Juke box.  A great classic regardless of the music loaded in it

The bar and night club (no alcohol is included in your stay)  120" projection screen, bring your laptop for streaming.  We have Cable, Netflix, Amazon Prime. Guest will be charged for any fees incurred for non-Prime options + a 25%  service fee.

This is the lounge area opposite of the bar and near the fireplace. It easily converts to a pull out sofa or one or multiple air mattresses. This space is also great to relax near the nightclub and bar.  This sectional will make you not want to leave
The pull out sofa in the lounge area.  The air mattresses are more comfortable but this is an option for you.

The fire pit is outside of the fence from the pool area.  Some stays include the fire wood and others we sell it by the bundle or bring your own.  Please ask about the rules for fires and the fire pit area.
First floor bathroom off kitchen hallway.  Newly remodeled in 2020.  All bathrooms include a minimum of shower, sink and toilet

We have two cats in the house.  They are both very friendly or will stay away.  Keep all outside doors and bedroom doors closed at all times.  Cats are curious and they are never allowed outdoors or in the guest bedrooms.
Our newly remodeled living room.  Fresh, clean and bright.  50" LED Smart TV, the aquarium for tranquility and indirect LED lighting and comfortable seating.
Its a large kitchen and this is the view from a different end of the kitchen.  Its not the smallest room in the house!
Christmas Bliss.  Fully decked for the season.
