description.summary: My partner and I live in this large expansive house and we stay during guests visits.  This is like original BNB but we don’t provide breakfast. Please read the description carefully and ask questions.  This is a well decorated home with the hosts personal belongings. The home has places to find peace and quiet or active and upbeat.  We want your stay to be a great time and while complying with house rules and respecting our neighborhood
description.space:
You are welcomed to use the entire property except for hosts marked private rooms.  Outdoors includes a full list amenities. Full access except for tenants property and tenants parking area. This is like a normal BNB.    We do not leave while guests come to visit.  We maintain the property and assist guests with less obvious amenities.  All guests must be included in the reservation.  Parents are required to supervise children at all times.

We follow strict Airbnb enhanced cleaning and safe social distancing.  We have both been fully vaccinated for COVID-19.  We expect the that all guests are careful and have been fully vaccinated and/or have not been in contact with anyone positive for COVID-19 or showing any signs or symptoms of cold, flu or COVID-19.  Please disclose this in your inquiry.
description.access: All areas of the home and property except private owners bedroom and bath, storage and utility rooms.
description.notes: Our listing is available all year round however, the pool is open seasonally from early May to mid/late September.   The hot tub is open year round. Please inquire when making a reservation close to these dates are available.  When making a request, guests must account for all guests in their group.  Unreported guests will not be allowed access or entire group may be asked to leave.
description.neighborhood: A pleasant and quiet county view. Nearby find all kinds of recreational attractions including white water rafting, kayaking, canoeing, hiking, biking, trails, train rides, the well known town of Jim Thorpe. Winter sports such as skiing, tubing, snow mobiling, hiking, and more. The Appalachian trail is a short 7-8 minute ride to its access point.
description.transit: Uber and Lyft have a small presence here, including the owner is an Uber drivers part time.  Cabs are available at times. Use of your own car is simple as most attractions do have parking. Biking and walking are both possible.
description.interaction: Owners lives in this expansive home. Although owners may not be present during certain parts of your stay they are available by text, calls or in person.
description.house_rules:
Kitchen and Bathrooms:
Guests are expected to clean up after themselves. Disposable plates and utensils are available. Guests shall hand wash their dishes, pots and pans or use dishwasher.  Note:  Some glasses and mugs are not dishwasher safe. Anything with a painted print, sculpting, acrylic or plastic drinking cups should be hand washed.   If you have questions of how to clean something we provide, please ask.  

Pots, pans, bakeware, utensils, grilling accessories, dishes, bowls, silverware and many other implements are provided by the hosts.  If you question if we have something you need, please ask in advance,

Hosts provide towels and wash cloths for personal hygiene.   Guests are responsible for bringing their own pool towels.

Our home depends on a well for water and septic system. for sewage.  Water resources are valuable, please refrain from running excess water inside or out when not necessary.  Do not dispose of any female sanitary products, condoms or other wipes, towelettes, etc... except for toilet paper in moderate amounts.  Likewise, used toilet paper shall be flushed and not placed in waste baskets. 

Doors and Windows:
Please keep bedroom doors closed.  Keep all doors to the outside and any windows without screens closed at all times.  We live in a wooded area and insects are very prevalent in the summer months.  In order to prevent biting or potentially infected insects, we do all we can to prevent insects from entering the house.  Please help us with that effort. 

Guests are responsible to supply their own pool towels, sun protection and personal bug repellant products.  The hosts will spray the perimeter of the patio area with an insect repellant prior to arrival.  Host also provides Beetle bags to reduce the number of beetles around guests and in the pool water.  Other products are used to control ants, mosquitos, flies and vermin.  

Outdoor quiet times are 1030 pm to 730 am on weeknights Sunday through but guests are always expected to be respectful to our neighbors by managing the noise of their group.  Guests may stay outdoors after quiet time but music must be turned off and voices shall be maintained at a talking level. In the event you lose track of time, we will advise you if the noise level is excessive at any time.  Indoor quiet times range from 2 am through 6 am.  

Outdoor rules are provided on site and include quiet times, absolutely no glass on or near the pool patio.  
 
No food or trash is to left or stored outdoors. This will attract wildlife and vermin with potential of ruining your visit. Proper receptacles are provided.  Ask hosts for more details.  We encourage and allow outdoor cooking and eating, but just clean up shortly thereafter and enjoy a clean property. 

Guests shall not harm any wildlife, damage any natural resources, or plant life.  The vegetable garden is private to the host only.  

Smoking is permitted outdoors only, HOWEVER, cigarette butts and any other residual waste from smoking products left in plant containers, mulch, grass, driveways and walkways, or anywhere other than a designated receptacle is and will be considered damage to the property and will be charged against the guest’s security deposit.  This also pertains to any other trash such as wrappers, cans, bottle caps, tabs, food items like bones, rinds, corn cobbs, etc... .  As a guest of our property, you are responsible for sharing this information with all of your guests and ensuring it is strictly adhered to.  We spend countless hours cleaning, preparing and maintaining our property so that you can enjoy it.  It is part of your responsibility as a guest to leave the property as you found it. 

Off street parking is available in a large driveway and overflow area. Please do not park on the lawn unless you are instructed to do so by the host. Please do not block any garage doors or main driveway.

Bedrooms:  As stated in the description of our property, we have two very friendly or timid cats in the house.  Our cats are like our children.  For the most part, our cats remain in our bedroom, but they are allowed out around the house for exercise and activity.  We do not allow cats or animals in the bedrooms to ensure any future guests with allergies or sensitivities to pet dander will not suffer.  Please keep your bedroom doors closed at all times to help us maintain this policy.  

Trash:  All trash shall be bagged indoor and outdoors and placed in the appropriate dumpster in the garage.  Our township does not provide recycling services bottles and cans may be placed in the trash.  Cardboard and paper may be set aside for use in the firepit.

name: Two Adjacent Historic Homes Designer’s Dream
title: Columbia, Pennsylvania

gallery.caption: Distillery House - Step into the perfect blend of modern and historic in our newly renovated kitchen!  Featuring a spacious oversized island this kitchen is the ideal space to prep, cook, and gather with loved ones!

Distillery House - Relax in our 2 story sunroom, overlooking the serene spring. With comfortable seating, a wood stove, and tons of natural sunlight, this space is perfect for unwinding. Come bask in the tranquility and beauty of this peaceful oasis.

Distillery House - Experience the enchanting allure of the property at dusk.  With its beautifully lit front porch and warm glowing interior, this historic gem exudes charm and invites you to step inside and savor its unique character and ambiance.

Distillery House - Enjoy yhe rustic charm of the upstairs living room, complete with reclaimed barnwood walls, exposed ceiling beams, and a game table for endless entertainment.  Take in the picturesque window view of our tranquil spring-fed pond.

Distillery House - Step into the ultimate sanctuary of our stunning sunroom, where vintage charm meets modern comfort!  Featuring a show-stopping wall of windows, a vintage leather Chesterfield sofa for lounging, and a cozy wood-burning stove.
Distillery House - Enjoy some R&R in the 3rd bedroom, featuring a king size bed from Crate & Barrel, the same stunning exposed ceiling beams and stone walls that you find throughout.

Distillery House - Lush greenery and ostrich ferns frame the front porch in the warmer months, creating a tranquil and inviting oasis. Come and immerse yourself in the natural beauty and cozy charm of this idyllic retreat.

Distillery House - The stunning and moody first floor primary suite. Featuring a majestic Restoration Hardware king size canopy bed, an exquisite painted tapestry, and a designer chandelier, this room exudes sophistication and style.
Distillery House - The twin guest room upstairs with a cozy Anthropologie rug and a picturesque window that overlooks the sunroom below.  Here you can unwind in style and comfort!

Distillery House - Cozy corner alert!  This seating area in the kitchen will make you wonder why all kitchens don't have this setup.  The huge wood cabinet is stocked with plenty of entertaining essentials.
Distillery House - Workout in style!  Guests enjoy access to our Peloton Bike+ located in the living room.  Just BYO shoes and login info to get your sweat on!
Distillery House - Feast in style in the dining area - with a massive Restoration Hardware dining table that seats up to 10, you can enjoy your meals in a truly unique and unforgettable setting.
Distillery House - Primary suite bathroom view with a brand new shower.

Distillery House - Experience the stylish primary suite bathroom.  Boasting a gallery wall of original paintings and opulent grasscloth wallpaper, every detail has been meticulously curated to provide a beautiful experience.

Distillery House - Start your day off right with a fresh cup of coffee from our charming Butler's pantry, complete with a bar sink and professionally styled floating shelves. This room is absolutely charming!

~General Store~
Escape to the luxurious primary suite with dark moody walls and a luxe leather king size bed.  Enjoy the custom painting by artist Lauren Rose Jackson.

Distillery House - Historic charm meets modern in our stunning kitchen with rare American Chestnut floors, exposed beams, pendant lighting, leather barstools, high end countertops, and stone walls.  Cook in style and create unforgettable memories!

Distillery House - The 2nd floor bathroom has stylish touches like wildflower wallpaper and gold accents.  Every detail has been carefully selected to create an inviting and functional space.  The stunning quartzite countertop is a personal favorite!

Distillery House - You'll love the cozy charm of this upstairs guest room, featuring two antique twin beds, exposed ceiling beams, and an abundance of character.  It has a convenient workstation / desk area for today's work from anywhere lifestyle!

Distillery House - Unwind and relax on this chaise lounge in this corner of the sunroom - a guest favorite!  Enjoy the tranquil sound of the artesian spring just outside the windows and get lost in a good book or peaceful daydream.

Distillery House - Relax on our cozy front porch and enjoy the blooming landscape that changes through the seasons.  It's the perfect spot for morning coffee or evening drinks. In spring and summer, the majestic ostrich ferns are a sight to behold!
View of the Distillery House from the side yard near the pond.
View of the back patio with the adjacent artesian spring.  Watch the many varieties of birds that frequent the surrounding trees!
Distillery House - Twinkling lights and serene vibes - a magical evening awaits on the patio or in the sunroom!
Distillery House - Sleep tight and wake up refreshed!  We take your comfort seriously, with hand-picked linens and mattresses to ensure a perfect night's sleep.  Rest easy and enjoy your stay!

Distillery House - Unwind in our spacious upstairs living room, complete with Pottery Barn sofas (one a Queen sleeper) and a huge 70" tv.  Perfect for movie nights and family game time, this room offers plenty of space to spread out and relax.

~Distillery House~
In the butler's pantry - coffee station and curated shelves that were custom made from local wood.

General Store - Welcome to your own oasis in Lancaster County, where beauty blooms every spring!  Enjoy the stunning perennial flowers that burst with color and immerse yourself in the tranquility of nature.

~General Store~
You won't run out of firewood, because we provide plenty of it for guests to use!
Distillery House - Every detail is a treasure.  The owner has personally sourced many antique and vintage local treasures including the items you find in this professionally styled coffee table.
Distillery House - This floor length Anthropologie mirror in the primary suite is the perfect solution for admiring your outfit from head to toe!

~General Store~
Charming work from home desk in one of the guest rooms.
Distillery House - Take in the tranquility of the spring-fed pond on our property, that is cold enough for trout to thrive.  Keep an eye out as we continue to add more of them!

hosts.about: Follow us on Insta @perennialstays

recent.comments:
2 gorgeous homes with wonderful character and amenities. I really appreciated that it was so well supplied. 
Leigh was a consummate, and incredibly responsive host. The houses are beautifully and comfortably designed and there are gorgeous outdoor spaces to enjoy. It was perfect for our family to stay for a wedding weekend.  The beds are very comfortable … my sister in law thought it was one of the most comfortable beds she’d ever slept on. I had a slight concern that the shower was really slippery , and Leigh immediately  sent over a  mat. She’s a great, thoughtful and responsive host… really like staying at a lovely bed and breakfast. It’s not an inexpensive place to stay but most definitely worth it. Just lovely  —-and we’d definitely stay again.  I’ve stayed at many airbnbs and this rates up at the top.

Leigh was a consummate, and incredibly responsive host. The houses are beautifully and comfortably designed and there are gorgeous outdoor spaces to enjoy. It’s not an inexpensive place to stay but most definitely worth it. Just lovely  —-and we’d definitely stay again.  I’ve stayed at many airbnbs and this rates up at the top.

We had an incredible stay at these meticulously renovated historic stone houses! The grounds were picturesque, with beautiful gardens. The attention to detail was unparalleled, with vintage decor and quality furnishings. The bedrooms were dreamy, with foam mattresses and premium linens. The convenient location put us close to family and our reunion. The houses were beautifully appointed with artwork, appliances, and even local snacks. We felt like we were in an oasis tailored to our needs. The gardens were loved by our gardening enthusiast family members. Overall, a relaxing and unforgettable experience. Highly recommended!

The General Store and Distillery houses were even better than we could have imagined! We felt like we were staying in a Restoration Hardware magazine. The house had every amenity we could need and was decorated to perfection. The location was perfect for us and just a short drive from many nearby attractions. We would recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in the area!

We loved our stay. The General Store and Distillery are unique and wonderful. Unfortunately, it rained during our stay, but that meant we got to spend even more time exploring and enjoying the grounds. What a perfect blend of modern amenities on a unique historical site!

Leigh was an amazing host! The property was amazing and the houses were beautiful! We had a couple issues using the keypad to unlock the door to the house. BUT Leigh was so quick with responding and trouble shooting to get us in!

Beautiful property in a lovely, quiet area. We had an excellent stay at the adjacent stone houses. The homes are absolutely gorgeous, with a lot of historic character and details throughout, lovely decor, as well as all the amenities you could want for a very comfortable and relaxing stay.  Everything was very clean, great kitchens, beds were comfortable, and dens cozy. The yard and landscaping is lovely, with beautiful trees, greenery and lush ferns. We enjoyed the sunshine and bird watching outside.
Leigh was an excellent host with great communication, provided informative guide books with restaurant recommendations and notes to enjoy the area. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone! :)

This property is remarkable; the  historic buildings are lovingly preserved, but all the travel necessities (hot showers with good water pressure, modern bathrooms, comfortable mattresses, easy WiFi) are readily available.   Ample  bathrooms, nice tile, marble countertops. The properties are genuinely beautiful and so nicely decorated. Each house has a coffee area and the kitchens were well stocked with good equipment. Everything was clean and in good condition.  The distillery building has a first floor master suite type bedroom and bathroom.  The grounds  are beautiful with ferns, hostas, shad trees, outdoor furniture and a pond.  I've lived in Arizona a long time but never stopped missing Pennsylvania; my family and I just loved our time here.  It's as nice as the photos.

description.summary:
These meticulously renovated historic stone houses are nestled on a picturesque 2.5-acre property. With over 4500 sq ft combined, the homes exude captivating character and boast professional interior design. 

Only 15 minutes from downtown Lancaster, this will be your perfect base to explore all the area's attractions. Accessibility from major cities, such as Baltimore, Philadelphia, DC, and NYC this is the perfect weekend getaway.  

Follow us on social media @perennialstays for more details.
description.space:
Experience the convenience of having two full houses at your disposal, allowing your group to spread out and enjoy ample space. The homes have been thoughtfully renovated to create an oasis tailored to your needs. One house operated as a distillery in its heyday, while the other served as a charming general store. Immerse yourself in a curated blend of vintage and antique decor, complemented by quality furnishings sourced from Restoration Hardware, Crate and Barrel, and more. Every detail has been meticulously considered, as no expense was spared in furnishing these homes to perfection. Art and antique enthusiasts will be delighted by the original paintings and captivating works of art adorning the walls. Each bedroom boasts a guest favorite foam mattress and premium linens, ensuring a restful night's sleep. 

Both homes are heated and cooled by an energy-efficient geothermal system, minimizing our environmental impact while keeping you comfortable. The water comes from an artesian spring flowing to a tranquil pond on the property.

In spring and summer, enjoy the beauty of mature walnut, cherry, oak, and locust trees. Spot deer, turkeys, hummingbirds, owls, and more. Admire stunning perennial flower beds with lilies, daisies, peonies, and more.

The Distillery House - sleeps 8; 3 bedrooms / 2 baths.  Has a nice open floor plan with tall ceilings and plenty of gathering spaces. 
- Kitchen and Dining Room – Newly renovated and spacious, there’s a huge Restoration Hardware dining table that seats 10.  Huge island with counter seating, quartzite counters, and design details that perfectly complement the historic stone walls. The kitchen is fully stocked for all your cooking needs.  
- Primary Bedroom and Bathroom - King size Restoration Hardware canopy bed with a designer chandelier, antique dresser, smart TV, and a lovely view of the spring. The walls are made of the barn wood from the original tobacco barn on the property! Adjacent is the newly renovated fresh and modern primary bathroom.
- Second Floor Living Room – Spacious with cathedral ceilings, perfect for congregating for games or falling asleep watching a movie. Pottery Barn sleeper sofa and a 70” flat screen TV with Roku. There’s a 4-person dining table for playing games or catching up on homework. This is also where we have a Peloton Bike+ available for guests. Don’t forget to bring your own cycling shoes!
- Guest Room 1 – King size Crate and Barrel bed in this cozy and stylish guest room.
Guest Room 2 – Two antique twin beds for the kids or solo travelers. There’s also a desk / workspace.
Sunroom - The stunning two story sunroom has a woodburning stove so you can entertain next to the cozy fire. Relax on the daybed to your favorite tv show. FYI - the sunroom is not currently climate controlled.

The General Store House - sleeps 6; 3 bedrooms / 3 baths.  
Living Room – This stunning room greets guests just off the foyer. Baby grand player piano with crystal chandelier, modern lighting, brick fireplace with wood stove, beautiful decor.
- Kitchen – Newly renovated and spacious with design details that perfectly complement the historic stone walls. The kitchen is fully stocked for all your cooking needs. Enjoy your morning coffee in the comfortable arm chairs flanking the antique storage cabinet.
- Dining Room - The dining room has a stunning crystal chandelier from Arhaus. Just off the dining room is a butler's pantry with tons of storage, a bar cabinet, and also a brand new full bathroom with laundry.
- Primary Bedroom and Bathroom - Up the back staircase is a private wing with the primary suite. King size leather bed, Roku tv, beautiful brand new en suite bathroom with carrera marble tile.
- Guest Rooms 1 and 2 – Up the main staircase you will find two additional guest rooms. Each has a king size bed and a desk workspace.

Wifi & Speakers- Each house has Wifi and we have added an Eero mesh network that is connected to Comcast high speed internet plus Sonos speakers.

Famous past owners and residents of the property include:

* Capt. Jacob Krug, co-founder and first treasurer of Franklin College (now Franklin & Marshall College)
* Abraham Hershey Herr, great-grandson of Hans Herr, the first Mennonite Bishop to emigrate to America
* Samuel J. Atlee Jr., son of Col. Samuel J. Atlee (Revolutionary War hero who served on the Continental Congress), and grandson of Lady Jane Alcock (lady-in-waiting to King George II's wife)
* John Miller, High Sheriff of Lancaster County (1785-1787) and Chief Burgess of Lancaster Borough (1799, 1805)
* Lt. Col. Jacob Shirk Strickler, member of the State Assembly (1797-1800), appointed commissioner to move the state capital from Philadelphia to Lancaster in 1799.
description.access: Guests will have exclusive access to both homes, providing ample space and privacy for their stay. Please note that the spring house and garage are not accessible to guests. However, the two main houses offer a wealth of amenities and comfortable living spaces for your enjoyment.
description.notes:
A rental contract is required for every booking and will be sent to guests within the 48-hour zero penalty cancellation period.

Please be aware that the historic General Store has a back staircase with uneven stairs, which may not be suitable for guests with mobility issues. We recommend guests with such considerations to take note of this before booking.

COVID-19 Update: The safety and well-being of our guests are our top priorities. Prior to check-in, we kindly request that all guests answer screening questions regarding COVID-19 exposure or symptoms.

Pet Policy: We welcome well-behaved dogs! We recommend ensuring your dog is up to date on flea/tick medication prior to their stay. To maintain cleanliness, we kindly ask that all dogs remain off the furniture at all times, even those that are considered "non-shedding." When left alone in the house, we request that you crate your pet. If you plan to bring your pet, please inform us at the time of booking. A pet fee of $100 per pet per stay will apply.

Although the property is conveniently located near various amenities, it is also nestled in Lancaster County's renowned farms and fields. Please be aware that you may encounter some wildlife, such as ladybugs, stinkbugs, deer, turkeys, bees, wasps, frogs, moths, ticks, spiders, bats, snakes, etc., during your stay. Our dedicated housekeepers and pest control service work diligently to maintain cleanliness and tidiness. However, as the property is centuries old and situated in the countryside, the occasional encounter with wildlife or the scent of nearby farms is possible.
description.neighborhood: Nestled in a rural setting, this property is surrounded by neighboring farms. Explore the historic rivertown of Columbia, PA, known for its timeless architectural styles and rich history. Enjoy direct access to trails, waterways, and river life, uncovering the secrets of our nation's early days. Discover tales of civil war bridge burnings and the birthplace of false-bottom railcars utilized in the Underground Railroad. Immerse yourself in the heritage of our nation's birth while experiencing the tranquility of this picturesque location.
description.transit: Ample parking is available on the expanded driveway for your convenience. Please note that having a car is essential for exploring Lancaster County and its surrounding areas. With your own vehicle, you'll have the freedom to discover the region's charming attractions, picturesque landscapes, and delightful hidden gems.
description.interaction: We are readily available via phone or messaging to assist with any of your needs during your stay. Whether you have questions, require recommendations, or encounter any issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. We are committed to ensuring that your experience is comfortable and enjoyable.
description.house_rules:
AGE 25 OR OLDER TO BOOK: The guest booking the property must be 25 years of age or older. The guest who books must stay at the property--you may not book for others if you do not intend to stay at the property.

PETS: - As pet lovers ourselves, we welcome canine guests with responsible owners with advance permission. Dogs must be housebroken, well-behaved, and pest-free. A flat $100 pet fee will be assessed for each pet per stay.

WOOD STOVES: You are encouraged to use the wood stoves as long as you do so carefully. The stove can get very hot, so be sure to keep small children away whenever a fire is burning. Do not use the stove during windy or dry conditions. You MUST use the provided fireplace screen or keep the doors shut while the stove is in use.

FURNITURE - Do not move the furniture, as this increases the likelihood of damaging something. Loss of any items or damage to furnishings will result in additional charges and/or loss of your security deposit.

PELOTON BIKE+:  Children under the age of 14 are not permitted to use the Peloton Bike+.  All others use the bike at their own risk.

BUGS: This is a house in the farmland of Pennsylvania - that means there are lots of bugs, especially in the summertime. Even if you are careful some of those bugs will find their way into the house. The best way to minimize the number of bugs inside is to keep doors and windows closed at all times.

SMOKING: Smoking is never allowed inside the house. You may smoke outside as long as you clean up after yourself. You may not litter cigarette butts on the deck, in the yard, or anywhere else--butts must go in the trash after they have cooled off.

ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES - Consumption of alcoholic beverages is limited to persons of legal age. Illegal drug use is strictly prohibited and will result in termination of the rental agreement, and dismissal of the guest without refund.

PARKING: Do not park or drive on the grass at any time because it could damage the lawn and / or the septic fields. The garage is not available to guests and will be locked during your stay.

SEPTIC SYSTEM: This property has a septic system. Grease and oil must never be allowed down any of the sink drains. Feminine hygiene products must be thrown away in a trash can and not flushed down a toilet. Never flush solid trash down the toilet or into a sink drain.

INCLEMENT WEATHER: During the winter, four wheel drive vehicles are recommended in the event of a snow storm. Guests should use their own judgement as to whether to cancel a trip before it begins or leave the house early.

NO FIREWORKS OR FIREARMS: Fireworks, and discharging of firearms, are not permitted anywhere on our property.

NO CANDLES - Use of candles is strictly prohibited.

ELECTRONICS - Guests are not permitted to alter the wiring of any electronic equipment including the security cameras and TVs.

INSPECTIONS - Homeowner reserves the right to enter property to investigate disturbances, check occupancy, check damages, and make repairs as necessary. Homeowner will attempt to notify guest when service/repair entry is to take place.

DAMAGES - Guests are solely responsible for any property damage, lost items, accident, or injury to any person or loss sustained by any person arising out of or in any way related to guest use of the premises, amenities, or equipment located on premises. Guest agrees to release, indemnify, and hold harmless the homeowner from and against all liability for injury to the Guest, and to any member of their party, resulting from any cause whatsoever.

hosts.about: Intimate Portrait Artist, Author, and Instructor.  I travel quite a bit for on location shoots, speaking engagements, and book tours.  I look sometimes for quaint quiet places to write and create on my own, and also for larger venues that I can host retreats at for my students.  I love meeting new people, and assume if you are inviting strangers into your home you do as well.  My non profit the Elysian Sanctuary also hosts 5 properties currently, and your stay at any one of them contributes to residencies for artists, writers, musicians, and other creatives.

recent.comments: We had a great visit at the Farmhouse in Kennett Square.  It is a short car ride to the town where there are restaurants and shops, and also a short ride to many of the sights.  Barbara, who lives on the property, is an excellent host and made us feel welcome and comfortable.  The property is gorgeous, with a pond and a waterfall, as well as a short hiking path.  It was lovely to sit outside and read overlooking the pond.  We hope to visit again soon.

items.comments: We had a great visit at the Farmhouse in Kennett Square.  It is a short car ride to the town where there are restaurants and shops, and also a short ride to many of the sights.  Barbara, who lives on the property, is an excellent host and made us feel welcome and comfortable.  The property is gorgeous, with a pond and a waterfall, as well as a short hiking path.  It was lovely to sit outside and read overlooking the pond.  We hope to visit again soon.

Heel vriendelijk onthaal, zeer rustige locatie en prachtige tuin om in te wandelen. Wij waren er met een groep van 4 voor een conferentie in de buurt, helaas konden we niet veel tijd in de airBNB zelf doorbrengen aangezien de omgeving geweldig was om tot rust te komen.

What a find! Friends and I stayed at this beautiful, historic, updated home touring the local area Estates and Gardens. It was perfect for our needs.  Our hostess was warm and welcoming. She was very knowledgeable about local events and attractions and very conscious about giving us our ‘space’.  Because we couldn’t get to see everything we wanted, we hope to return to the area, and we would definitely consider staying here again.

We love Barbara and her kindness and patience towards our grandsons.  She makes us feel at home.  This is our second stay and we will be returning again.  The sereneness of the home and surroundings alone is worth the stay.  We're looking forward to our next visit.

We had a great experience and only wished we could have spent more time at the home. 
The property was so well maintained and looking back at some of our pictures they look like they could be used as a postcard.

This was the perfect place for our 3 day stay. Barbara was extremely accommodating, helpful & friendly. She went above & beyond with recommendations & getting us in to see beautiful local gardens. The Farmhouse was clean & welcoming. We enjoyed our afternoons on the outside deck. I would highly recommend staying here.

Fantastic stay, and such a unique and beautiful space! Hidden away in the country side, the mill was filled with unique and intricate decorations that made us feel right at home. The energy there is amazing! If you’re looking for a unique stay where you’ll leave feeling refreshed and relaxed, this is the place for you.

description.summary:
The Farmhouse Retreat & Wellness Center
is an intimate, temporary haven-a safe space to heal, recharge and to help both pets & people.
We are here to serve the need we all have, individually and collectively, for an oasis of peace, calm & creativity, for reflection, restoration, & rejuvenation. 
 
Access to Longwood Gardens,  your own private waterfall natural pool, acres of walking trails, lovely gardens, and rustic decor. Your stay contributes to Elysian Sanctuary Non Profit Artist Programs.
description.space:
There are 2 available bedrooms downstairs, one with a full bed, and one with a pair of twin beds.  Upstairs in the loft, there are 3 additional twins available.  

The farmhouse is a 300-year-old mill that sits against its own private pond and waterfall and has beautiful trails for wandering and reconnecting with nature.  The main floor is an open floor plan with an enormous dining room table, lots of cozy sitting areas, a functioning fireplace, piano, books, board games, and more.  The kitchen is charming and has a separate table, as well as an outdoor picnic table on the deck.  There is a bathroom in the main hall of the bedrooms, and another half bath on the main floor.  The gardens are extensive and welcome both pollinators and people.

We do have friendly rescue animals that roam the main parts of the house but are kept out of the guest rooms at all times.   They welcome your pets to come visit.
description.access:
There is parking in the driveway available,  when you arrive you'll climb the stairs up to the back deck, take in the lovely pond, ducks, geese and egrets, and then come through the sliding doors.  

Guests have access to all the public areas in the home, the dining, kitchen, sitting areas, decks, grounds, the little library under the stairs.  

The founder of the Farmhouse, Barbara is available at all times for any needs or questions, Anouk the cat is a brilliant conversationalist, while Cash, the rescue dog is rather introverted and keeps to himself most of the time.
description.notes:
The Farmhouse Founder, Barbara is available and on site during your stay.   We do allow people to bring their pets, and do have both a rescue dog and cat on the property, though they are not allowed in guest rooms.  

We are open to special requests and helping plan for special occasions.   

This property is part of the Elysian Sanctuary initiative, and parts of your stay contribute to retreats and residencies for artists and creatives.
description.interaction:
We are available for anything the guests need.  We're very friendly and are happy to tour you around, chat, and socialize if that suits, otherwise we tend to give you your space to enjoy the retreat center fully.   

The retreat center is overseen by Barbara, the caretaker/founder of the Farmhouse Non-Profit her dog: Cash and cat: Anouk both of whom are very friendly.

name: Private retreat minutes from GW P/way, DC, airport
title: McLean, Virginia

hosts.about: Avid skier, sailor, surfer... I love to travel. I also love hosting in my own places.  I have 13 and counting.

recent.comments: We really enjoyed our stay at Cam’s place.  The communication was A+, the place was clean and had everything we needed. Plenty of space and a serene setting. Wonderful outdoor spaces, deck, yard, etc.   We felt right at home. Highly recommend!

items.comments: We really enjoyed our stay at Cam’s place.  The communication was A+, the place was clean and had everything we needed. Plenty of space and a serene setting. Wonderful outdoor spaces, deck, yard, etc.   We felt right at home. Highly recommend!

A great home convenient to DC. An amazing secluded woodland property. House is rustic with some wonderful features like a spacious dining room surrounded by windows overlooking the woods. Great for our family gathering. Cameron was very responsive and helpful.

The location of the house was great, just a quick drive in to DC to see all the sights. House was rustic but clean with modern kitchen appliances. Driveway is over a narrow bridge and then very steep- in the event of snow or ice I imagine it would be difficult to traverse. If traveling with kids, bring games, books, activities as there is nothing besides the TV to keep them entertained in your downtime. Overall, good spot to stay and could be great with some TLC and attention to detail.
We had a wonderful stay here! Great house and location- would highly recommend.

You will not be disappointed with this. House is amazing. Being close to DC but out far enough to relax from all the hustle and bustle. Our family absolutely loved the property and it’s surroundings. Getting to the metro and taking it in to DC was close too. Our host was super easy to work with and communicate with. If you’re looking for a place to stay outside of DC this is it.

This comfortable home feels like a quiet woodland retreat, yet you're just a few minutes away from the center of McLean, the DC Beltway, Tysons Corner and Georgetown. Our group of friends enjoyed gathering around the wood-burning fireplaces in the living room and dining room. The well-stocked kitchen, Netflix and comfortable beds made for a relaxing escape. Cameron provided lots of information and responded very quickly to questions.

We very much enjoyed our stay at Cameron's home. Cam was a wonderful host. He left us well stocked with wood pellets and firewood, and called on the first day to make sure we knew how to run the pellet stove (pro tip: don't leave the lid open longer than 60 seconds). His home is really well situated. It's minutes from the GW Parkway, I-495, and Mclean proper, making it convenient to get places. Even with that, it's very quiet/private: your only visitors will be foxes and roving mobs of deer who are wholly unafraid of you. There are some beautiful views from the giant windows all over the house. 

The flip side to those giant windows is that it can get a little nippy when it's cold but that's where the fireplace and stove come in. All in all, this is a wonderful home for a family or private getaway. Five stars.

description.summary:
Very private retreat in the middle of McLean, VA, 10 min, one traffic light Georgetown, K St, 5 min 495, 20 min to IAD Dulles, 15 DCA National, 5 min Tysons, 15 min Old Town Alexandria.

Down a private rd near the Potomac & GW Parkway, cross a bridge & see the home, set on an acre, surrounded by around 10 acres of streamside woodlands & flood plain. Wildlife aplenty, almost rural
description.space: Relax on the huge deck overlooking 5 acres of undisturbed woodland and stream side fields. Enjoy the 270 degrees of privacy, with the occasional twinkle of the lights from houses across the river during winter when the leaves are gone.

items.comments: Our family of 6 had a great stay on our way to Penn State!
Beautiful place to spend a weekend away from the city. Very clean space with lots of board games. A lot of bed options.

We were in the area for our oldest grandsons wedding, we had our daughter's family up from Tennessee staying with us. I was at first a little bit hesitant about staying in a basement with a party of 7 but as soon as we arrived our 4-year-old granddaughter was in heaven playing in the children's playroom, the basement is nicer and roomier than I even hoped for.  The teenage grandkids were a little bummed that there was no TV but we seldom see them that they aren't staring at their phones anyhow. We would have loved to spend more time at this property but between the wedding rehearsal and the wedding it's self we were on a limited time schedule, but it was so peaceful sitting outside enjoying a cup of coffee in the morning. Amos is great at keeping in touch and more than willing to make sure you are happy with your stay. If you're looking for peaceful getaway this, is it.
This place is stunning!!! Amos was a wonderful host and the property was beautiful!!!! It was by far my favorite Airbnb I have stayed in!!! I can’t wait to stay again!!!

We can't say enough good things about Amos and our stay at his airbnb.  He is indeed a super host, such a kind man and was so helpful with everything we asked of him.  The home sits on top of a hill with fantastic views as you travel to and from it. It was so peaceful and we hope to return for another restful stay. Amos is one of the nicest men you'll ever meet. Jim and Doris

We had a short stay at Amos's place, but it was enjoyable. Our 4 kids LOVED the playroom with tons of fun toys. My husband and I enjoyed the comfy sofas! 😁 It was peaceful and homey. Perfect for our family of 6!
Everything good thank you for all

description.summary:
We would love to be your host and like meeting new people , we do respect your privacy . We generally greet our guests upon arrival !  Our home is "your home away from home"
We are about a 20 minute drive to Selinsgrove where Susquehanna University calls it home. Downtown Selinsgrove has a variety of restaurants and shops . Also about 10 minutes away is the town of Mifflinburg which is home to the Mifflinburg Buggy Museum . Penn View Bible Institute is less then 5 minutes away .
description.space: Our space is in the basement with a large sitting area and playroom for the children , 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom .
description.notes: We also have an on site family run candle making business selling from our little shop , they are all hand poured right here ! We call our business Crackling Wick Candles . We use a wooden wick which makes a crackling sound as it burns. So be sure to ask us about them during your stay with us.
description.interaction: Will be available either in person or by phone.

name: Historic house interior design Lancaster County
title: Columbia, Pennsylvania

gallery.caption: Welcome to our elegant living room, where history meets comfort. A stunning grand piano, beautiful artwork, and a spacious sectional sofa create a perfect gathering spot to relax and make memories!

The newly renovated kitchen blends historic charm and modern comfort. Admire the original Amish-made cabinets, wood beams, and historic stone walls while enjoying brand new appliances. A delightful space for culinary enthusiasts!
You'll love the perennial beds that surprise us each season. A circle drive welcomes you, leading to the inviting front porch with four rocking chairs.
The primary suite has moody vibes and cozy elegance. You'll love the king-size leather bed and the en suite brand new primary bathroom.

This guest suite is full of style - from the designer chandelier to the gallery wall of botanical prints.  With thoughtful amenities like a SmartTV and dresser, you'll be supremely comfortable in this room!
The dining area has a statement Arhaus chandelier that casts a warm glow over the charming farmhouse table, inviting you to savor delicious meals and delightful conversations.
Welcome to your own oasis in Lancaster County, where beauty blooms every spring!  Enjoy the stunning perennial flowers that burst with color and immerse yourself in the tranquility of nature.
Two guest suites have dedicated desks. Whether you're a remote worker, a student, or simply need a quiet space to focus, these thoughtfully designed areas provide the perfect setup.

Welcome to the serene 3rd bedroom, adorned with a crystal chandelier and touches of green. The Anthropologie rug adds bohemian charm. Relax on the plush bed and immerse yourself in this stylish sanctuary.
Enjoy socializing thanks to the bar cabinet in the living room.  You'll notice the antique mirror and marble lamp, just a few of the many design details that grace the home.
Gather around the firepit under a starry country sky.  This Breeo firepit has 6 Adirondack chairs, and is the perfect spot to relax, unwind, and make memories with loved ones.
Welcome to your peaceful retreat, where convenience meets tranquility.  There's ample parking on the circle driveway for you and your guests.
A beautiful antique hutch is proudly displayed in the sitting area of the kitchen.  Brimming with character and style, we provide a few of our favorite cookbooks for you to enjoy!

hosts.about: Follow us on Insta @perennialstays

recent.comments:
Leigh and Corey were great hosts. Minor hiccups were fixed in minutes….literally. They were always available to answer questions but were never intrusive.
Their local guide book was filled with great suggestions. 
The beds were extraordinarily comfortable and so was the furniture.
The dining room chairs were so comfy we found ourselves sitting  around the table for hours with no need to move to the living room couch!
Living in a flight pattern in Jersey, it struck me that we never heard a plane fly overhead all week. The nights were beautifully still. If you’re looking for quiet and privacy,  this is the place to be.

items.comments:
Leigh and Corey were great hosts. Minor hiccups were fixed in minutes….literally. They were always available to answer questions but were never intrusive.
Their local guide book was filled with great suggestions. 
The beds were extraordinarily comfortable and so was the furniture.
The dining room chairs were so comfy we found ourselves sitting  around the table for hours with no need to move to the living room couch!
Living in a flight pattern in Jersey, it struck me that we never heard a plane fly overhead all week. The nights were beautifully still. If you’re looking for quiet and privacy,  this is the place to be.

Modern luxury meets old world charm: Perennial Stays

Nestled in Columbia, PA’s rolling hills and picturesque landscapes, this beautifully restored home is the perfect getaway. The architectural detail pays homage to a bygone era while seamlessly integrating modern luxury comforts and touches. The kitchen is the hearth of the home and so inviting…perfect place for wine after dinner before hanging in the family room with a grand piano. Even if you cannot cook or play the piano, this place makes you feel as though you could win a James Beard award and moonlight in the national symphony. The grounds are gorgeous and mature with grapevines, tiger lilies and a pear tree.  

Every inch has been carefully curated and designed, you can feel the love that was poured into making this place a perfect gem. 

Leigh is a generous and gracious host, every thing you want and hope for. It’s perfect for kids, pet friendly, lots of natural light. Highly recommend. 5 stars times infinity!!! ♥️♥️♥️♥️♥️♥️

Words cannot describe how perfect I think this home is! It is beautifully renovated! And has so many thoughtful touches like hooks just in perfect places, more towels than you need, extra blankets, USB ports by the beds, every item you could need in the kitchen and quality dishes and utensils...the list goes on and on. The kitchen and bathrooms are beautifully done with tiles and cabinets. The central AC worked wonderfully, the seating on the porch, living-room, kitchen was perfect, everything was just perfect! The hosts were incredibly responsive with a great welcome guide with all kinds of helpful info. I've traveled all over the world staying in airbnbs and other similar companies as well as hotel apartments etc. and this home might be the nicest place I ever stayed. Well done!

We had a wonderful stay at Leigh's gorgeous home. We appreciated the historical aspects of the house and all of the modern amenities.  Greatly enjoyed having fires in the living room fireplace and enjoying meals in the dining room overlooking the backyard garden.

Super location close to Lancaster, Hershey, and our Sunday destination in Harrisburg.

We highly recommend this special retreat, and we are very thankful to Leigh and Corey for thinking of all that we needed during our stay.
We booked the place for a long weekend with our girls. It was nice and quiet and close to Hersey Park. It was amazing for us to see such vibrant restaurant and bar life. Worth the trip over from NYC.

We chose Leigh's place because of its convenient location between NYC and VA. We also love historic homes so it was extra special to see all the work they have done to restore the property. The kitchen was fully stocked with all the tools we needed to make family meals, as well as a cute coffee station. We ventured out to the Turkey Hill Experience to sample ice cream, and had a lovely walk and lunch in downtown Lancaster, both a short drive away. You won't need to plan ahead when visiting, as Leigh provides an extensive guide of things to do and local amenities.

Leigh's place is stunning. The art, the kitchen the beds, the baths... simply stunning. This was the perfect place to relax and unwind after a very hectic pace. 

We were in town for a basketball tourney. This was an easy 15-minute ride to Spooky Nook. But far away from the hectic craziness that 700 teams playing all weekend creates. 

We're seasoned Superhosts and Leigh puts us to shame, her guidebook is great, she leaves lovely little local surprises, and there's a peaceful, relaxed decadence about this Stone Home. 

Best of all, while being a pet- friendly place, there was NO evidence of animals or dust-- its simply pristine. 

The kitchen has everything you need, including a very functional layout. All 3 bathrooms had great soap, shampoo and conditioner, nice towels and very spacious-- including headroom. My 6'5" husband often has to duck in older homes, but had no issues here. 

I could go on and on about this lovely home, but trust that it will appeal to the very fussiest.

description.summary:
This historic stone house is brimming with charm and captivating character. Each bedroom offers a guest-favorite King size mattress, ensuring a comfortable stay. 

Only 15 minutes from downtown Lancaster, it's perfectly situated for exploring the area. Easy access to Baltimore, Philly, DC, and NYC makes it an ideal getaway location. 

Follow @perennialstays for more photos and glimpses behind the scenes. Your memorable stay awaits!
description.space:
This stunning house once operated as a General store.  You'll fall in love with the 2 ft thick fieldstone walls, 1700's architecture, cozy fireplace, bubble glass windows, and 2 staircases.  2,700 square feet. No expense was spared on the high end furnishings in this home! As art and antique lovers, you will find original paintings and other works of art throughout the home. The kitchen is incredibly charming with wood beam ceilings and stone walls but still has all the efficiencies a modern chef will need.

Our home is heated and cooled by an energy-efficient geothermal system, minimizing our environmental impact while keeping you comfortable. The water comes from an artesian spring flowing to a tranquil pond on the property.

In spring and summer, enjoy the beauty of mature walnut, cherry, oak, and locust trees. Spot deer, turkeys, hummingbirds, owls, and more. Admire stunning perennial flower beds with lilies, daisies, peonies, and more.

Living Room – This stunning room greets guest just off the foyer.  Baby grand player piano with crystal chandelier, beautiful original paintings, fireplace with wood stove, beautiful decor.  A huge sectional to relax with your group! 
 Optional king size air mattress available for groups greater than 6.

Kitchen – Newly renovated and spacious with design details that perfectly complement the historic stone walls. The kitchen is fully stocked for all your cooking needs.  Enjoy your morning coffee in the comfortable arm chairs flanking the antique storage cabinet.

Dining Room - The dining room has a stunning crystal chandelier from Arhaus.  Just off the dining room is a butler's pantry with tons of storage, a bar cabinet, and also a brand new full bathroom with laundry.

Primary Bedroom and Bathroom - Up the back staircase is a private wing with the primary suite.  King size leather bed, Roku tv, beautiful brand new en suite bathroom with carrera marble tile.  

Guest Rooms – Up the main staircase you will find two comfortable guest rooms.  Each has a king size bed and a desk workspace.

Wifi & Speakers- The house has Wifi and we have added an Eero mesh network that is connected to Comcast high speed internet plus Sonos speakers.

Famous past owners and residents include:

* Capt. Jacob Krug, co-founder and first treasurer of Franklin College (now Franklin & Marshall College)
* Abraham Hershey Herr, great-grandson of Hans Herr, the first Mennonite Bishop to emigrate to America
* Samuel J. Atlee Jr., son of Col. Samuel J. Atlee (Revolutionary War hero who served on the Continental Congress), and grandson of Lady Jane Alcock (lady-in-waiting to King George II's wife)
* John Miller, High Sheriff of Lancaster County (1785-1787) and Chief Burgess of Lancaster Borough (1799, 1805)
* Lt. Col. Jacob Shirk Strickler, member of the State Assembly (1797-1800), appointed commissioner to move the state capital from Philadelphia to Lancaster in 1799.
description.access: Guests will have exclusive access to the entire home during their stay. Parking on the driveway is shared with the adjacent historic home, which is also available for rent on Airbnb. Rest assured that we have made arrangements to ensure that parking is convenient and accessible for all guests.
description.notes:
Please note that this house shares a driveway with an adjacent historic home where the owners or other Airbnb guests may be staying.

A rental contract is required for every booking and will be sent to guests within the 48-hour zero penalty cancellation period.

Please be aware that this old house has a back staircase with uneven stairs, which may not be suitable for guests with mobility issues. We recommend guests with such considerations to take note of this before booking.

COVID-19 Update: The safety and well-being of our guests are our top priorities. Prior to check-in, we kindly request that all guests answer screening questions regarding COVID-19 exposure or symptoms.

Pet Policy: We welcome well-behaved dogs! We recommend ensuring your dog is up to date on flea/tick medication prior to their stay. To maintain cleanliness, we kindly ask that all dogs remain off the furniture at all times, even those that are considered "non-shedding." When left alone in the house, we request that you crate your pet. If you plan to bring your pet, please inform us at the time of booking. A pet fee of $100 per pet per stay will apply.

Although the house is conveniently located near various amenities, it is also nestled in Lancaster County's renowned farms and fields. Please be aware that you may encounter some wildlife, such as ladybugs, stinkbugs, deer, turkeys, bees, wasps, frogs, moths, ticks, spiders, bats, snakes, etc., during your stay. Our dedicated housekeepers and pest control service work diligently to maintain cleanliness and tidiness. However, as the house is centuries old and situated in the countryside, the occasional encounter with wildlife or the scent of nearby farms is possible.
description.neighborhood: Nestled in a rural setting, this property is surrounded by neighboring farms. Explore the historic rivertown of Columbia, PA, known for its timeless architectural styles and rich history. Enjoy direct access to trails, waterways, and river life, uncovering the secrets of our nation's early days. Discover tales of civil war bridge burnings and the birthplace of false-bottom railcars utilized in the Underground Railroad. Immerse yourself in the heritage of our nation's birth while experiencing the tranquility of this picturesque location.
description.transit: There is ample parking for several cars on the circle driveway in front of the home.  You will need a car, since you will be out in the country.
description.interaction: We are readily available via phone or messaging to assist with any of your needs during your stay. Whether you have questions, require recommendations, or encounter any issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. We are committed to ensuring that your experience is comfortable and enjoyable.

hosts.about: I've owned this property for 21 years and have poured my heart and soul into it. I hope you enjoy it as much as I have.

recent.comments: My only issue with our stay is that I had no idea just how incredible this home was going to be. The pictures, though beautiful, simply do not do enough justice. We had such an incredible stay, it was everything we could have wanted and more. Mornings were so peaceful out on the front porch, and we had a great time cooking in the kitchen. The beds were so comfortable, and exploring the intricacies of the home was one of the best parts of the weekend. So many small touches made for the perfect weekend. Thank you so much Steve!

items.comments: My only issue with our stay is that I had no idea just how incredible this home was going to be. The pictures, though beautiful, simply do not do enough justice. We had such an incredible stay, it was everything we could have wanted and more. Mornings were so peaceful out on the front porch, and we had a great time cooking in the kitchen. The beds were so comfortable, and exploring the intricacies of the home was one of the best parts of the weekend. So many small touches made for the perfect weekend. Thank you so much Steve!

Stephen’s place is one-of-a-kind. When I sent pictures of it to my mom she said “ It’s like staying in a museum!” So true, but more comfortable. We enjoyed the interesting historical art and maps that were hung throughout the house. The herb garden outside was so quaint and we made use of them in our cooking. There are beautiful flowers and lawns and huge, amazing shade trees! Our daughters enjoyed playing the grand piano. The master bathroom is quite large and nice. Stephen met us at the house to give us the key and introduce himself. He left us muffins and fresh cut flowers in the kitchen. Such a fun and unique stay, perfect for some family together time! Thank you Stephen!

Stephen's home was amazing. What a beautiful job he did in restoration and all the touches. A truly curated space and wonderful for a anyone who enjoys a home that has history. Every corner was perfectly detailed and decorated and was immaculately clean. Spacious dining room, updated kitchen with everything you could need, and overall amazing decor. The grounds were beautiful too! We will definitely be back again. This place you can't pass up. It's breathtaking and peaceful. Stephen was a wonderful host - check in AND out were so simple. He was easy to communicate with.
Very charming, period home, furnishings & accents. No cluttered. Piano was nice to have. Super clean, fresh and tidy. We felt immediately obliged & comfortable to take our shoes off coming inside!
Great quiet place for a family to stay with access to surrounding attractions/activities. We would definitely stay again if we return to the area.

Look - this is certainly the place you've been looking for. My family and I were on a roadtrip through the area and had a chance to stay in Stephen's historical home. Wow! What a. unique experience. We visited amish country as well as Hershey stuff - it was the perfectly location between these tourist spots. what we didn't expect was charm of the home and it's surrounding town.  Book this place.
Beautiful property, lovely location, and Steven was a great host.

description.summary: Built in 1850, and nestled on a cozy hill just outside of historic Marietta, PA (15 minutes from historic Downtown Lancaster), this 3,600 square foot residence is located just two miles from Route 30, with easy access to Baltimore, Philadelphia, etc.
description.space:
Nestled on a hill just outside of Historic Marietta, PA (15 minutes from Historic Downtown Lancaster), this 3,600 square foot, Italianate style ironmaster residence sits on a meticulously landscaped one acre lot. Located two miles from Route 30, the home is centrally located to Baltimore, Philadelphia, Washington DC, Hershey Park (20 miles) as well as the entire Lancaster County experience  

The entire home has been carefully restored and decorated with an eclectic mix of antiques and art. Features include:
* Spacious rooms with 10+ foot ceilings and floor-to-ceiling windows, allowing for ample amounts of natural light
* Elaborate woodwork
* Restored original grain painting throughout
* Original plank floors with Persian area rugs throughout
* Streaming music throughout first floor
* High speed WIFI throughout house and grounds
* Central Air Conditioning
* Hundreds of books of all types located throughout the home

The home's exterior features include:
* Three porches, including a forty foot long front porch with elaborate cast iron façade and small dining area, perfect for al fresco dining
* Multiple outdoor seating/dining areas, including one located north of the house with seating for six and a charcoal grill
* Herb garden, located outside the kitchen, for your culinary use
* Nearly an acre of exquisitely landscaped gardens
* Mature trees, including redwood, chestnut, tulip poplar, magnolia, weeping copper beech and many others
* Plenty of parking on the property

First floor highlights include: 
* A large, 450 square foot “stainless steel and granite” gourmet kitchen, including all the essentials.
* Coffee burr grinder/french press, traditional coffee maker, and a Nespresso Machine with milk frother for cappuccino/espresso
* Dining room with a 12 foot long table that comfortably seats 10 people
*  “Entertainment room” with leather seating and 55” 4K Ultra-HD Smart TV with Hi-Definition Cable, various streaming services (Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Sling TV, Pandora, Spotify, etc.), Blu Ray DVD player, and state of the art surround sound
* Formal living room with grand piano

The home’s second floor includes:
* Three bedrooms, with a total of five beds: a king-sized bed, two queen-sized beds, a double bed, and a rollaway bed. One of the bedrooms is a 700 square foot, two-room master suite.
* 300 thread count, 100% cotton sateen linens
* Pillows, down comforters and feather beds by Pacific Coast Feather
* Soaps, Shampoo and Conditioner by Tarocco
* Two full bathrooms, including a Master Bath with a large marble walk-in shower, front-loading, high-capacity washer/dryer and marble vanity, and a second bath, which includes a clawfoot tub/shower and period details
* Hairdryer, iron & ironing board
* Second floor porch, accessible from hallway
* Many restored original details, including unique interior tri-fold shutters which fold into the wall when fully closed

This home is located just outside Marietta PA, across the road from the Susquehanna River and Susquehanna River Trail, which connects the historic river towns and villages of Columbia, Marietta, Bainbridge, and Falmouth. Cross the street and you're in the historic river town of Marietta, which features a nice selection of restaurants and taverns and loads of charm.

(Photography by Casadei Photography)

hosts.about:
Based in Charles Town, WV we serve Jefferson County and surrounding areas in the West Virginia panhandle region. We love hosting AirBNB guests coming to visit the Charles Town/Harpers Ferry area for the first time, or returning to visit over and over.  Sometimes we even host people for longer stays when relocating to this area for work or for a longer assignment.  

We are always happy to help with ideas for things to do in this area, whether tubing, hiking, museums, or shopping is your thing!

recent.comments: This was our 3rd time back at the place.  That should say it all!  Love it.  Wonderful in every way.

items.comments: This was our 3rd time back at the place.  That should say it all!  Love it.  Wonderful in every way.

We enjoyed every minute of our stay. It was hard to leave this wonderful time capsule. The surrounding countryside and and lake were glorious and we really enjoyed swimming and paddling around in the canoe. I could have sat for days in the beautiful sunroom reading all of the vintage magazines and books! Many hours were spent in the amazing game room, too! We had a great time exploring all the historical sites in the area, as well.  We highly recommend the Mod Pod Lake House and hope to stay again!

This was our third summer staying at the Mod Pod. I could write a book about why we love it so much! Beautiful surroundings and lots of fun to be had on the lake or at the local beach. Just as much fun to be had in all of the cozy nooks and crannies of the home. My son calls it our “happy place”, and I agree! Already ready to book for next summer. ☮️
Wow, what a beautiful house on a beautiful cove. Paddle boarding at sunset was a highlight. The bottle of wine was a nice touch as well. Hope to be back soon!
Wonderful place to stay. The character of the house was enjoyable as was the dock and lake access. Look forward to returning.

My family wanted a lakefront property to go fishing and this place was perfect. My boys loved walking down to the private dock to cast their fishing rods. They caught so many large bass we lost count. We had lunch on the deck everyday. In the evenings, we played games in the game room. We had a wonderful time and would come back. Thanks for being a great host.

We loved staying here for the weekend! We thoroughly enjoyed the dock as well as the ping pong table. The house is quite large and was comfortable for our family. We can’t wait to come back next year!

description.summary: Step back in time for a timeless weekend! Visit this impeccably curated 1970's hideout for an unforgettable time away. Fabulous mountain getaway in a tranquil lakeside setting. Ideal for time away from the madness of life where you can slow things right down.
description.space: As you step into the home, after catching your breath from the panoramic view, you will notice all the lovely spaces designed to bring family and friends together for a great evening of fun. You will also discover many intimate areas for long conversations or quiet times alone. This home has it all. The game room is a perfect place to play with it's big TV, board games, ping pong table and vintage arcade game. Spread out and enjoy the three comfortable bedrooms and three bathrooms. No more scheduling bath time, just enjoy the tranquil bliss of a peaceful night's sleep. As you wake and make your way to the well appointed kitchen I think you will appreciate all the conveniences of home. Grab a warm cup of coffee, cozy up on the screened porch or in the bright sunroom, and watch the lake come to life. We have full sized appliances for whipping up gourmet meals and an electric grill on the large deck for your grill master. If take out is your thing we are close enough to town to make it easy. That is what our home is all about - taking it easy, unwinding, enjoying the simple things in life.
description.access: The ModPod is situated on a private lake with it's own dock surrounded by trees. So grab one of the kayaks  for a day of adventure on the water. The game room opens up to the back yard making it access easy. You can sit on the dock, the deck, or the screened porch and just watch the world pass by. The quietness of nature is inspiring.  It really is wild and wonderful here.

Lucy was an ideal host.  We had several changes to our travel schedule before and after the deadline and Lucy could not have been more accommodating and understanding.  We were traveling during the impossible week between Christmas and New Years of 2022 and Lucy made the accommodations part of that week a breeze.

This is a very nice place, in a calm and safe area of Georgetown. There's a bus stop very closeby, that would bring one to D.C. Downtown. The place itself is spaceous and comfortable, we had a good stay there.

It occupies a whole floor in a luxury house at the ground level: One bedroom, one living room, one kitchen, one bathroom, including refrigerator, microwave, stove, cookware, dishwasher, washer/dryer and smart TV with Roku. It has 1,000 sf. and 10 ft. ceiling, three closets and a baby grand piano as well. Fully furnished, and more than 20 art pieces on the wall. The sensor lights are in the foyer and the corridor. It shines when you walk by and you never need to switch them on and off. Extra sheets and towels are in the closet. Feel free to go to the deck where has an amazing Potomac River view, an unique place in DC. This space is good for single or couples, and business travelers.

As Stewards of Stone Gables Estate, our goal is to preserve Lancaster County treasures and share them with the world. We trust you will be inspired and touched by your visit to the Estate
Our mission is to donate 100% of the net profits through Stone Gables Estate to aid abandoned children worldwide through Brittany's Hope

recent.comments: I can’t say enough about this amazing experience for me and our entire group. The inn keeper was absolutely a world class host. The amenities were off the charts. We can’t wait to stay there again.

items.comments: I can’t say enough about this amazing experience for me and our entire group. The inn keeper was absolutely a world class host. The amenities were off the charts. We can’t wait to stay there again.

I highly recommend not just the Klein Mansion physical accommodations but also the team behind it! I’ve had a last minute plan for my elopement dinner celebration (I also rented the conservatory) and it was the best decision ever! It’s beautiful inside and outside! Everything is high quality and lovely! We were amazed to hear that this beautiful mansion carries a beautiful story to match with it! You can tell that place was built and maintained with love and dedication 😍

Jessica (the person I interacted through the Airbnb platform) was very communicative and did a great job recommending me options of caterers - I ended up going with Simply from Scratch (loved their food and service!). She took the time to answer all my questions through the phone, and made sure to coordinate with me all the details! I was very happy to see that she cared about my event like if she was part of my family!

Timothy and Tammy (the Klein Mansion Innkeepers) were the best as well! They accommodated an earlier check in so I could take my pictures at the garden before my guests’ arrival! It made a huge difference! Plus, along the day they were always coming to us to check if we needed anything else (even later in the night, 8pm -9pm, I mentioned that we were going to use the jacuzzi and Tammy offered extra towels for us to use). They were very generous and made us feel very comfortable and did an amazing job assisting us! The breakfast was just AMAZING! We left the house with big smiles and I will remember this day forever thanks to you all!!!!!

If you are wondering if the price is fair - it’s worthy every single dollar!!!! ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️

description.summary:
Built in 1924, this stone manse has a rich heritage. The mansion, originally owned by William Klein, Jr, of M&M Mars Chocolate, was then purchased by the Abel family in 1986. It housed a total of 15 children, most adopted from around the world in what was a sort of United Nations under one roof. The home has savored memories expressed in antiques, art and models. Many enjoyable amenities include a 19 seat movie theatre in the theme of the Titanic, a one of a kind museum with trains, planes, and automobiles, Diorama displays and more!

This home consists of 7 bedroom ensuites,  a Conservatory, large Gathering Room, both formal living and dining rooms and several fireplaces. Each bedroom is uniquely different with it’s own personality. The Klein Mansion King and Queen Master Suites are adjoining, yet separate but do share a ginormous bathroom with tub, shower, dual sinks and a private water closet. The original Master Suite is The Burgundy Truffle Suite and boasts a king bed, airy bathroom with views to die for. The lovely Mocha Latte Loft, with its vaulted ceilings and rich chocolate furniture  enjoy a small fireplace is simply tantalizing! The ambiance and views are simply amazing! If you haven’t noticed yet, every room has a flavor that resembles the “chocolate” roots of this inspired home. Take a peek into the Romantic Round Turret that has a custom round bed, claw foot white tub and a shower! Enticing! Other rooms to investigate are The Retro Gum Drop Studio and The White Chocolate Bliss Bungalow.  Every room has a specially designed bathroom with incredible touches and appointments. 

The robust Abel family moved out so you could enjoy the many custom features both inside and out, including a teardrop jacuzzi, granite corn hole, playground, fire pit, a Koi pond and fountains all meshed with gorgeous foliage and landscape. The original house even supports a Billiard Room! The Conservatory can be reserved for special gatherings such as rehearsal dinners, showers and catered events for up to 24 guests.

The Klein Mansion Bed & Breakfast sits on the front of a 280 acre property which displays many restored and historic structures including sites where Abraham Lincolns’ Funeral Train and even the Liberty Bell passed through. This very private and historic property is centrally located to Harrisburg, the Capital of Pennsylvania. To Hershey with its restaurants, theme park, concerts and Chocolate history. Then there is nearby Lancaster where Amish villages, shopping and choice restaurants abound. Choose this quiet “Burb” for your getaway, retreat or celebrations.
description.space: The Conservatory: may be rented for private events along with a full mansion rental only. All private events must be pre-approved in writing by Stone Gables Estate and as agent for the owners. Estate events may carry additional costs based on fully executed contract. Using the conservatory for a catered luncheon/dinner will hosts an additional cost of $500.00 for up to 24 guests, the mansion only sleeps maximum 16 guests. If you have extra guests we have other lodging facilities on the estate if available.
description.interaction: This house will host innkeepers and provide breakfast!!
description.house_rules:
Smoking of any kind is prohibited in the mansion, Smoking is allowed only in the designated smoking areas outside.

Quiet hours 10pm - 7am. Please be cognizant of other guests

We love animals just not in our mansion

Respectful children older than 12 years of age are welcome 

Only entire mansion rentals have use of the Conservatory.

Please lock your rooms door to insure all personal belongings maintain safe.

No candles or glitter in any part of the mansion are welcomed. 

Pending other events on the estate, please adhere to Innkeepers instructions regarding touring of the property.

Awesome place. Will stay again if I’m in town. Loren was super communicative. Great host.

Loren's home was clean, as described and quiet. Loren herself was a gracious host and enjoyable to talk with. 
I look forward to staying again when in the area. 😊

This was such a great place to stay! Clean and cozy. Check-in was very easy and on our own time as we traveled a far distance. Room was very clean and set up nicely. By far one of the comfiest beds I have slept in in a long time!
This was a great stay with a convenient location and a very friendly host. Everything you needed was there. I'll definitely come again.

*Washer and dryer on premises
