Bathroom features a mini-kitchen with Keurig, tea kettle, assorted teas & coffees, chilled filtered water. Dishes, glassware & flatware provided.
Living room is common space. Front door entrance in living room, access to guest suite.
Living room with fireplace leads into dining room.
Dining room where breakfast is served.
Host kitchen, guests may have limited use.

hosts.about: Love to travel, read, cook and eat well! Am active in our local Farmer's Market and have successful fresh market soup & salad business at the Market. You are bound to get some special home made treats when you stay with me! Because I've traveled a lot I am sensitive to all the touches that make your stay easy and comfortable.

recent.comments:
Lindy was a perfect host and immediately made us feel welcomed  into her home. The accommodations were picture perfect. The room and bathroom were beautifully appointed with everything we might need. Breakfast of was a treat. 
I highly recommend a stay with Lindy in her beautiful home. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Kent Island.

items.comments:
Lindy was a perfect host and immediately made us feel welcomed  into her home. The accommodations were picture perfect. The room and bathroom were beautifully appointed with everything we might need. Breakfast of was a treat. 
I highly recommend a stay with Lindy in her beautiful home. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Kent Island.

We had a great stay at Lindy’s. She was very communicative and helped us pick out places to eat and explore around Kent Island and beyond. The room is very peaceful and the bed comfortable. Definitely would stay here again.

Lindy was fantastic!!! She was very prompt to communicate, allowed for early check in. The house smelled amazing and was super clean. The bedroom was spacious and comfortable. She was a joy to have met and super sweet. We felt right at home for our one night stay. Would definitely return!
We only stayed one night at Lindy’s but would highly recommend staying there. We hope to be back in the future
Lindy is a superb host! This might be our 6th booking with her, it’s become so easy & convenient, I lose count.  Always a wonderful stay in such peaceful surroundings on the bay. 💜
Very responsive and respectful of our space. Great cooking.
We’ve booked so often now with Lindy and her lovely home, we feel like extended family! She AND her home are simply lovely!

description.summary: Quiet house setting on Kent Island. Private, spacious bedroom suite (queen size bed) & bath with rustic pine interior throughout the house. Mini kitchen area with amenities. Close to Bay Bridge and local wedding venues.
description.space: This is listing 2 of 3 for this house space. This is spacious and quiet bedroom and bath for 1 or 2 people. Though I can add a twin bed in this room for a 3rd person, if needed. It features a table/desk area, Roku Smart TV, large closet, floor space for exercise, yoga mat & hand weights. Adjacent bathroom features full tub/shower, double sinks, and kitchenette with fridge, Keurig coffee maker. Coffee, tea and condiments, still and sparkling water, and breakfast snacks are provided. When you book this room individually, no one else can book the adjacent 2nd bedroom, so the area is private for you.
description.access: Access through the main front door with key-less entry system, through the living room on the left. Double doors lead into the suite area. This room is off to the right from there. There is a back patio area with tables and chairs that you are welcome to use.
description.notes: There is an iron and ironing board available upon request. You are welcome to use the microwave in the kitchen, or let me know if you have any other kitchen or laundry needs and I will accommodate you.
description.neighborhood: House is located on a wide open country road near the water. Great for walking, jogging or cycling. Less than 6 miles to either the Chesapeake Bay Beach Club or the Kent Manor Inn, both popular wedding venues, easy to get to without having to get on the highway. Also easy access to the Cross Island Trail for walking, jogging or cycling. There are plenty of good restaurants and shopping nearby.
description.transit: There is no public transportation to speak of on Kent Island. I can help you arrange local transportation if you need it. Kent Island is 30 minutes from Annapolis, an hour away from either Baltimore or Washington, DC, and 45 minutes from BWI airport. It's just about 5 miles away from the Bay Bridge Airport for you small plane pilots!
description.interaction: When I am there I am available to answer questions, recommend local destinations and activities, and be as much or as little company as you need.
description.house_rules: No smoking in the house, really. If you must smoke, you may do so on the back porch and I'll provide you with an ashtray. Quiet after 11. Be tidy and courteous.

name: Peaceful, Modern, Spacious Home Sleeps 10!
title: Reston, Virginia

gallery.caption: We have tried to achieve a balance of sun and shade ...
The house is on a bit of an incline so soil erosion is an issue ...
There are four decks -- two in the front; two in the back ...
Super important to remember and remind guests this 1980s house was built with a step down into the dining room, and living room ...
View from the living room into the dining and bar area ...
We moved in ten years ago and I still haven't figured out what to do with this very retro bar area ...
View from the kitchen into the coffee nook where we play games, have a morning snuggle with the dogs, kids watch a show while we cook ...
View from the nook into the kitchen ...
Photos below will show what's in each cupboard ...
Laundry and open pantry is off the kitchen ...
These machines are beasts ... finally a washer/dryer that is simple and gets the job done
There are two office areas ... computers will be removed
We're upstairs now ... this is the first area you will see.
Girls room sleeps two with pull-out trundle ...
And now ... the following photos show what's in the cupboards and drawers ...

hosts.about: Areas of work and teaching focus on international business, emerging economies, and online education.

recent.comments: Best AirBnB host ever! Attentive, responsive, caring, helpful, and proactive - providing incredibly useful tips on local amenities and things to do. The location is perfect for enjoying the Washington DC region, and of course Reston itself is a beautiful place to be!

items.comments: Best AirBnB host ever! Attentive, responsive, caring, helpful, and proactive - providing incredibly useful tips on local amenities and things to do. The location is perfect for enjoying the Washington DC region, and of course Reston itself is a beautiful place to be!

Sarah is absolutely lovely – the best host one could ever expect. She is extremely responsive. We had silly little issues like not being able to find certain things (that were under our noses), and she immediately informed us where to find them. The home is gorgeous, in a brilliant location, and beautifully equipped with everything imaginable. I couldn’t possibly recommend any AirBnB host more highly than Sarah!

description.summary: Tree-lined street near Wiehle Metro, restaurants, golf course and multiple walking trails. Ten minutes to IAD airport. The downstairs includes a bedroom office, kitchen, bar, living & dining room, laundry, three decks and fenced-in yard. Upstairs bedrooms include master with tub/shower, girls room with twin trundle; boys room with bunk beds; hall with twin bed; and bedroom office.
description.space:
Tree-lined street near Wiehle Metro, restaurants, golf course and multiple walking trails. Ten minutes to IAD airport. 

The downstairs includes a bedroom office (sleeps 1), kitchen, bar, living (sleeps 1 in large recliner) & dining room, laundry, two decks and fenced-in yard. 

Upstairs bedrooms include master with king bed (sleeps 2) with en suite bathroom, bedroom office (sleeps 1) and adjoining upper deck with hot tub; girls room with twin trundle (sleeps 2), desk, piano, and 1/2 closet; boys room with bunk beds (sleeps 2), desk, armoire, and piano; hall with twin bed (sleeps 1) and bookcases; and downstairs office with daybed (sleeps 1 total) and armoire.
description.access: This is a five-bedroom home that provides access to all areas -- with the exception of the garage, private en suite apartment, and some closet space.
description.notes: Please wipe dog's paws when coming back inside to avoid stains on furniture.
description.neighborhood: Tree-lined quiet drive that leads to many walking paths, restaurants and shops
description.transit: The Silver Line Wiehle Metro station is a +/-5 minute walk away
description.house_rules:
- Quiet before 9 am and after 9 pm
- No shoes in house please
- No more than one dog allowed but not on beds
- No dog that sheds
- Trash out to mailbox on Thursday evening
- No smoking inside or outside
- No more than 10 children/adults AND one infant in the house please

name: Historic Estate near Gettysburg (Room 2)
title: Westminster, Maryland

gallery.caption: Back Patio with the calming sounds of the fountain behind
Foyer with original Stain Glass Doors
Dining Room with Original Stain Glass Windows
Guest Bathroom (Please note the Guest Bathroom as well as the 1st floor powder room are shared between guests)

hosts.about: Welcome to our booking site for the Historic Arthur Willis Feeser Estate. We currently have 3 rooms that are able to be booked. We hope to see you soon!

recent.comments: Jonathan and Timothy were wonderful hosts.  Their home is lovely.

items.comments: Jonathan and Timothy were wonderful hosts.  Their home is lovely.

Timothy and Jonathan are excellent hosts. We were warmly welcomed and spoiled with fresh and home baked goodies. The house is a gem and has been furnished with great attention to detail. The beds are comfortable and the rooms exude the charm of the past. The garden and grounds around the house are also very well kept and decorated. We have had many nice and interesting conversations with them and learned quite a bit. Definitely come back one day!
Jonathan’s house is very beautiful and unique. Jonathan himself is very friendly and offers great muffins for the breakfast. It was a nice stay.

Jonathan's home is beautiful, clean and very cozy. It is a historic home that has a fascinating history and it is decorated with wonderful period pieces. The home is close to Gettybsurg and is located on a quiet street. It has a beautiful outdoor area, a living room and kitchen to share with the other guests. There are homemade muffins and a wonderful breakfast awaiting in the mornings. Jonathan and his partner are incredibly kind and generous hosts. They gave us recommendations and made sure we had everything we needed. They made sure we were comfortable and happy. We loved sharing conversations with them and we were very grateful for their kindness. We highly recommend this home and look forward to returning!

My stay was very peaceful and carefree. My host showed me around and let me know the best ways to conntact them and they were very responsive, but otherwise I could not tell anyone was there. It was great.
Their home is absolutly amazing, very well put together, clean, and efficient. For an old home (1920) the amenities were very modern, from the automated greeting when I walked through the door to the lights setting the mood when I entered another room.
Timothys muffins are really good and went very well with the morning coffee. 

I will absolutly recomend this location and look forward to visiting again. Thank you.

Jonathan & Timothy were excellent hosts. We were greeted with fresh baked brownies and muffins. Their home is lovely and quiet. If you're looking for an historical AirBnB experience, this is the place for you. Only 20 minutes from Gettysburg, and is a nice drive through rolling hills.

I was visiting my elderly mother and mainly picked this place because it is close to where my mother lives. The one comment I would make to someone considering  staying here is that they need to be able to climb a set of stairs and it helps if you like antiques/old homes. I found it utterly charming but not everyone would appreciate the “old” aspect of the house. I did love it however.  Thanks Jonathan for sharing your beautiful home with me.

description.summary:
Built as a manor house for the Feeser Canning Company in 1920, Arthur Willis Feeser spared no expense in the many architectural gems shown throughout the house. Minutes away from downtown Westminster and only a short 20-minute drive to Historic Gettysburg PA.

Please note: After booking, you will receive an email with a short rental agreement, this must be signed before you arrive. Also there are pets that live in the owner's suite. Do not book if you dislike or are allergic to Cats or Dogs.
description.space: Built as a Georgian Colonial Style Manor, there is so much this historic home has to offer. If you have an interest in staying in a beautiful home that boasts many architectural gems, the Arthur Willis Feeser Estate is perfect for you.
description.notes:
Disclosures:
*. Please note there is 24/7 video recording in all public spaces and also on the grounds for security surveillance. 
* Please note there are cats & dogs living in the estate. Please do not book if you dislike or are allergic to either cats or dogs.
* Animals are welcome with prior approval. Animals must not have history of destructive behavior such as chewing or digging. Your records of vaccinations must be made available for coping upon check in. They must remain in your reserved room and not left to roam the building.
*Booking is not fully confirmed until the rental agreement has been signed. This will come through to your email and must be signed before you arrive at the property.
description.neighborhood: We are located in Historic Silver Run Maryland which has a few local businesses. Within walking distance are a local grocery market (Brewer's Market) a liquor store, and our recommended restaurant Buds at Silver Run. There are also a couple of small novelty shops in the area as well as a few wineries. For lager scale shopping, the city of Westminster offers pretty much anything you can think of. The city of Westminster is about a 10-minute drive from the Estate.
description.transit:
Located on Maryland Route 97, we are only a 10-minute drive into Historic Downtown Westminster Maryland and only 20 minutes from Historic Downtown Gettysburg Pennsylvania.

PA and MD Route 15 are only about 15 minutes away.
description.interaction: We are proud to call the AW Feeser Estate our home and as such, we are available on property for the majority of your stay.
description.house_rules:
Booking is not fully confirmed until our rental agreement has been signed. You will not gain access to the property until this is signed. 
We are happy to accommodate small dogs & cats as long as they have updated vaccinations, they are not destructive, and they must be kept in the private bedroom.
Off street parking is available, however the left garage stall must never be blocked.
First Floor Office as well as Room 1 and Room 4 on the second floor are private use by homeowners only.
Smoking at the Estate is Strictly Prohibited unless located outside by the garage.
Guest not on the Reservation may not enter the property unless given prior permission by homeowners.
No Swimming is Permitted in fountain.
Guest who play piano are welcome to use the grand piano so long as they do so respectively. No Children may bang on the piano keys.
Upon Check-In, Please use the front door unless stated elsewise prior to check-in. After Check-In the back door will be the main point of entrance.
Guests accept fully liability while on property.
Make sure to turn off the lights, air conditioning, and any electronics when you leave the house. Don’t forget to close the windows and lock the door. 
Report any damages and/or breakages in a reasonably timely manner. Damages exceeding the security deposit amount must be paid by guests and will be reported to Airbnb.
Obey all instructions given by the homeowners during your stay.

name: Old Homestead...Rest, Relax and Renew at this Quant Getaway
title: Shippensburg, Pennsylvania

recent.comments: During our three week stay, Saundra was the perfect mix of being attentive to questions and needs,  and being respectful of our privacy.  This location would be a song writer's paradise. You can be as plugged in or as unplugged as you want to be. There is also an area in the driveway, to turn your vehicle around, so that you never have to back out into the street. Check in and check out was easy and organized. Thank you Saundra!

items.comments: During our three week stay, Saundra was the perfect mix of being attentive to questions and needs,  and being respectful of our privacy.  This location would be a song writer's paradise. You can be as plugged in or as unplugged as you want to be. There is also an area in the driveway, to turn your vehicle around, so that you never have to back out into the street. Check in and check out was easy and organized. Thank you Saundra!
This place is perfect for privacy and relaxation !! we loved every bit of our stay and ms. saundra was soooo sweet and helpful !! we will definitely be back in the future.
Saundra's place is hands down the best.  I've stayed there two years in a row and will continue to do so every time I'm in the area.  You will not be disappointed !

Sandra went above and beyond to make us feel very welcoming in her home, it was everything her photos represented and so much more, especially the backyard, very serene, quiet. just a little drive away to Carlisle and The Hamilton restaurant was amazing, also some ice cream at Leo's was some ice cream at Leo's was very delicious!
I would most definitely revisit her home

If I could give 10 stars I would!
This was, BY FAR, the best Airbnb we've ever stayed at!!!
We stayed for the weekend for a car show, so we didn't spend much time at the house, but every question I had was answered immediately, and Saundra is extremely nice!
I asked about restaurants and immediately she gave me great recommendations!
The house rules were very clear, and has everything organized so well!
There are extras all over the house just in case you forget to pack something...which is amazing when you pack for 4 people and forget!
The beds are incredibly comfortable!
The wifi is strong.
The backyard is an oasis!
Utterly relaxing after a long day of travel and a long, hot day at a car show.
I hope to make this our yearly place to stay when we go again!!

Beautiful place that has that comfy welcoming feeling.   Saundra and her husband went above and beyond to accommodate our last minute stay.  Sooo glad they were recommended to us.    Would definitely recommend this place

Saundra’s place is amazing, beautiful inside and out . Spotlessly clean, the beds where some of the most comfortable I have slept on. That was great after a long day of walking at car show. Communication was great. My group will definitely try and book her place again for future car events

description.summary:
Welcome to the "Old Homestead."  
If you are looking for a quaint and relaxing getaway, then the Old Homestead is the perfect spot. Located between Shippensburg/Carlisle areas, there is so much to see and do within driving distance.  History enthusiast...you have so many places to choose from.  Maybe wine is more to your liking...it's a matter of which winery do I choose first.  Enjoy hiking...then nearby Michaux State Forest is the perfect place to go or the Cumberland Rails to Trails. Perhaps you prefer to just relax and enjoy dinner on the deck or sit around a firepit and enjoy the evening. Whatever your preference, be sure to enjoy your "home away from home."

name: The Mother-in-Law Studio @ Rose Rent Lofts
title: Chambersburg, Pennsylvania

gallery.caption: This studio apartment is a one-room living and sleeping configuration with an ADA restroom and ADA kitchen and appliances.
This 543 SF studio is furnished with a queen bed, sofa, cable tv, dining area, an ADA washer/dryer combination, ADA kitchen and ADA bathroom.
This 543 SF studio is furnished with a queen bed, sofa, cable tv, dining area, an ADA washer/dryer combination, ADA kitchen and an ADA bathroom.
Entrance, hallways and maneuvering area around furnishings have been designed for wheelchair clearance and accessibility.

The dining table is a 30" x 60" butcher block top on a crank-style, height-adjustable base.  The table can be set from 28" high to 44" high to accommodate any mobility device.  The dining chairs are also height adjustable from 19" to 26".
Our kitchen is well-appointed with cookware, bakeware, pots, pans and all the tools necessary to prepare meals.  Dinnerware settings for 8 include plates, glassware, mugs and flatware.

Our kitchen includes GE Profile ADA appliances.  Accessibility design features include cabinets with additional toe-kick height and pullout shelves, sink with wheelchair knee space and front-controls for the glass-top range.
A 60" width interior access is maintained for the entry hallway, kitchen area and bathroom entrance.
Our Air B&B suite is located on the first floor in studio apartment 102.
Studio 102 features an extra wide entrance for wheelchair accessibility.
For guests traveling with a companion who may be ambulatory but has difficulty with longer traveling distances, a transport chair is available for use during your stay.
Our parking area is accessed from Burkhart Avenue.  The property is surrounded by a security gate which is open from 6am to 8pm.  Resident fobs and PIN codes open the gate after hours.

Our Billiards and TV Room is part of the common area accessible by residents and guests 24/7.  The room features and 8' Connelly pool table and 85" 8K TV with bluetooth speaker system that can be quickly paired with any phone or player device.

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

hosts.about: My wife, Kristen and I own Rose Rent Lofts in Chambersburg.  As an architect for K12 schools on the east coast, I've rehabilitated a number of historic schools and this project represents the first we've converted to residential use.  We live in this complex and are happy to answer any questions about Chambersburg, your housing experience, or the project's history.

recent.comments: The owners are friendly, interesting, well-read, educated. They allowed me a private tour of their residence on site and pointed out specifics of this unique historic school building turned loft apartments.  They gifted me a booklet keepsake of the history and renovations which meant a lot to me as I was in this building for two years when it was my junior high school.  Made for a unique stay in my hometown.  The studio apartment was a nice mix of "hotel" and "close friend's house".  It is tastefully decorated and has everything you need away from home.  Plentiful linens and dishes.  The shower is a small cube, not spacious, but the shower head itself is great!  Lots of thoughtful, homey touches.  Very quiet and sound-proof.  Friendly tenants,  plenty of parking.  Parking lot is gated and secured at night for extra safety.  Entire building is secured via codes/cameras at all times.  Great place in Chambersburg if you need more than a hotel room.  I would definitely stay here again.

items.comments: The owners are friendly, interesting, well-read, educated. They allowed me a private tour of their residence on site and pointed out specifics of this unique historic school building turned loft apartments.  They gifted me a booklet keepsake of the history and renovations which meant a lot to me as I was in this building for two years when it was my junior high school.  Made for a unique stay in my hometown.  The studio apartment was a nice mix of "hotel" and "close friend's house".  It is tastefully decorated and has everything you need away from home.  Plentiful linens and dishes.  The shower is a small cube, not spacious, but the shower head itself is great!  Lots of thoughtful, homey touches.  Very quiet and sound-proof.  Friendly tenants,  plenty of parking.  Parking lot is gated and secured at night for extra safety.  Entire building is secured via codes/cameras at all times.  Great place in Chambersburg if you need more than a hotel room.  I would definitely stay here again.

My stay was a unique chance to stay at a school I once attended. The host were more than gracious to give myself and family members a tour of the 1800's building they worked very hard to restore. The amenities and style of the interior best that which you would experience at most hotels. The location within the local area made the stay very convenient. The studio was very well supplied and clean and served almost as ones own personal apartment away from home.
we really enjoyed our stay. it was clean, roomy, and vern was great with communication during the stay.
This AirBNB rates 10 stars on a 5-star rating scale. The amenities are plentiful and appreciated. Overall, the facility should be your first choice when you stay in Chambersburg.

Great little apartment. Loved the easy check in and the secure parking. Very clean and the host went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. If your in the area and need a place to stay, don’t pass this one up.

This place was amazing. I was surprised when I was offered to tour the place before I booked. Very secure building, which was a plus.  The place was clean and cozy. I would definitely stay here again in the future.
Beautiful place! Vern was a great host! We would be thrilled to come stay again.

description.summary: Rose Rent Lofts is a residential apartment community in downtown Chambersburg, PA.  The building is a former High School with original portions as old as 1824.  Converted to 28 loft apartments in 2020, one unit is reserved for guests of tenants on a priority basis, then available to other Chambersburg visitors up to 2 weeks before their stay.  This ADA accessible studio apartment has one parking space within the secure gated perimeter.
description.space: This studio apartment is wheelchair accessible. The unit features a full kitchen with an adjustable height table for dining, cooking, or working. This studio has a queen-size bed,  living area with small sofa, and ample closet space.  Ensuite laundry is provided with a single combination washer/dryer unit. Television with cable service is included.  In addition to building WiFi access, this suite has high-speed internet access via a CAT5 data line.
description.access: In addition to the studio apartment, respectful guests are welcome to stretch out in our lobby area to relax, work, or play our 1870 grand piano.  Guests may also enjoy the adjoining community room with its large-screen TV.  Guests are also welcome to enjoy the use of our pool table.
description.notes: Guests will be given an access code for the security system and guest suite prior to check-in.
description.neighborhood: We are located in downtown Chambersburg 2 blocks from the town square, where many local festivals and events are held* throughout the year (* please note that these events may not be taking place through the current pandemic, please visit the business-Chambersburg-org "Events Calendar" for updated information). There are several craft breweries, restaurants, and cafes within walking distance.  A "rail-to-trail" park and pathway is 2 blocks away.
description.transit: You are within easy walking distance of downtown. There are multiple municipal parking lots and on-Street metered parking is available. You are provided one parking space in Rose Rent Lofts secured parking area as a guest.
description.interaction: If you are a new visitor, our property manager will meet you to familiarize you with our access procedures and property rules.  If you are a guest of a tenant, your tenant host will be able to show you our site amenities and help you settle in.
description.house_rules: We allow guests to use our common areas which include a lobby with grand piano as well as a community room with TV and pool table.  We ask that guests be courteous with their noise level after 9:30pm.

gallery.caption: Fully Equipped Kitchen including Spacious Eating Areas
Welcome all Music Lovers to Enjoy Piano Room

recent.comments: Great place in a clean and safe neighborhood.  Great hospitality and location.

items.comments: Great place in a clean and safe neighborhood.  Great hospitality and location.
I would highly recommend staying with Stephanie! The space is spotless, comfortable, and conveniently located, and she is a very responsive and gracious host.
Great place to stay. Will definitely come back.

Extraordanary furnishing and comfort. I‘ve never had a better bed. The house has a very lovely style in a very calm surrounding for a good price. Communication was easy, our hosts gave us a warm welcome. Highly recommanded lodge in DC Area.
Great place to stay. Nice neighborhood and a beautiful home.

Stephanie is a wonderful host and her home is beautiful and sparkling clean. The bed was the most comfortablewe have ever slept in while traveling. She added personal touches to our suite and we had a wonderful stay. Also, her little poodle Patches is the sweetest little dog and added an exta wonderful bonus to our stay. If you are looking for a wonderful place to stay near Rockville, this is it!
Beautiful and quiet accommodations.  Stephanie is a very gracious host and makes you feel right at home.   Location is very close to metro.   Will definitely be staying again.

description.summary:
GORGEOUS Bedroom that sleeps 2 ADULTS +2 CHILDREN under 18 years PRIVATE BATH located in a quiet neighborhood. C-AIR and FREE WIFI.  Fully equipped Kitchen with views to an enclosed backyard. Easy FREE PARKING. MD Lic # BCA-74745

Minutes from highways (I -270 and I- 200) to the heart of DC (35 min) and Baltimore Harbor(45 min). Easy access to Shady Grove metro station ( quick 5 min bus/Uber ride or 30 min walk on a lighted path) on the RED line to DC. Perfect for business travelers!
description.space:
We love and embrace diversity in our community.  Everyone is welcome here!  PLEASE NOTE: The bedroom space sleeps 4 persons, however the County laws state there may be no more than 2 adults in the room. Thus, the rental reservation is limited to 2 ADULTS and 2 CHILDREN under 18 years of age. There are 3 separate Beds.in this room consisting of : one Queen Bed, and two Twin Beds.. The daybed / couch  that is pictured in the listing against the wall-- has a twin mattress on top and another twin mattress on a frame beneath the daybed  that easily rolls out. All three of the beds are very comfortable and have their own separate bed linens. 
I pride myself with providing my guests with an immaculate sparkling clean space. 
We have a large fully equipped kitchen with ample seating that opens to a lovely backyard, garden and barbecue area. You are free to use these shared spaces, but please clean them after use. 

PLEASE NOTE: our family includes  a sweet and people friendly 10 pound Parti Poodle that is a hypo allergenic breed.. We also live with 2 beautiful cockatiels ( very friendly but remain caged) on our main level.
description.access: All my guests are welcome to use the fully equipped kitchen and the adjacent outside area for seating and barbeque grill.  I also have a piano on the main level of the house and invite my music loving  guests to play it! Enjoy!
description.notes: I am licensed under the Montgomery County Maryland Rental Licensing Department Agency and adhere to their rules and guidelines. My Rental LIcense  # is : BCA-74745.
description.neighborhood:
My husband and I have lived in this community for over 25 years. I am proud to be part of this wonderful and diverse  mix of people from all over the world.  We love our neighborhood featuring friendly cul-de-sacs  and its' spectacular location  which is literally within minutes to everything -including grocery stores, pharmacies and great restaurants. 

My husband and I have shared many blessings in this home.. marriage and the birth of our daughter. We  are also very active in our areas' local music scene , a welcoming community of like minded individuals of all ages. So for any of our guests that may have an interest in live music it would be our joy to help guide you to some of our best and finest music venues. It is with  this love of music that  we  also invite our guests  to take a  little time and enjoy our antique piano - feel free to sit down and play for a while!

Most importantly what we LOVE most about our home are the people that we share it with. We sincerely look forward to making your stay a warm and happy experience for all!
description.transit:
Minutes from RED LINE METRO at Shady Grove Station which provides a direct route to downtown Washington DC and Union Station where you can take the Marc Train to downtown Baltimore. Our neighborhood has a variety of quick and convenient access points to Shady Grove metro. These access points include a lighted walking path (approximately 30 min walk  from my front door to metro ), a SHORT less than 5 minute car / bus/ uber ride and four different  buses (running approximately every 15 minutes ) that stop at our neighborhood entrance...all going non stop direct to the RED LINE Shady Grove Metro. 

Our home is also fantastically located within minutes of two major highway interstates.. I 370/ I 270 -- direct routes to downtown Washington DC, Great Falls,  Sugarloaf Mountain, Wineries, Berry Orchards, Antique Row in Downtown Frederick,  Whites Ferry,  and so many other wonderful historic landmarks that this area has to offer. We are also literally right off the exit to the newly built ICC ( I 200 ) interstate which provides direct access to I 95 to downtown Baltimore Harbor as well as the historic Fells Point District with its' charming shops and water front restaurants. 

There are so many wonderful and  extraordinary destinations in our area to explore that we would be happy to assist our guests  if needed in the planning of your vacation itinerary...We are here to help.
description.interaction: I live on the premises and thus  I’m available as much as you need but also respect your need to have time to yourself. If you need any assistance, please feel free to text me as I want you to be happy and comfortable.
description.house_rules:
It would be much appreciated if our guests could remove their shoes upon entering our home. 
-Our guests have full use of the kitchen, but we ask that you wash all dishes by hand and leave them to dry on the drying rack or dry with a towel. 
-If you eat at the wood table in the dining area alongside the kitchen, please use the provided placemats to protect the table from heat damage. 
-We do not permit smoking inside of our home, but we have no problem with smoking in any of our shared outdoor spaces.
NOTE to ALL of our guests:  We THANK YOU  in advance for bringing  a necessary photo ID ( drivers license )  or passport to be reviewed at check in.

hosts.about: We wish you a very nice stay at our cosy home!

recent.comments: Laurent’s home was the perfect place for our extended family gathering. Just walking into the house had kind of a special feeling, with all of the special garden features that were framing the front of the house - very European feeling.  The amount of space was perfect - everyone had their own bedroom AND bathroom. The kitchen had all the things needed to cook and we love to cook when we are on vacation. Even though Laurent was on vacation in a different time zone, he was very responsive to any questions we had. There were places for both the adults and the kids to enjoy their time. It didn’t feel like an Airbnb, it felt like a home.  The attention to detail that Laurent pays to many aspects of his Airbnb make it a very special place to stay.

items.comments: Laurent’s home was the perfect place for our extended family gathering. Just walking into the house had kind of a special feeling, with all of the special garden features that were framing the front of the house - very European feeling.  The amount of space was perfect - everyone had their own bedroom AND bathroom. The kitchen had all the things needed to cook and we love to cook when we are on vacation. Even though Laurent was on vacation in a different time zone, he was very responsive to any questions we had. There were places for both the adults and the kids to enjoy their time. It didn’t feel like an Airbnb, it felt like a home.  The attention to detail that Laurent pays to many aspects of his Airbnb make it a very special place to stay.

Laurent's home is spotless, private, friendly and gracious.  The kitchen, baths, bedrooms and great room were perfect for our family.  The large table that seated 12 was ideal for family meals and games. The wi-fi was strong and available throughout the home. Laurent was quickly responsive via email, and his neighbor/friend Steve was available on site if we needed anything.  This home is a private residence with personal art objects throughout.  We respected Laurent's request for certain personal objects that were off limits to guests.  The deck and large yard are also lovely and accessible. The yard amenities, as the trampoline and deck furniture, were much enjoyed.  
We definitely recommend this home for those who prefer a convenient, modern Bethesda location with a large, well-equipped kitchen, great room, private bedrooms with en suite baths, ambiance throughout the property and easy parking.

This Bethesda home was a great find for our family vacation. Laurent was flexible and responsive and ensured we had everything setup for our arrival (including milk, eggs, bread and cereal for first breakfast!). The place was amazing with a great art collection and lots to do as a family. It was just 20-25 mins to DC and would highly recommend to anyone with a large party for their DC vacation.

The house was beyond our expectations. My friends and me like the house space specifically the living room and the basement. The kitchen is fully equipped, and we enjoyed our breakfast in bright dining room. Laurent is a wonderful, well organized, and transparent host. I didn’t meet him physically since he was in Europe, but he emailed me back instantly whenever I need his help. Thanks Laurent! Keep the good job! I recommend the house for family and friends gathering, you will love it.

OMG , beautiful, wonderful, warm , inviting, cozy and more
We loved every min. of our stay 
Everything was more then we expected ,  so very happy Thank you Laurent

Lauren’t place is such a beautiful home that is both stylish and fun! It is also very spacious, simple gorgeous! I had high expectations from the pictures but can safely say that they were even exceeded when we arrived. The house is also very well located in a beautiful neighbourhood and close (by car) to all necessary amenities. It was the perfect location for our family reunion. Laurent is also a fantastic host, very easy to deal with, contributing to a very smooth and successful trip for us!  Can’t recommend enough!
Stunning house, equipped with everything we needed and above.

description.summary: Our home will give you all the comfort you can dream of. Located only 10 minutes walk from Bethesda Metro and city center, you are minutes away from vibrating DC while enjoying a quiet environment!
description.space:
Our home offers 6 independent bedrooms with 5 baths. It has many private spaces so each member can relax or have fun.
The living room is a huge open space that allows great family&friends diners.
description.access: Our entire home will be opened to you.
description.notes:
We have a large driveway and private street parking that allows many cars to park.
Our home is powered by solar energy so we are proud to be green!
Our yard offers a bocce/petanque ball field, a trampoline, a firepit with enough to sit 8 to 10 people around it and swingers for kids.
description.neighborhood: Bethesda is a great DC neighborhood! Located 20 min away by metro or car, you will enjoy both the calm and green of the location together with a lovely downtown city center with all the food stores and restaurant you can dream of!
description.transit: Our house is located 10 min walk from the metro. Buses come in front of the house and will allow you to reach both downtown Bethesda in 3 min and DC in 25 minutes.
description.interaction: We will be delighted to help you with your stay and discover DC and its beautiful surroundings.
description.house_rules:
This is our primary residence and we want you to feel at home! Ask us for anything you would like to use.
We make our honey and have two beehives in the back yard. Our bees are italien docile bees. If you do not bother them they will not bother you!
It is our please to offer you some of our homemade honey! Let us know if you want some.

hosts.about: After 20+ years in the technology field in the legal industry, I have decided to pursue my dream of owning and running a B&B.  This dream combines many of my true passions including meeting people, travel (have been to approx. 70 countries) and my love for cooking.  I'm trying to make this B&B experience something special; something different than other B&B's bringing in a very social aspect and an open arm/welcoming environment.  If you're open to having an experience where you feel more like you're staying with great friends where you can be yourself and truly relax and enjoy life, then I hope you will please consider having your next B&B stay at Hummingbird Inn.  Me, and my faithful and super friendly Inn Dog, Tru are waiting to welcome you in our home!

recent.comments: Great little place with a nice breakfast.

items.comments: Great little place with a nice breakfast.

The Hummingbird Inn is an incredibly worthwhile and memorable place to visit. Every where you look there is something both interesting and beautiful to look at - from the paintings, prints, and carvings to the gorgeous hardwood furniture - including a 100 year old, tuned piano - to the claw foot tubs and antique lighting fixtures. The house is clean, full of light, and surrounded by an epic wraparound porch and beautiful pollinator gardens. The bed was super comfy! We live on a farm in the country and I was so inspired by the plantings I ran to the garden store as soon as I got home. Breakfast was special. Our waitress, Bev, was a fascinating person to talk to and the courses were all delicious and well prepared. Eric and Michael, were so friendly and creative and full of helpful tips. We were intrigued by the events, murder mysteries, and dark dinners they organize. The Inn is a unique destination and we loved our stay. Thank you so much
Loved this place. the bed and shower in my room were awesome. Also, loved the porch swing. Easton in general is a cute town so if you’re passing through check it out!

The Hummingbird Inn is fantastic and Eric, the owner, is a fabulous host.  I loved the attention to detail and thoughtful touches in the room and at breakfast (and omg, the food - so good). He has great information on local restaurants, too.  The St. Michaels Room was sooooo comfy, and the jacuzzi tub and shower....can't wait to go back for both of those.
Loved this Inn!   Perfect place for a quiet getaway. Wonderful house and room!  Eric was a fabulous  host!
Such an incredible stay. Loved the claw foot tub and the breakfast was to die for.

My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Hummingbird Inn in the St. Michaels room. The room and bathroom were very comfortable and we enjoyed all of the thoughtful touches from Eric throughout the entire experience— from welcoming us on arrival and tips on places to eat/explore to the delicious breakfast. The other staff at breakfast were also very welcoming and kind. The Inn is very close to the central part of Easton and you can walk to cafes, restaurants, boutiques, and art galleries. We recommend Hummingbird Inn and hope to stay here again soon!

description.summary:
The St. Michaels Room (2nd fl) features:
- King bed 
- 2 chairs
- Cable TV 
- Central AC/heat 
- Ceiling fan 
- HEPA air filtration system 
- Bubble-jet deep soaking claw foot tub 
- Walk-In shower w/high-pressure rainfall showerhead 
- Heated towel racks
description.space: The St. Michaels Room, on the second floor, has a King pillow-top bed with down comforter and pillows (the bed can be split into two twin beds if preferred). With one of the largest bathrooms at the Inn, St. Michaels offers the only bubble-jet/Jacuzzi slipper clawfoot tub on the property, a large, separate shower room with a high-pressure, massaging rainfall shower head, and a heated towel rack.  A cozy sitting area, central air/heating, a ceiling fan, HEPA air-filtration, and TV complete this warm and inviting space.
description.access:
Guess will have plenty of options at Hummingbird Inn to hang out in from the large guest parlor with a cozy fireplace, game selection and lending library to the peaceful tranquility of our private Victorian Garden.  

And of course, no stay is complete without spending some time on our 1000 sq ft wrap around porch! Chances are you will usually find your host  Innkeeper here nightly and you’re welcome to join him for some “Porch Time”. Come and listen to some music, share a lite snack or chat over an enjoyable glass of wine or other enjoyable refreshment.
description.notes:
****************
PLEASE READ
****************

-	Hummingbird Inn has a strict "Non-Discriminatory Policy".  We welcome everyone regardless basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, in any of its activities or operation.

We also extend a special welcome to the LGBTQ community, their friends, and their families.

- Hummingbird Inn has a 3/4-acre property available for guests to enjoy.  This includes a beautiful Victorian Garden with a fountain and soft music.  There are also several grassy lawn areas available to guests.

- Please note that we no longer allow children under the age of 12 to stay at the Inn.

- Well behaved dogs allowed ($25/dog/night). Dog sitting available ($15/hr). Outdoor grassy play area is available. Dogs are welcome in any area on the property. Dog owners are responsible for any damage to the property caused by their dog.

- Room Rates are based on Double Occupancy.  Some rooms can accommodate additional guests.  There is an Additional Guest fee of $56/guest/night.  

- Registered Guests may invite non-registered guests to join them for breakfast.  There is a "Breakfast Only" fee of $24.00/person/meal.  Guests must notify Innkeeper in advance (minimum 24 hours advanced notice) as dining room space is limited.
description.neighborhood: We have 6 unique en suite rooms with delightful Victorian architecture, traditional details, and modern luxury. All rooms include central air conditioning/heating, ceiling fans, large windows overlooking the property and/or the historic district, HEPA Air Filtration System, sound proofing, private bathrooms with heated towel racks, unlimited hot water, high pressure shower heads, some with claw-foot soaking tubs or bubble-jet massaging tub, ESA Eco-Friendly bath products (Glycerin Soap, Shampoo, Conditioner, Sower Gel, Body Lotion), hair dryers, shower caps and bath salts. Rooms all have Queen or King pillow-top mattresses, down pillows and comforters and additional seating areas. Some rooms also have working fireplaces.
description.transit: Being a small town, getting around is done either by foot, bike or car.  There is limited taxi service.  It's recommended that one has a car to be able to explore the neighboring towns as well.  Hummingbird Inn has a private off-street parking lot on the property which is available exclusively for Inn guests.
description.interaction: The Easton area offers a wide variety of things to do from shopping, dining, checking out art galleries and museums to the many festivals that are held in the town throughout the year.  We will be happy to help you find things to do and offer maps, brochures and other information regarding local and nearby attractions and events.
description.house_rules:
AirBnB does *not* collect the local county taxes upon booking. Therefore, guests will be required to pay the applicable tax amount upon check-out.

Hummingbird Inn has a strict "Non-Discriminatory Policy". We welcome everyone regardless basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, in any of its activities or operation.

We extend a special welcome to the LGBTQ community, their friends, and their families.

Hummingbird Inn has a 3/4-acre property available for guests to enjoy. This includes our Victorian Garden complete with fountain and ambient music.

Please note that while children and young adults are welcome, we do not provide a special Children's Breakfast Menu.

Well behaved dogs allowed ($20/dog/night). Dog sitting available ($10/hr). 

An outdoor grassy play area is available for guests and dogs. NOTE: The lawns are not completely fenced in - please be cautious if you allow your dog to run/play off-leash.

Dogs are welcome in any area on the property with the exception of the Guest Dining Room. Dog owners are responsible for any damage to the property caused by their dog.

Room Rates are based on Double Occupancy. Some rooms can accommodate additional guests. There is an Additional Guest Fee of $50/guest/night.

Registered Guests may invite non-registered guests to join them for breakfast. There is an "Ala Carte Breakfast Fee" of $24.00/person/meal. Guests must notify Innkeeper in advance if any ala carte breakfast request as dining room space is limited.

recent.comments: Loren’s place was clean and comfortable. As described and Loren went out of her way to accommodate. Would highly recommend.

items.comments: Loren’s place was clean and comfortable. As described and Loren went out of her way to accommodate. Would highly recommend.
Loren was a kind host. Her house was updated and comfortable. Thanks for your hospitality.

This was my 2nd stay here! This place is wonderful! Peaceful and perfect to get some well needed rest. Super clean. I love staying here when I’m in the area.  Loren was very responsive. It was a last minute booking and she was very accommodating.

A decently cheap place to rest your head for the night. Walls are very thin and road traffic can be very noisy. The living situation in the house is a little unclear. While staying I wasn’t sure if the host living on site or if the property was being managed by another. The stay just felt a little odd.
Great Host. Just as described. Thank you
Great place to stay in Hurlock!

Loren was great, what a sweet lovely woman. The room is exactly as pictured it’s super clean, it’s super quiet,  and Loren is Super accommodating. 

The only sad thing is that the place is booked and I can’t come back the week I need to! But I’ll definitely be returning! Thanks for a great stay!

recent.comments:
Great location. Very walkable. Close to coffee shops, bars, restaurants, and art galleries. I was able to park my car and walk from the house to Penn Square in about 15 mins. 
The room has a large private en suite bathroom with a steam room and washer/dryer. 
Zu was super responsive whenever I sent a message. 
Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here.

items.comments:
Great location. Very walkable. Close to coffee shops, bars, restaurants, and art galleries. I was able to park my car and walk from the house to Penn Square in about 15 mins. 
The room has a large private en suite bathroom with a steam room and washer/dryer. 
Zu was super responsive whenever I sent a message. 
Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here.

Super cute room in a lovely residential neighborhood — about a 10-20 minute walk to most everything we did in Lancaster. The room is large and has lots of natural light, and the bathroom is enormous. The whole space was very clean, with lots of extra linens & towels. Zu was quick to respond when I had questions and one small issue with the entry code was resolved within fifteen minutes. One note: the room is within the house and doesn’t have an internal lock. Generally when staying in a room in someone else’s house, I prefer when there’s a lock on the door — that said, we felt very safe and didn’t have any issues. All around a lovely place!
Great location, loved the sauna, comfortable bed and pretty quiet despite being in the city.

Great spot to explore downtown. You’re in a cute little neighborhood with Victorian houses. Plus there’s an awesome breakfast place down the street called On Orange.

Room was comfy and pretty clean, but the bathroom trash can and mini fridge wasn’t emptied. Otherwise, a good stay overall.

Came to Lancaster for F&M’s alumni weekend and this place has the best location that you may easily walk to the campus and the downtown within 15mins. Clean, quiet, and cozy, and the sauna is definitely a charm. Zu also has the cutest cats — they will not get close to the guest room, but always spying on the guests lol.

Nice area, centrally located, with much within walking distance. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. More than enough towels and pillows were provided, as well as bathroom essentials. Having a private bathroom makes all the difference!

There was only one small glitch in that the overhead light/fan wasn't working. Zu was very quick in responding to me about the light, although she happened to be away when I was there and so couldn't fix it. There were two lamps in the main room, which helped.

The traffic could be very noisy in the evening. It wasn't constant, but fairly frequent, with some vehicles revving down the street loud enough to drown out whatever I was watching on my laptop. But I wasn't familiar with the area and how noisy it might be before booking.

Absolutely perfect Airbnb, in the cutest part of this storybook town. If you want to truly experience Lancaster, stay with Zu. 

The private steam sauna is just cherry on top. One of my favorite mini vacays. Zu is very understanding and kind and responsive. 

Go on walks while you are staying here, the town is incredibly cute.

description.summary: Welcome! Thank you for your interest in the space in our home. The residential wing includes a comfortable private bedroom attached to a bathroom with sauna in a beautiful three-story house. We are located an easy 10-minute walk to downtown, F&M, and just a few steps away is Chestnut Hill Café, a popular breakfast and lunch spot. In addition to Chad and I, two kittens live in the house but are not allowed in the Airbnb space.
description.space: The space includes a private bathroom with sauna.
description.access:
A lockbox has been installed in order to accomodate safe and remote access to the house, and guests are able to get the key anytime after check-in time. For your safety and ours, access to the kitchen is no longer allowed until further notce, but we have installed a mini fridge in the room. For longer stays, we offer plates and cutlery if requested.

To access your quarters, take the stairs immediately in front of the lobby, make a U-turn at the first landing, go up four steps, and your accommodations are through the French doors.
description.notes: For a quick overview of Lancaster, check out the video "My Lancaster: All About Lancaster County, PA" on youtube. To learn about Lancaster's Market (rated among the top 10 worldwide by CNN Travel), look for "Lancaster Central Market 125" on youtube as well. Chad, who co-hosts this Airbnb listing, worked on both videos in filming, editing, and sound production. He can also tell you pretty much everything you want to know about Lancaster.
description.neighborhood: The Chestnut Hill neighborhood is prized, not only for its charming residents and local businesses (a popular café and an art gallery within the block), but also for its ideal location within walking distance to most city destinations.
description.transit: Walking is the best way to get around. We are located an easy 5-10 min walk from almost everything. Uber and cab rides are readily available and, if taking short trips within the city, not expensive. They're actually a better alternative to driving downtown and looking for parking.
description.interaction: Check-in time is anytime after 3pm, but please give us your arrival time the day before or morning of so we can plan. Feel free to text or call with any questions.
description.house_rules: We welcome everyone who agrees to the following shared space rules: no smoking, no pets (we have a very friendly shih-tzu, BaoBao, who likes to be the only pet in the house), no overnight guests, and basic cleanliness. Thank you for making your stay and our hosting a pleasant venture!

hosts.about: Aerial dancer/choreographer, yogini,  author, professor of dance at Towson University.  Love to travel and hear about others traveling through.   My roots are in Vermont but have lived in Manhattan, Philadelphia, and Boulder, Colorado.

recent.comments: I was a guest at Jayne's home during the summer of 2022 as I was working an internship. I found the neighborhood quite peaceful. The house was tidy and well-furnished. Jayne is a wonderfully kind host. The only reason I could see to not stay at Jayne's place would be a severe cat allergy.

items.comments: I was a guest at Jayne's home during the summer of 2022 as I was working an internship. I found the neighborhood quite peaceful. The house was tidy and well-furnished. Jayne is a wonderfully kind host. The only reason I could see to not stay at Jayne's place would be a severe cat allergy.
Place is great, very clean and has everything you need. Jayne was also very helpful since the beginning, available at all times whenever I had any questions. Totally recommend it.
Very kind.  Great communication!  Thank you so much!

Jayne's house is the most unique and lovely Victorian home I've ever seen in Baltimore. Fun trinkets and art of all kinds in spirited colors adorn every room. My bedroom was very comfortable from the plush carpet to the extra down pillows. The windows look out on gorgeous grounds full of storybook trees. Jayne is uniquely multitalented, cares deeply about the space, and keeps it sparkling. The cats are timid and sweet. The location is great. A hidden gem.

I lived in Jayne’s house for 2 months and I had great time there. Jayne is a great host and we chat and have conversation very often during my stay and she also offers me some tips regarding hiking and places to go to around Baltimore. It is located in a really safe area with safe neighborhoods, which is one of the main reasons I choose to stay here prior to my arrival to Baltimore. Self-parking is always available on the street. Thanks Jayne for being such a wonderful host:)

I stayed here for seven weeks, and I absolutely loved it. The two porches and the beautiful backyard are my favorite part of the house, besides the two wonderful kitties! If you are a cat person, it will be a little slice of heaven. Relaxing on the back deck is unbeatable, and I would say that the house and amenities could not be rivaled for the price.  I would definitely consider staying here again.
Good location, good space

description.summary: Our home is close to Towson University, and other colleges/universities in Baltimore including: Goucher College, Johns Hopkins University. 9 foot high ceilings beautiful hardwood floors with crown molding.  Our backyard is an oasis.....very peaceful with a large goldfish/frog pond.  We have two cats: Corvie and Nikolais.
description.space: The room has been recently renovated with Zen color tones for a more peaceful and restful stay.
description.access: Parking is on the street or a parking pad/driveway is available on first come first serve basis.  I usually park my car next to the house on the street.  Laundry room is available for long term guest (more than 1 week). Kitchen use has limited availability, depending on when I'm using the kitchen.
description.notes: Must like cats and not be allergic
description.neighborhood: Our neighborhood is mostly families with children and some elderly who have lived in the neighborhood for generations.
description.transit: It takes about 10 minutes to walk over to the bus stop on York Road.
description.interaction: If I'm home, I am available to answer any questions about the neighborhood (where to get groceries, etc.)

I especially found a lot of peace sitting on her back porch and in the backyard with all the crickets, frogs and trees. Jayne is a wonderful person full of stories and many talents, and I'm lucky to have gotten to know her. Communication was always great and open, and we were able to find a good balance with sharing the common areas. I would highly recommend staying here!

The home is beautiful and in a great location, and Jayne is a wonferful host. Highly recommended!
Awesome place! Jayne is wonderful

Jayne's place is very quaint, with lots of character.  The house is over 100 years old, but is in excellent condition with lots of personal family touches.  There is a lovely covered front porch with a swing and screen in back porch. There is also a little frog pond out in the large back yard.  The room reminded me of my grandma's house and was very cozy. Jayne is very friendly and accommodating.

Great value Airbnb with a super friendly host.  It is a shared space with 2 other units so restroom access requires a bit of mindfulness, but otherwise the space has everything one expects.  The neighborhood is very walkable and there are convenience stores less than 5 minutes away, which was nice to have.  No complaints to share, highly recommend this listing.

We were visiting Towson to get my daughter organized for college. Jaynes home was in the perfect and it was delightful. Jayne is very kind and suggested many places for us to visit. She has an oasis of a backyard with a gorgeous pond. Great for quieting the mind. We will definitely stay here again!
Our stay at Jayne's was nice and easy. Quiet,  tranquil home. Cute cuties and a wonderful host. Thanks again!!

description.summary: Master Queen Bed in 4 bdrm home, screened in deck, 1/2 acre backyard with fountain goldfish/frog pond.  Remodeled kitchen, bath, baby grand piano.  Yoga studio owner/Towson U professor.  Two cats (Corvie and Nikolais)
description.space: Our home has been creatively decorated and the foyer entrance has Grandma's vintage hats from the 1930/40's.  All walls have been hand brushed and toned with various shades of warm secondary colors (greens, orange, purples). We have a gas fireplace that blows heat in the winter to keep the house cozy warm.
description.access: Wireless internet.  Parking is on the street or a parking pad/driveway is available on first come first serve basis.  I usually park my car next to the house on the street.  Laundry room is available for long term guest (more than 1 week). Kitchen use has limited availability as I am usually home during eating hours.
description.notes:
Please be respectful of my home and ask before you help yourself to things. 
An A/C window unit is available in the summer months.  Please only turn it on when the temp. outdoors is 80 or above and while you are in the room and please turn it off when you leave to conserve energy and electric costs.
description.neighborhood: It's family oriented.  We have a strong community association and everyone watches out for each other.  Some of our neighbors have been here for 3 generations or more.   We're close to grocery stores and restaurants.  Ask me for recommendations.
description.transit: Close to Towson University, (1.5 miles) JHU (4 miles) YMCA of Towson (2 miles). Buses on York Road will take you anywhere in Baltimore.  It's about 3/4 mile walk to the bus stop.
description.interaction: When around and available, I enjoy visiting with my guests to answer questions about the area, where to buy groceries, etc.
description.house_rules: No smoking.  We are a quiet household.  We don't stay up late, and rise fairly early (5:30am).  Since COVID, I've moved my yoga studio into the basement, and hold classes downstairs now when not teaching at TU.  The house needs to be quiet during the day without much activity in the kitchen as it's right over the basement studio.

name: Chateau de L'Amour Retreat
title: Warrenton, Virginia

hosts.about: Living Design is a collective of regenerative residences and retreat spaces across the U.S., owned and curated by a team of artists, biologists, educators, impact investors, and social innovators. These spaces are an expression of our commitment to travel like we live, work, and play -- in consonance with nature and community. The call for purposeful and conscious travel is growing exponentially, as people are increasingly mobile yet are deeply committed to nurturing the social and natural ecosystems we explore. Living Design Spaces responds to this call, providing beautiful energizing spaces designed in harmony with the natural resources and communities in which they are located. We invite you to plan an experience in one of our spaces to deepen, rejuvenate, and expand what is most important to you. We treat each place as we do our own, with love, generosity, reciprocity and living by original principles.

description.summary: Chateau de L'Amour welcomes the harmonious planet conscience traveler.  The Chateau is one of many locations hosted and designed by Living Design Networks led by a collaborative group of artists, biologists, educators and impact investors who model regenerative practices where we live, in how we develop our companies and initiatives and products and services and how we travel.  We treat each place as we do our own, with love, generosity, reciprocity and living by original principals. Welcome!
description.space: Chateau de L’amour is an oasis in the Virginia countryside, between Washington, DC and the Blue Ridge Mountains. This home has been a space for our family to enjoy city and mountains, a place where we have hosted executive retreats, intensives, and other small events. As our kids have now left the nest and we travel extensively for our work, we are making this beautiful family home available as part of the Living Design Network of homes and retreat spaces across the U.S.
description.access: Guests have access to the entire home, except to the owners library.  There are also a couple of closets that are locked where we store additional items and inventory.
description.neighborhood: The Chateau is nestled in a cul-de-sac.  We have also created a small park to the side of the house for evening fires and relaxation in nature.
description.transit: There is parking available on the driveway.  We usually get 5-6 vehicles parked safely, and you can also use the street for additional parking.
description.interaction: Your host, Angela de la Meza, is a resident artist and has access to the house and will pop in if available and if needed.  As an artist, Angela is also available for artistic and creative experiences.  Please inquire.

description.summary: Our historic Farm is nestled in 700 acres of the Piedmont foothills. Your Farm Stay, in the stunning 1780s Manor home, lets you experience life on a working cattle operation. The home is decorated with period antiques, yet all modern comforts await you. Stroll the gardens, fields & forests. Fish in your private ponds. During your Private Farm Tour we'll meet the Wagyu and 4-wheel to the mountain top to enjoy the incredible views.  Private Wagyu dinner avail. Wineries all around!  Stable avail.
description.space:
Located on 700 acres in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, our farm is steeped in Virginia history, predating the Civil War. The stunning Manor home, which was built in the late 1700's with additions added in the 1800's and renovated in 2014, has been lovingly and painstakingly preserved.  Although the Farm is the most photographed and painted farm in the County and has been featured in many articles & on garden tours, until now, the home has never offered FarmTour & Stay.   
To embrace its historic character, this magnificent home has been decorated with period antiques, yet includes all modern comforts. Each bedroom has its own theme and unique decor - from the Fox Room to the Blue Room.  The Master Bedroom's Turkish rugs and its adjoining master bath decorated with a wall-sized Turkish mosaic, provides a comfortable, quiet place to rejuvenate.  Take tea in the parlor and loosen up your rusty-fingers on the Steinway baby grand.  Relax or jump on the computer in the Reading Room paneled in original cherrywood harvested from the property.  Whether you're sipping a fine Virginia bourbon in the Cherry Room circa 1830, enjoying a gourmet meal on the 16-person dining table circa mid-1700's, or chilling with a movie in the modern basement theatre on comfortable, plush sofas,  you will feel comfortable and immersed  in a history few will ever have the opportunity to experience. 
Once you're settled in, we'll take you on your Private Farm Tour to see our farm operations,  meet our friendly Wagyu cattle, and 4-wheel to the top of the mountain to talk about the farm and our husbandry practices, while enjoying the most memorable views in the area. 
After the tour, you're off to explore.  Right in your backyard is the stone house where George Washington passed thru while surveying nearby land in 1769. You may prefer to fish in the 6 ponds on the property that await your prize-winning catch (& release) or hike through the vast pastures & forests. For the cowfolks, join us to feed the cattle and tend to the barn animals. Come evening, enjoy the beautiful outdoor terrace with a glass of local Virginia wine while watching the sunset over the Blue Ridge mountains.  Weather & season permitting, the full-size pool, cabana, bathhouse, basketball courts, and gourmet outdoor kitchen with Italian brick oven is available for your use.
The home's six bedrooms and 6.5 bathrooms  accommodates several couples or a large family easily.  
The Farm is close to Great Meadows for the Gold Cup, restaurants and shopping in Upperville, Marshall, and Middleburg, endless hiking trails, including the Appalachian Trail, and more wineries than you could visit in a week. During your Farm Stay, we can arrange a Private Gourmet Wagyu Dinner with one of our Resident Chefs.  You may never want to leave and we'll count the days 'til your return! 
Note: In order to ensure your safety and that of our animals, only the guests on your registered Farm Stay may stay and/or enjoy the amenities on the Farm during your Farm Stay.
description.notes: Stables and parking available.
description.neighborhood: Farms, wineries, forests... it doesn't get any better.
description.interaction: We will receive our guests when they arrive to show them around,  look over the rules and accessible areas, and confirm the scheduled Farm Tour.  Guests are welcome to spend time feeding with us on the morning after their arrival and will have lots of opportunities to enjoy a bunch or a little of Life on The Farm Stay.  We will be available and working on-site during your stay, so please reach out when you have any questions.
description.house_rules:
This property is an actual farm.  There will be farm operations going on as daily operations. During your Private Farm Tour, we will ask that you complete our Agritourism waiver form, available ahead of time by email.  
ATTENTION:  Under Virginia law, there is no liability for an injury to or death of a participant in an agritourism activity conducted at this agritourism location if such injury or death results from the inherent risks of the agritourism activity. Inherent risks of agritourism activities include, among others, risks of injury inherent to land, equipment, and animals, as well as the potential for you to act in a negligent manner that may contribute to your injury or death. You are assuming the risk of participating in this agritourism activity.

Highly, highly(!) recommend this lovely BnB to anyone looking for a comfortable and peaceful getaway with really thoughtful hospitality.

description.house_rules:
General Policies
•	Check-in time is 4:00 – 7:00 PM. Checkout time is 11:00 AM.
•	A credit card is required to establish your reservation.
•	A $25 nonrefundable deposit will be charged at the time the reservation is made.
•	If "Worry-Free Booking" or "Travel Protection" is added to the reservation, the entire amount is collected at the time the reservation is made.
•	We are a non-smoking establishment ... no smoking, no vaping. Smoking is permitted outside in designated areas.
•	Pets are accommodated on a limited basis. Our Pet Policy is below.
•	All major Credit Cards are accepted.
•	Guest Room rates are based on double occupancy.
•	A $50 extra person/3rd person fee is applied for guests over the age of 10.
•	A $50 fee is applied if a rollaway or sleeper sofa is needed.
•	A $25 fee is applied for early check-in between 2:00 PM and 4:00 PM
•	A $25 fee is applied for late check-out between 11:00 AM and 1:00 PM
•	Ask about our Military discount and Government/Per Diem rates.
•	Guests who overlook their reservation (a 'no-show') are still responsible for the entire reservation amount.
•	Early departures will be charged the full amount of the room reservation.


Cancellation Policy
•	We require notification for a cancellation as follows:
•	Group Reservations of three or more rooms – by 7:00 PM 30 days prior to check-in date
•	All other reservations – by 7:00 PM 7 days prior to check-in date

If you must cancel your room reservation, please note the following:
•	If "Worry-Free Booking" or "Travel Protection" was added to the reservation and you need to file a cancellation claim for the warranty service, please use the link provided in the email confirming your reservation.
•	For all other reservations, if a cancellation is made fewer than 7 days prior to your arrival date, you will be charged your full reservation amount.
•	If you are a "NO SHOW," you are responsible for the entire amount of the reservation, as the room was held specifically for you.


Pet Policies
•	Pheasant Field Bed and Breakfast offers pet friendly lodging as follows:
•	Pet fee is $25 per pet/night.
•	Limit two pets per room.
•	Pets must be kept on a leash.
•	Pets are not permitted in the main house. Pet friendly rooms are: Pet-sylvania Room, Country Comfort, and The Cottage.
•	Owners must clean up pet waste. Pet walk areas and a pet waste receptacle is clearly marked.
•	Pets must be fed on a mat or outside. Mats are provided in each room.
•	You must crate your pet if left alone in your room.
•	If your pet is a barker, please take measures to ensure the quiet atmosphere for our other guests.
•	Please discourage your pet from climbing on the bed and furniture. Please cover the furniture or bedding with a sheet or towel if your pet is a climber.
•	Special pet towels are available for your use. Do not use bath towels to •	•	wipe muddy or dirty paws.
•	We reserve the right to decline your pet. We limit pets to certain sizes & breeds.
•	Unsociable pets (barking, chewing, showing aggression) may be asked to leave.
•	If a cat litter box is used, please contain the cat litter in the box.

Horse Hotel Policies
Guests traveling with horses can use our two roomy paddocks complete with run-in shelters.

Please note the following horse policies:
•	There is a $35 per horse/night fee.
•	Negative Coggins Test documentation is required upon arrival.
•	Please empty the water buckets before you depart.

description.summary: Escape to luxury at our exquisite farmhouse Airbnb! With 5 bedrooms, 3.5 modern baths, an indoor pool, hot tub, piano, and entertainment area, it's perfect for up to 20 guests. Ideal for large groups seeking a lavish nature getaway, our farmhouse offers modern amenities and high-end finishes, ensuring an unforgettable experience. Book your stay now for the ultimate luxury retreat!
description.neighborhood: Nestled in the picturesque Secluded Shangri-la Villa, this stunning property boasts breathtaking natural beauty and serene surroundings. Located amidst lush greenery and rolling hills, this location offers a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The area is renowned for its stunning views, diverse wildlife, and natural landmarks, including Blue Mountain and Lehigh Gorge State Park. With numerous hiking trails, fishing spots, and outdoor recreation areas nearby, it's the perfect destination for outdoor enthusiasts. Enjoy the peaceful surroundings, crisp mountain air, and panoramic views of the countryside.
description.transit:
Discover a world of nearby attractions, restaurants, and markets from the comfort of Secluded Shangri-la Villa. Outdoor enthusiasts can explore the stunning Blue Mountain Ski Resort, Beltzville State Park, and Palmerton Memorial Park, all located within a few miles of the property. For indoor entertainment, check out the nearby Palmerton Community Festival and the Carbon County Historical Society. Sample the local cuisine at The Stone Row Pub & Eatery, P.J. Whelihan's Pub + Restaurant, The West End Saloon, and The Bagel Experience, all just a short drive away. Stock up on groceries at the nearby Giant Food Stores, Walmart Supercenter, and Weis Markets. Here are the distances to these nearby attractions and amenities from Secluded Shangri-la Villa:

Blue Mountain Ski Resort: 3 miles
Beltzville State Park: 5 miles
Palmerton Memorial Park: 2 miles
Palmerton Community Festival: 2 miles
Carbon County Historical Society: 4 miles
The Stone Row Pub & Eatery: 1 mile
P.J. Whelihan's Pub + Restaurant: 2 miles
The West End Saloon: 2 miles
The Bagel Experience: 3 miles
Giant Food Stores: 4 miles
Walmart Supercenter: 5 miles
Weis Markets: 5 miles

Experience the ultimate vacation getaway at Secluded Shangri-la Villa, with endless possibilities for adventure and relaxation just a stone's throw away!
description.interaction:
Welcome to my vacation home, where your comfort and satisfaction is my top priority. Although I understand you may be seeking a peaceful retreat, rest assured that I'm always here to assist you with anything you may need during your stay.

I strongly believe in giving my guests space and privacy, but I'm also just a phone call away if you have any questions or concerns. Whether it's a quick fix for a property issue or recommendations for local hotspots, I'm happy to help make your stay as seamless as possible.

So sit back, relax, and enjoy your time in this beautiful space. I'm committed to ensuring your stay is nothing short of amazing and memorable.

Thank you for choosing my vacation home, and I'm excited to welcome you to your home away from home.
