name: Sunnybrae Mansion is family and pet friendly.
title: Milford, Delaware

hosts.about: I am a farmer and business man and I love to play golf.

recent.comments:
Lynn was a great, responsive host. He gave us a tour at the beginning that was interesting and enlightening. 

The place was a pretty good fit for us.  It's elegant and roomy. We had a large group and ended up using all 9 bedrooms. It was so nice that even though we had kids with naptimes, the house was big enough that we weren't bothering each other.  The kids loved exploring the many rooms and historic artifacts.  There were large rooms for us all to hang out and play games, and also small rooms if we wanted to be by ourselves and read a book.

There were a few cons despite the many pros. The carpets were a bit dirty, there was some missed trash under one of the beds, and our bathroom smelled a bit. Location-wise, it took about 45+ mins to get to Rehoboth beach, so we ended up just heading to Slaughter Beach and looking for rocks/shells. There wasn't a whole lot to do in the area, although we did hit some local restaurants.

However, we really had a great time and would recommend!

Sunnybrae is a Beautiful & Historic Mansion that is located on a 90 acre estate in lower DE.  (first floor handicap accessible) There are many attractions nearby, such as beaches, parks, casinos, & shopping.
Parties and events such as weddings, etc are allowed and have additional fees.
description.space:
Attached are plenty of pictures of our relaxing but stimulating grounds, antiques, and unique history. Though we have the ambiance of an affluent home in the 1930's, we have the conveniences of today, such as air conditioning, television, and wifi. We also have some outdoor fun you can use such as croquet or corn hole, and plenty of indoor fun too with our board games such as chess and checkers, card games, billiards table, foosball table, gaming table, and antique organ and grand piano. 
We have 2 basic wedding packages.
1) for all day Saturday 8 am to midnight is $4000. 
2) to rent Sunnybrae for all weekend is $6000 from Friday at 3 pm to Sunday noon. This includes Friday and Saturday overnight stays for up to 15 people.
Both wedding packages include full use of the Mansion and grounds and 
include 100 chairs and 20 rectangular tables with linens.
We have caterer, flower, and many other vendors that we can refer you to or you can use your own vendors.
description.access:
You have access to the whole Mansion
as per the photos attached and use of the beautiful grounds.
description.notes:
Seasonal traffic is heavier during the Summer and Holiday months, give yourself ample time and drive safely please.
Sunnybrae is handicap accessible. 
It is also a smoke-free establishment, but we do have large urns at each doorway for smokers to put their cigarettes or cigars out. Please do not leave them in the grass, we don’t want to hurt the wildlife around us.
description.neighborhood: The special thing about this Mansion is that it is located in the middle of a 90 acre Estate, so it makes it easy to getaway with the Beautiful Views and nice privacy.
description.transit: Access to the main highways is easy as they are close by.
description.interaction:
We will be there at your convenience.
Tours of this Beautiful, Historic and Charming Mansion are available upon request.
description.house_rules:
Please strip the sheets and pillow covers off your bed and leave them next to the bed along with the used towels before you leave.
Please tidy up the Mansion and take all trash from the kitchens and bathrooms. Take the trash out to the large green trash cans before you leave. If something did not work correctly or if there are any damages, please let us know.
Please no lighting of candles or the fireplace in the Mansion.

name: Wild and Wonderful Barndominium
title: French Creek, West Virginia

gallery.caption: Lots of stain glass and repurposed items. You can see an old coffee grinder made into a lamp.
Night time view of the barn. Lots of outside lighting and lit room above the silo guides you in at night !
The plush queen bed takes center stage.
The barn is surrounded by streams and ponds with gravel road access to nine more miles of trails.
12 ponds and three streams create lots of misty mornings and sunsets.
A side by side four wheeler awaits a morning ride ...
Barn has a gas furnace and four gas fireplaces that are connected to the gas well on our property. This is not your grandfathers drafty barn !
Just a beautiful snowy covered dawn morning here at the Wild and Wonderful Barndominium
The driveway to the barn features a "Mini Me" that also lights up at night !
Outdoor lights also keep away the varmints
Like a light house in the fog this room about the grain silo is a 13' diameter sattelite dish we rescued from along the road in 2008.
Note the stars above ..... no light pollution to keep you from seeing 10,000 points of light at night !
Fall colors here are spectacular! Come stay and leaf peep !
Entrance hall with gas fireplace for your coats and boots - bring your slippers !
Lots of decorations to make you feel your in a high class pub .... includes an orginal still and lots of "Squeezings" jugs !
Who needs overhead lights ? Let us know before you arrive and we can light up the place for you !
After a long ride you'll be looking for the bathroom
The bathroom has all the amenities you would expect of a fine hotel.

The double sink with a granite countertop and a full mirror has a cabinet base made out of wormy chestnut. Originally on the outside on the barn ,wormy chestnut which has been extinct since the early 1900's is characterized by little "worm holes "
Each cabinet features storage for your personal items.
Deluxe stack washer and dryer allows hiking,mudding,four wheeling and a slip and fall in the stream! Ironing board,iron and steamer too for prissing up !
Leave the bathroom and enter your entertainment area!
Come in from out of town and invite local friends,relatives and business associates for a meal. Cook yourself on a 36" professional gas stove or employ one of our many fine local caterers.
A studio Kwai piano for those with talent - if not pop in a CD and let it play itself.
If you remember the glazed tile silo in all the outside pictures imagine this  - we took a diamond bladed chopsaw and cut a doorway into it from the barn later adding a door.
Exit back out into the kitchen bar area.
When then istalled a firepit connected to the gas well for instant flame.
We the went to the top of the hill cutting down four 30 foot locust trees. We lowered them in with a crane adding a room you will see later overtop.
In renovating the barn the original floor on the second story was kept to be used as a ceiling and all the paneling are boards from the outside of the barn over 120 years old !

The carpet was purchased in Georgia from a distributor who had made it for a Cherokee Indian Casino in Biloxi, Mississippi that was flooded during Hurricane Katrina. We purchased the 150 feet left over  installing the 12 colors in a 24 x 36 room.
Shown here is the Kwai Studio Piano. This piano has quiet the history and many stories to tell.
Great sofa pit in front of a 65" flat screen. Use netflix or Dish network which is included in the price.
Third gas fireplace for chilly evenings
Curtains give privacy while allowing light through the many windows.

Bar / kitchen features stools for 14 another 65" TV with Google,wine coolers,double sinks,service for 24 in Fiesta dishes & silverware, beer and wine glasses,dishwasher, gas stove and oven and the list on. Entertain that special person or a crowd.
Even a martini table for two !
The King and Queen always need a throne. If the space was used as a ceremony space the chairs are perfect for the honorary couple.
Going upstairs the wormy oak and chestnut boards on each side were taken off the outside and denailed,washed,trimmed,rehung inside as paneling and then cleaned with Murphys oil soap.
This space is multi-functional. It's set up here for a wedding or ceremony to take place.
This area could be used for many uses as well. Buffet Table, Appetizers for game night and slumber parties, etc. Here its pictured to display our collection of barns.
After a long day the upstairs can also function as sleeping quarter for everyone to enjoy laughs and create memories at your slumber party :)
Extra bedding to create more sleeping room for additional guests.
The upstairs could also be used for game night or movie night with friends and family

The Eiffel Tower room, as we refer to it, Is the top of our silo. Multi functional as a couples romantic dinner for 2, a quaint card game or maybe a nightcap and take in the 270 degree view of the farm.
The Eifel Tower Room overlooking the 243 acre farm
The cave that is located on the property that can be accessed by the hiking trails or atv
Back outside for a moment there is a pond stocked with bluegill,small mouth bass,catfish and some other locals a three minute walk from the barn.
We had some amazing guests stay with us that attended Fashnaut and they were so generous and shared their pictures with us. So much rich history around the area.
Fashnaut Festival in Helvitia. Our guests made their own masks and attended. We are in a very quaint area but the festivals offer so much more than you could imagine.

hosts.about: A 68 year old single man with 40 years of successful professional sales and 25 years of real estate investing with properties in four states. I am born and raised in New Jersey and have traveled extensively for business. I speak  a smattering of eight languages with broken English being my best second langauge. I am comfortable in most ethnic and cultural situations as I consider myself a Foodie. I have been to some wonderful locations but have had my best time in back water places with down to earth people like here in West Virginia. I am very gregarious and a thoughtful host; I am an explorer of both belt ways and back roads by nature so if you come stay with me I will point you  in the right direction of what you want to experience or leave you alone to enjoy the properties tranquility.

recent.comments:
The Barndomenium is absolutely unique, beautiful and amazing. If you are looking to get away from the hustle and bustle in the city or suburbs this is the place to go. Very relaxing surroundings.
The place is very flexible you can have football game parties, weddings, events or just relaxing family time.
Craig is very friendly and has a lot to share about the area.

items.comments:
The Barndomenium is absolutely unique, beautiful and amazing. If you are looking to get away from the hustle and bustle in the city or suburbs this is the place to go. Very relaxing surroundings.
The place is very flexible you can have football game parties, weddings, events or just relaxing family time.
Craig is very friendly and has a lot to share about the area.

An absolutely amazing stay! Craig met us at the door and gave us a tour of the entire barn. He was super responsive and stopped to talk to us any time he saw us out. The land is absolutely gorgeous. Craig gave us a tour of the entire trails and woods. Between the barn, the cave/waterfall, the views, and the fishing, this place was more than beautiful. Craig was incredibly helpful and friendly the entire time. We will definitely be returning soon!

The barn is just as described with many unique features and comfortable amenities. The surrounding countryside is stunning. We brought our 4 wheeler to tour the property. The abundant flora and fauna did not disappoint in the various areas: woods, meadows, marshy fields, etc.. The cave and other natural features were beautiful as well. We had dinner and breakfast at Buck's diner just down the road and enjoyed the friendly staff and found the food to be much better than your typical American diner fare. The only thing I would change is to have a map of the property (even just a rough sketch) because although Craig gave us some directions, we were still a bit confused as to where his property boundaries were when riding the 4 wheeler. We weren't sure if the houses around were his rentals or someone else's property. It's just easier for me to have things on paper. Overall, was a beautiful place to visit, whether you like to hike or ride ATVs.

You have to have a warm welcome! I was hesitant to meet Craig for introductions because it would just be easier to get there and unpack, but the tour of the barn seriously made the difference between simply sleeping in a barn and the whole amazing experience. He told us all about the barn and it made the stay so much more special!
This establishment is BEAUTIFUL! Wonderful experience!

The "Barndominium" was a great place to stay.  The first floor man cave / kitchen was well put together and had plenty of seating.  The second floor ballroom / bedroom was huge, with lots of lighting options.

My family of 5 was looking for a nice, quiet place to get away for a few days that didn't cost a fortune.  The renovated barn is a really cool place to stay, exactly as the pictures represented.  The property is beautiful and peaceful.  Craig was a great host and made us feel very welcome.  He met us to check in and gave us a tour of the barn, offered to show us around the property if needed, and stopped by to see if we needed anything before we left.  We went out to a couple places in the area, but we mostly just stayed on the property relaxing, fishing, riding our 4 wheeler out to the cave, which was very interesting to see, and we all had fun playing pool in the evenings.  We enjoyed our stay and plan to go back again sometime.

description.summary: Welcome to a 4400 square foot renovation of a 120 year old wormy chestnut barn set on a 243 acre former farm in the West Virginia mountains. Originally started in 2007 as a project to create a place to watch football every board on the outside was removed to be used again on the inside while keeping as much of the original barn structure visible.   Stay in a historic renovation without giving up creature comforts in a place made for entertaining friends,family and business associates.
description.space: Let's talk about our place......we can't wait to share the tranquility with you. Our surprisingly exquisite, barndominium is breathtaking from the minute you lay eyes on that silo. Then you open the doors and the time put into the details never disappoint. The warm tones throughout the property sets the tone of love and relaxation. How could you not kick back and enjoy a night or 30 :)  The kitchen is just an absolute dream whether your entertaining a family dinner, hosting Super Bowl Sunday, a romantic Valentines Day dinner or just throwing together some drinks together;  the kitchen is the heart of  a homes  memories! There's so much it offers we can't wait to show you around and share the barndominium that started a dream.
description.access: Upon reserving your stay at our cozy, completely renovated, romantic Barndominium you will have full access to 4400 square feet of what we consider perfection! Whether your entertaining in the bar area, cooking up a delightful dinner in the high end kitchen, Enjoying couples dinner in the "Eiffel Tower" or resting under the stars this beautiful place is completely yours to enjoy. Wait did we mention hiking trails, fishing ponds, 9 miles of atv trails that lead to our own cave, wildlife all around and views that are breathtaking! Come enjoy our paradise we can't wait to see you! Who knows you may come back and get married here the possibilities are endless!
description.interaction: We are always available to socialize and get you acquainted with the property, not to mention we love to show you around and share our history. We will always give you your space for your time here at the farm. We're just a quick call or message away should you need anything at all.
description.house_rules:
We try to do our very best to accommodate you as our guest. We have a few things to ask during your visit with us.

1. Please leave remotes on the end of the bar closest to the living area.
 
2. Set thermostat at 73* in the summer and 64* in the winter. 

3. Put all towels and washcloths in the washing machine. 

4. Please strip beds/beds and take bedding downstairs to the bathroom.

5. Wash dishes and rinse out sink. If you load the dishwasher make sure to pre-rinse your dishes and start the cycle before checkout. 

6. Clean fridge of any personal items and wipe down any residue. 

7. Bag trash and place outside the front door or take to the top of the hill. there is a dumpster on your left as you're leaving the property. 

8. If you use the coffee pot please rinse after each brew.

9. Sweep any excess dirt or trash off the floor.

10. Turn off tv's and lights as your exiting. 

11. Please relax and enjoy your stay in a truly exquisite and unique barndominium in wonderful French Creek, WV

name: Waterfront home with pier near Solomon's Island
title: California, Maryland

gallery.caption: The back of the yard by the water is marsh grass with a fire pit and hammock

hosts.about: We live in Southern Maryland and love to go to our getaway from the crazy life every chance we can.  Love the mountains and being in the middle of the wilderness watching birds, deer, and any other wildlife that comes across our home.  Enjoy building new things alone or with my little one and love to do honeydolist as long as it involves building, cooking, not cleaning!  We look forward to hosting people that are looking for a place to unwind and ground themselves.

recent.comments: Courtney and Christian‘s house is warm and inviting tastefully decorated,  creating a cozy and charming ambiance The kitchen is fully equipped and the house has many comfort details such as beach and bath towels, Keurig coffee machine, washing machine, television, a piano and many more. The huge garden invites to relax with a lounge, the little pool and big trees around. It is only a short drive to Solomons Island, restaurants, shopping, museums and recreation parks. Courtney and Christian were very responsive and very helpful, giving us very good recommendations for restaurants or fun things to do in the area. We visited the Calvert Cliffs State Park which is wonderful, we went to Leonardtown and had dinner at the fun market place called Shepard‘s Old Field. And we explored the PAX River Naval Air Museum, where we even got a private tour from a former engineer in testing airplanes, now working  as a volonteer. This was very interesting. Thank you for letting us stay in your house.

items.comments: Courtney and Christian‘s house is warm and inviting tastefully decorated,  creating a cozy and charming ambiance The kitchen is fully equipped and the house has many comfort details such as beach and bath towels, Keurig coffee machine, washing machine, television, a piano and many more. The huge garden invites to relax with a lounge, the little pool and big trees around. It is only a short drive to Solomons Island, restaurants, shopping, museums and recreation parks. Courtney and Christian were very responsive and very helpful, giving us very good recommendations for restaurants or fun things to do in the area. We visited the Calvert Cliffs State Park which is wonderful, we went to Leonardtown and had dinner at the fun market place called Shepard‘s Old Field. And we explored the PAX River Naval Air Museum, where we even got a private tour from a former engineer in testing airplanes, now working  as a volonteer. This was very interesting. Thank you for letting us stay in your house.

A nice house with a big yard, dock and swimming pool. it was great place for our 5 year old to play, and to have a remote work space.  Courtney and Christian were super accommodating - they came to fix the pool when it the chlorine ran out, cleaned up their grill for us, and were were very generous in letting us use food in the pantry (since it's their home, they have a fully stocked pantry, so made cooking much easier than a typical airbnb, because they you could use a little bit of olive oil, or sugar, or spices, etc. - They also have excellent kitchenware!)
So many thoughtful details and amenities! The kitchen is fully stocked and ready for cooking! Beautiful home!

The house was exactly as pictured and perfect for our weekend away. It's in a quiet residential neighborhood, with water views in all directions. The house is beautiful and was very comfortable for our family of 4 (and 2 dogs).  Christian and Courtney went out of their way to communicate before and during our stay, and more than accommodating throughout. If we are in the area again, we wouldn't hesitate to book with them again!
Had a great time at Christian & Courtney’s place. They were super responsive. The place was clean and set up like a B&B with the furnishings in the house. Would 100% recommend!

Christian & Courtney’s place was the perfect stay for our Christmas vacation! Always quick to respond to any questions we had. And the place itself was beautiful, felt like home, the rooms were the perfect size, and the kitchen was great! We were able to cook dinner in when we wanted to. I highly recommend their place to stay when in Southern MD!

Our stay here was wonderful. Christian and Courtney really went out of their way to make sure we were able to host a beautiful Thanksgiving dinner for us and our family. They put out festive decorations, made sure we had all the necessary kitchen tools, and even offered to get us a turkey ahead of time. This was the best air bnb experience have had yet. They were always responsive and helpful, and the house was stunning yet homey. This will for sure be our go to place to stay when we come back to southern Maryland.

description.summary: Spacious waterfront home with three bedrooms and a seasonal above ground swimming pool/fire pit.   The home is bright and airy and thoughtfully decorated to make your perfect getaway along the Maryland shore.  Enjoy kayaking or crabbing off the pier while watching beautiful sunsets.
description.space:
This house has been our primary home for the last 6 years, so you will find some of our personal items, but we have cleared closet and drawer space for you.  We love this area because of the beautiful views and all of the fun places to visit close by.  What makes it even better, is being able to share it with you.  
The home is in a neighborhood with 2 marinas.  The house backs to Town Creek, which leads directly to the Patuxent River.  The water in the creek is deep and calm, so it's perfect for kayaking or floating!  Thr marina next door has some old boats that are mostly underwater, so you can catch crabs super easy with a net near them. We are just over the bridge from Solomons island, which has a gorgeous boardwalk and tons of nice restaurants to enjoy.  Solomons Island is where the July 4th fireworks are set off.  To view the fireworks, you can drive over the bridge to the island and enjoy the show!  
The home was originally a beach bungalow with 1 bedroom built in 1929.  In 1963 the home was converted to a 2 story home, a breezeway added, and a garage.  In 2018 the home was renovated again with new flooring, a custom kitchen with quartzite counters, 2 marble bathrooms, and new windows
  The home has lots of character that i hope you enjoy while you visit!  Because it is 100 years old, and we tried to keep as much character as possible, you will see some original character of the home fr 1929.  So please, understand this is an old home that has some quirkiness about it that anyone who loves old homes should appreciate. 
 You will be close to lots of shopping locally, with being about 5 minutes from major stores and strip malls.  For activities, you can always enjoy hanging out watching TV in the house, go kayaking, swimming, fishing, or enjoy lots of local entertainment.  Again, we are super close to Solomons Island, which is gorgeous and also has a fun marine museum with a lighthouse you can visit.  We are about 20 minutes from Leonardtown, MD which has lots of small town character, a downtown wharf, and a fun market place called Shepard's Old Field where you can shop for boutique clothing or have a craft beer at the Beer Garden.  Leonardtown also has a fun waterfront restaurant called Fritzie's Marina that has great food and atmosphere.  We also enjoy Stoney's Clarks Landing restaurant that is a short ride from the house.  It has peaceful water views from the beach out back.  If you enjoy crabs, we have 2 traps off the pier, or you can tie chicken necks from a string to catch them.  We are conveniently located near several beaches including Myrtle Point and Calvert Cliffs.
The front door is equipped with a coded lock, so you won't have to worry about lost keys.
description.access: The whole house, yard, pier, and pool are available to you.  We don't allow access to the garage or the apartment above the garage, as our personal items are stored there.  The garage apartment has its own entrance and parking spot, and occupied by a full time tenant.
description.notes:
The garage and apartment over the garage are not available to the guests.  This is used for storage and the apartment is occupied by a tenant.  The apartment has a separate entrance and parking spot.

This is our main house we live in.  We rent it out while we vacation, so you will find some personal items in the home.  I have cleared a section of my closet, 2 drawers in the chest, and 1 drawer per nightstand for you in the main bedroom.   Please respect our items while you stay.

The refrigerator has been cleaned out, and only a few items will be in it.  We do have lots of condiments, eggs, frozen items, and pantry items for you to enjoy.  Please feel free to eat or drink anything in the house!
description.neighborhood: The house is located in a small community that has 2 marinas.  The neighborhood is actuall an island that is connected by a land bridge near the fishing pier.  The Marina next door used to be a resort that many presidents, including John F. Kennedy, have vacationed at.
description.transit: The neighborhood is beautiful to take a walk.  It is a small island with a land bridge connecting the island to the rest of the neighborhood.  There are no stores within walking distance, but there is a marina and dive shop next door.
description.interaction: We offer a safe self check in, but are easily available by phone at any time.
description.house_rules:
We have a full-time tenant in the apartment over the garage. Their is a separate entrance for the apartment. 

We have an owners closet with a lock to keep our belongings in.

The drawers in the bedrooms have an Airbnb sticker designated for your use.

name: Fire Pit + Family Friendly + Great Location!
title: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

hosts.about:
At 4.95 / 5 overall reviews, we're one of the highest rated Superhosts in the country! Myself and my team at HostWise are focused on providing our guests with amazing stays & outstanding amenities. Every one of our properties reflects our brand - quality linens, abundant amenities, whole bean coffee, high speed internet, workspaces, and lots more! We're here as your "virtual concierge" - if you need anything, any time, just ask! Don't take our word for it; take a look at our reviews and see what our previous guests are saying about us!

How did we end up in the Airbnb hospitality business? Our founders were "road warriors" for >10 years of our lives, in the consulting industry, the music industry, traveling nursing, and more.  We stayed in a ton of different places, and learned what we loved (and what we hated!) at all of the places we've stayed over the years. We appreciated seamless check ins and check outs, friendly, unobtrusive hosts, sparking clean spaces, abundant amenities, and rapid help if we needed it. We reflect these qualities, and more, in all of our HostWise properties throughout the country. From myself and my team, we can't wait to host you at our place! 

Remember - life is too short to stay home!

Hi!  I'm Stephanie, part of the HostWise team. We're the highest rated Superhosts in Pittsburgh! I'm born & raised here, but I spent much of my career prior to this on the road. 
I'm the Ground Operations Manager for Pittsburgh.  Prior to HostWise, I worked in the Event and Show Production industry. Wearing every hat from Tour Manager, Sound Engineer, to Event Manager, I got used to the 24/7 grind of traveling across the country. I realized that I could create a better guest experience, so entered the world of short term rentals. I takes pride in managing a hard working crew, meticulous turnovers, and providing our guests a memorable, flawless stay!
When I'm not working, I love to travel, I'm a dessert junkie (ask me about my favorite places in town!) a gamer, and a musician!

Hi, we're HostWise! Several of us use this profile to help our guests with whatever issues they need. We're a small international team located in the US, Philippines, and Bolivia!  Need a suggestion for late night tacos? Just ask! Door code giving you trouble? No problem! Looking for some ideas on things to do? Let us know! We look forward to helping you.

recent.comments: We had a great stay! Super easy walk to Bloomfield and Lawrenceville restaurants, home was nice and clean, and had so much fun playing piano!

items.comments: We had a great stay! Super easy walk to Bloomfield and Lawrenceville restaurants, home was nice and clean, and had so much fun playing piano!

This AirBnB was just what my family (with 3 small kids) needed to break up a road trip. The kids loved the top floor kid area the grownups loved the location and how walkable it was. The house was very clean and the baby supplies were helpful. I really appreciated the environmentally responsible products within the house as well.
Great place— private, well-appointed, and very convenient access to the area.
Perfect location for a family fun filled weekend! Easily access most places within a 10-15 minute drive.
The house was comfortable and spacious, the beds were comfortable and the place felt very clean.  We enjoyed our stay.
This house was very clean and in a great location my family and I found lots to do in the area and my daughter and son loved to play the piano and use the playroom. Very family friendly.

The house is lovely and in a residential neighborhood within walking distance of restaurants, coffee shops, and a lovely bookstore. The house has everything anyone could need. The little covered outside entrance was great to use during rain, and the raised patio was lovely when it wasn't raining. The kitchen was well equipped and the beds were very clean and comfortable. 

The host was fantastic about responding to concerns quickly and completely. I would highly recommend this house!

description.summary:
Welcome to our family-friendly home in Bloomfield! Tickle the ivories on our baby brand piano while you send the kids upstairs to play with coloring books, toys, and more. Cook a great meal in our well stocked kitchen, or relax on the couch and watch Netflix. At night, spark up the fireplace and enjoy an evening outside with friends!
If you're an "out and about" type - you're just a few blocks from the main drag in Bloomfield, full of great bars & restaurants!
description.space:
KEY AMENITIES / DETAILS:

✓ Check-out process: Chore-Free Checkout™
✓ Check-in process: Keyless entry with code
✓ Check-in technology: Dack-enabled, swipe to unlock, digital guide 
✓ 3 Bedroom home
✓ 1 full Bathroom
✓ Sleeps 5 in one king, one queen, and one twin bed
✓ Internet: High speed 300mbps
✓ Parking: Free street parking for 2 vehicles with permit
✓ Laundry: Laundromat ~5 blocks away
✓ Kitchen: Fully stocked with quality amenities
✓ Work from home: 1 cozy desk + ergonomic chair + charging station
✓ Coffee: Pittsburgh's Commonplace Roasters premium whole bean coffee 
✓ Tech: G-Mini enabled speaker, three Smart TVs 
✓ Eco-friendly: Recycling, earth-friendly toiletries, water filters
✓ HVAC: Central air + heat

ABOUT HOSTWISE STAYS: 

As the top-ranked professional hosts in the Pittsburgh area, we are obsessed with quality service & amenities. Like high end hotels (but better!), we don't have crazy check out procedures, we only use professional cleaners, and we're available 24 / 7 / 365 (often within seconds!)

We provide our valued guests with seamless lodging experiences & top-notch amenities - fast Wi-Fi, high end coffee bars, quality linens, clean spaces, earth-friendly products, remote work spaces, premium toiletries, and more!

CLEANING PROCEDURES:

Now more than ever it is important to stay in a professionally cleaned space. We don't "outsource" our cleaning - our cleaners are professionally trained with a passion for what they do! Our team follows an industry-leading cleaning checklist, and our Operations team executes randomized inspections to ensure our standards are met.

DETAILED FEATURES:

➤ Freestanding 3 BR / 1BA home with its own private entrance

➤  Entrance + Security- Keyless entry with unique/random codes generated via Dack- enabled security software for each guest - highly secure! 

➤ Sleeps 5

      ➣ 1 king, 1 queen, and one twin / trundle bed. 

➤ Parking - Free street parking for up to two vehicles, with complimentary parking pass

➤ Bathroom - One full bathroom

      ➣ Includes shower + tub, blow dryer, plush cotton towels, and 
            premium toiletries

➤ TVs -  55" 4K smart UHDTVs in the living room, 43" smart TVs in king & queen bedrooms 
     ➣ Most apps are free to use and / or you are able to use your cable provider's login info for "paid" apps (ESPN, HBO, Showtime, etc.)
      ➣ Free Netflix is also included

➤ Outdoor space - patio + fire pit in the back of the property

➤ Special features - baby grand piano, top floor "kids room / play area" 

➤ Internet - High speed 300mbps internet

➤ Technology + Security - External camera + internal non-recording 
decibel meter, for party prevention + smart speaker
      ➣ Dack-enabled smart lock with random code generation + digital app 

➤ Kitchen - Fully stocked with stainless pots & pans, knives, utensils, toaster, microwave, full coffee set up, dishwasher, stove/range, and more

➤ Coffee & Tea - Drip coffee maker, French press, electric kettle, premium locally roasted Commonplace whole bean coffee, and premium tea selection is provided, along with organic sugar & individual creamers

➤ Living Room - Comfy couch, 55" TV, and more

➤ Dining - Seating for 6 available at the kitchen table

➤ Office space - On the top floor, the office features two desks + comfy chairs, perfect for working from home

➤ Laundry - Laundromat available nearby

➤ Air Conditioning / heating - central heat + AC

➤ Pets not permitted

➤ No Smoking indoors
description.access: The entire house with the exception of the basement is accessible
description.neighborhood: Bloomfield is historically known as "little Italy" in Pittsburgh. The main street is just a block away, and has lots of great bars & restaurants, from dive bars to fine dining! West Penn hospital is a ~10 minute walk, Bloomfield's public swimming pool is ~2 blocks away...this is a great location, perfect for walking, but also great access to the rest of Pittsburgh.
description.transit: Uber / Lyft are your best bet, or take a scooter or bike! Pittsburgh is called the City of Bridges due to our rivers and hills, and because of this, it's one of the hardest cities to drive around in. Luckily our area is super walkable, with a 92 walk score!
description.interaction: Our team is available 24 / 7 / 365 for questions, concerns, and more! Seriously, just ask us, we're here to help!
description.house_rules:
1. Smoking (or vaping) is NOT allowed in the house. Smoking is allowed outside only; PLEASE no butts on the ground. A minimum $1,000 cleaning fee will be reported if evidence of smoking is found in the home.

2. People other than those in the Guest party may not stay overnight in the property without prior notice. Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of Guest. The host has not represented this unit as an event facility, therefore, there is a limit to the number of any visitors at any one time (in addition to registered occupants) of four (4) up to a maximum of eight (8) persons in the property at any given time. At no time may any of these visitors remain overnight or assume any guest privileges whatsoever.

3. The host is not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The host is not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. Thanks

name: Snow Hill Riverfront Cottage
title: Snow Hill, Maryland

gallery.caption: Rest and relax on the banks of the Pocomoke River during your stay at the Cottage at Red Landing.
The Cottage, a stand alone house with a two car garage
Bring your own kayak and launch from the Farm's shoreline
Queen sofa bed with linens provided
Grand piano in the living area
Whole house filtered water by Culligan and reverse osmosis option at the sink for drinking water.
Gas stove, microwave, and toaster oven.
Drip and Keurig coffee makers available
washer and dryer in laundry area with laundry supplies provided
Two queen beds, a walk in closet, and dresser in the main bedroom.
Queen bed in second bedroom with dresser and closet.
Walk in shower in second bathroom
Launch kayaks from the banks of the Cottage at mid and high tides
Unique cypress knees line the banks of the river along the Cottage's shoreline
Rent kayaks in Snow Hill at the Pocomoke River Canoe Company. They deliver to the Cottage!
Walk the trails in Milburn State Park, 4 miles away
The Old Furnace Town Heritage Museum is an outdoor museum  that uses a living history format with live demonstrations to re-create a vanished 19th-century community.  furnacetown.org
Walk this trail at Furnace Town.

The Cottage is surrounded by the Nassawango Creek Preserve, 9958 acres and is one of the northernmost remaining examples of a bald cypress swamp.  https://www.nature.org/en-us/get-involved/how-to-help/places-we-protect/nassawango-creek-preserve/
Nature Conservancy hiking trail one mile from the Cottage
The Cottage is minutes away from Assateague National Seashore, Chincoteague, and Ocean City as well as Snow Hill's beach on Assawoman Bay - Public Landing.
The shoulder season at the Cottage has some of the year's  best weather.

Bike local roadways through the Pocomoke Forest.  The rural roads near the Cottage are part of Salisbury University's annual Sea Gull Century Ride.  

https://seagullcentury.org/
Regina and Jeff are here to make your visit a success
The Black Eyed Susan paddles past the Cottage for a moonlight ride.

hosts.about: My husband Jeff and I are enjoying retirement on a beautiful farm on the Eastern Shore of Maryland.  Jeff retired after 46 years teaching high school Biology and I retired from 20 years as a professor in the education department at Salisbury University.  We love the ability to enjoy solitude on the farm and make day trips for more excitement. Our parents recently passed away and we think their home on the farm is an excellent place for guests to relax and recharge.   Come enjoy the quiet life, surrounded by nature's beauty and be well.

recent.comments: Really enjoyed our stay! Regina helped getting us to the cottage after failing to follow her most thorough directions. She and her husband were consummate professionals! The farm/counry landscape along with the scenic river setting was even better than pictured. My grandson tried his hand on the piano...a unique amentity. All the kitchen/bath accessories were on hand  and the decor created a comfortable "vibe". Simply...a wonderful experience.

items.comments: Really enjoyed our stay! Regina helped getting us to the cottage after failing to follow her most thorough directions. She and her husband were consummate professionals! The farm/counry landscape along with the scenic river setting was even better than pictured. My grandson tried his hand on the piano...a unique amentity. All the kitchen/bath accessories were on hand  and the decor created a comfortable "vibe". Simply...a wonderful experience.

Loved it! We had a great time, despite a ton of rainy weather. Peaceful and clean, sweetest host, every amenity you need for a comfortable stay, great place to relax and enjoy family time. We checked out some local spots for food and fun, and when we were at the cottage we felt so far away from the hustle and bustle back home. Definitely recommend!
Wonderful place! Very peaceful.

We loved our stay here!  The fields out front were beautiful and the river out back was incredibly scenic.  We brought outdoor games but didn’t really use them because of the flies and mosquitoes, but most of the house has windows which allowed you to see the river.

We split our time between Chincoteague and Ocean City, which is why we chose this location.  We also went into Berlin a couple of times.  Snow Hill was tiny but charming, a beautiful spot on the Eastern Shore.

The house was large and comfortable; we brought everything we needed to cook and make picnic lunches, but did use some of the kitchen gadgets.  The kitchen was fully stocked with silverware, plates, pans, etc.  The bathrooms also were large and stocked with toiletries.  Overall, it was a nice house in a beautiful setting!  We forgot to sign the guest book, just one of the reasons we would love to come back!

Check-in was very easy.  When we got there the AC wasn't working, and when I messaged Regina, she and her husband came right over and fixed it, which was all due to a power outage.  Regina talked with us and discussed the area, as well as let us know about the awesome turtle nest in the yard!!  The house was very cozy and had plenty of space for everyone that was preparing for the wedding there.  I would definitely request this house again.

Our family had a wonderful and restful time together. The house and property were clean and very comfortable. The setting was OUTSTANDING and Regina did a good job of helping us make the most of the area. We are planning to return to the area!

Perfect place to use as home-base for 3 days of bike riding on the Eastern Shore, for a group of 6 coming from different states/locations.  House would be of similar value/interest for a couple days of kayaking.   Nice place to gather as a group at the end of the day.   Photos don't do justice to the setting by the river, and the perfect condition of the house.  Highest rating across the board.

description.summary: Surround yourself with nature's beauty when you stay at this 120 acre farm retreat. Located on the Pocomoke River, near quaint Snow Hill Maryland, this Cottage at Red Landing accommodates up to 7 people comfortably.  Complete solitude overlooking the Pocomoke River, a perfect hideaway. Enjoy your coffee watching spectacular morning sunrises over  the river and evening sunsets across the farm fields. Feel far away while being right in the middle of it all!
description.space:
There is plenty to keep you busy if you want. Launch your own kayaks from the riverbank or rent in Snow Hill at the Pocomoke River Canoe Company. Catch a fish!  Or book a cruise with Pocomoke River Cruises down the Pocomoke. Bike or hike, miles of the surrounding area are owned by the Nature Conservancy and Maryland State Parks. Enjoy the attractions in Ocean City, Maryland, Chincoteague Virginia and the Assateague Island National Seashore beaches, all just a short drive away or just relax by the river away from it all. 

Outdoor Living: Adirondack chairs with outdoor gas fire pit sit 20 feet from the river’s edge. Enjoy views down the river along with the unique cypress trees and sweet bay magnolia that line the property.  River breezes cool the air, even on hot summer days . Outdoor grill and dining table encourage outdoor living.  


Indoor Living: Accommodations for 8 with linens provided, fully stocked kitchen, washer/dryer,and Wifi with Hughesnet satellite. Or unplug! The real attractions are the views!Guests have spotted deer, turtles, eagles, turkeys, fox, and beaver!

The farm has been in Regina’s family since 1948 when her grandfather purchased and farmed the land.  This area was historically called Red Landing and an old ramp and concrete kiln that might have provided pitch to repair the bottom of boats trafficking the river remain on the property as evidence of a bygone era when steamboats regularly traveled the river .  

 For those looking for peace and quiet, communing with nature, this stand alone house offers a chance to stay in the midst of one of the most visited areas on the east coast.  Where else on the east coast can you spend time in a place without any other views of neighbors?  The Cottage sits on a point of land that affords views of the river and the adjoining state forest.  The privacy is spectacular; especially since a major resort that expands to 300,000 people in the summer is only minutes away.
description.neighborhood: This is a secluded area with no immediate neighbors. The house is set back into the trees with plenty of privacy.  Miles of the surrounding area are owned by the Nature Conservancy and Maryland State Parks.  Perfect for biking and hiking.
description.transit: Four miles to the small town of Snow Hill.  Seventeen miles to historic Berlin, Walmart, and Atlantic General Hospital.  Additional shopping and medical options are available in Salisbury (18 mi)  and Pocomoke City (13 mi).  28 miles to Ocean City; 17 miles to Assateague, and 16 miles to Chincoteague Island.  Guests can easily travel to area resorts and relax after a day's outing.
description.interaction: Owners will be available either via phone/text/email or in person at a neighboring house on the property. There is privacy and distance between the two homes, but assistance and social interaction are available when desired.
description.house_rules:
Guests:  At least one member of the booking party must be over 21.  Likewise, the person making the reservation must be in the guest group. 
Farm: The farm has 122 acres. Feel free to explore but know that farms and woods have bugs, flies, lightening bugs, butterflies, hummingbirds, finches, woodpeckers, ticks, and more. You may even spot an occasional deer wandering through and beaver swimming by. OFF spray will be provided. Explore the woods in the summertime at your own risk 😊
Dogs: (Sorry no Cats due to guest allergies) Pet owners must have proof of current rabies vaccination. Dogs must be leashed at all times. Clean up any pet mess and let us know if there are damages. Pets must be in a crate or in the garage if owners are not present on the property.  All requests to include dogs in rentals must have prior approval.  
Toddlers: We love children, even ones younger than 2. But no crib or high chair is available. Home is close to the river without fencing. Carefully watch your children.
Housekeeping:  There is no daily housekeeping service.  While linens and bath towels are included in the rental fee, we suggest that you bring your own beach towels.  We do not permit towels or linens to be taken from the unit 
Water and Septic:  The Cottage is on a well and septic systems.  A water treatment system, including reverse osmosis, provides safe, clean, drinking water in the kitchen.  The septic system is very effective but will clog if improper material is flushed.  DO NOT flush anything other than toilet paper.  
Firepit:  The woodstove in the Cottage does not operate.  There is a gas firepit riverside for guest gatherings.
GUESTS: People other than those in the Guest party set forth above may not stay overnight in the property. Any other person on the property is the sole responsibility of Guest.

Liability: The guest agrees to the following waivers of owner responsibility while on the property. Certain amenities are provided. The guest understands that the owner takes no responsibility for these amenities. 
This means that the guests assume responsibility for any misuse, or injuries, that may occur in using the any of the amenities and holds harmless the owner. Specifically, the guests agree to waive owner responsibility in the following areas and all others not mentioned: 

1.  Three adult bikes are provided, but guests need to furnish their own helmets. Any injury resulting from use of the bikes is solely the responsibility of the guests, not the owner. 

2.Small watercraft such as kayaks and standup boards may be launched from the shoreline of the Cottage. Life jackets are required per Maryland Department of Natural Resources guidelines for water safety. Launch at your own risk. Any injury resulting from the launching or use of watercraft and/or swimming in the Pocomoke River is solely the responsibility of the guests, not the owner.

3.Cottage shoreline and environment.  We love children but please note that the Cottage is about 50 feet from the shoreline without fencing.Carefully watch your children.Likewise, the Cottage is surrounded with woods, providing seclusion and beauty.  However, visitors must watch their step, as the ground is uneven by nature.  Any injury resulting from the Cottage’s surroundings is the responsibility of the guests, not the owner.

 LIABILITY:The Cottage at Red Landing is privately owned;the owners are not responsible for any accidents,injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly accepting these House Rules and Liability Waivers.

recent.comments: Great place for a stay with the family!  The kids loved roasting s’mores at the fire pit, and playing songs on the piano. Comfortable house with everything we needed for a nice stay, and Anna was super responsive and helpful with any questions we had.

items.comments: Great place for a stay with the family!  The kids loved roasting s’mores at the fire pit, and playing songs on the piano. Comfortable house with everything we needed for a nice stay, and Anna was super responsive and helpful with any questions we had.

My family of 4 was looking for a 3 bedroom house with internet near hiking so we chose Anna’s place.  The house is so much better than we expected and we were very happy with our choice. It is spacious, very comfortable, and extra clean, and the owners were very responsive.  The grounds are beautiful and peaceful. After a hike up Old Rag mountain, which  is only a 20 min drive away from the house,  we dipped in the local swimming hole which is minutes away.  If u like to cook, like me, the kitchen is well stocked with utensils, gadgets, and good pans.   We are planning another stay in the future to hike the white oak canyon trail next. Wonderful

Loved Anna’s home and the surroundings! It was a breeze getting in and comfy the moment we stepped inside. The home was very clean and organized, moreover, fully stocked with all essentials guests could need! We loved having Shenandoah a short drive away, making it super easy to explore the park. 

Highly recommend Anna’s home for your stay near Shenandoah!

description.summary: Charming, sun-filled East Liberty/Friendship home with piano and private yard
description.space:
Please note:  If you are looking for a luxury hotel-like stay then this is not the place for you.  However, if staying in a 100+ year old Victorian-era building with plenty of architectural charm and floors that tend to creak sounds like a good idea then this might be a good fit.  

Each room has high ceilings and has plenty of natural light.  The apartment is my home and I've furnished it sparingly.  Highlights include a 1928 baby grand piano, two acoustic guitars, and a Gaggia espresso machine, all of which you are welcome to play.
description.access: You'll have the entire apartment to yourself along with the backyard.
description.notes:
There is no cable TV but Amazon Fire Stick is available for you to use in the bedroom.

There is no A/C but ceiling fans are in the bedroom and kitchen.  
 
The floors are original, are uneven in some places, and creak.

The dishwasher is currently out of service. 

There is a tenant upstairs but no shared walls with any other apartment.  

Washer and dryer are coin-operated and are located in the lobby.

I live in the apartment so the refrigerator and freezer will not be empty.

The backyard is available for use on an "as-is" basis.  I cut the lawn whenever I'm in town so it might be overgrown during your stay depending on my travel schedule.
description.neighborhood:
Friendship is a beautiful residential neighborhood within walking distance to so many amenities that a car is not needed.  Walk to the restaurants and shops of East Liberty, Shadyside, Bloomfield, or Garfield.  Whole Foods, Giant Eagle Market District, and ALDI grocery stores are all less than 10 minutes walk away.   

Walkscore of 93.
description.transit: Getting to and from Downtown is a breeze thanks to the East Busway stop at Negley which is less than a 10 minute walk away.
description.interaction: I'm generally available for any questions via email.  Responses may be delayed if I am out of the country or out of service area.
description.house_rules:
No shoes in the house.  

Quiet hours after 10pm to be respectful to the upstairs neighbor.  

Please leave the apartment as you found it, including washing any dishes you may have used.  
With the exception of tea and coffee please do not consume any food or drink that does not belong to you. If you are storing food in the refrigerator please discard any open containers upon checking  out. (Please see above rule regarding leaving the apartment as you found it—this is my home and not a hotel or 100% rental!)
Upon checking out, please strip bed and place used sheets and towels in the hamper below the bathroom sink.  

Recycling trash can is to the right of the refrigerator.  This can has clear bags meant for recycling.  

Additional trash bags are located under the sink.  

Full trash bags may be placed in the rear of the property next to the garage adjacent to the alley (Ravoux Way).

Please do not adjust the thermostat as it controls the heat for the apartments upstairs as well.

No drinks on the piano, please!

Pets are accepted on a case-by-case basis. Please message me if you are traveling with pets.

No illegal file-sharing/Bittorrent usage is permitted.  You are liable for any damages due to copyright infringement during your stay.

description.summary: Open our front door to the beautiful Canal Front park which offers a waterfront setting that includes boats, ship, docks for walking along the canal, fishing, crabbing, seasonal outdoor movies, music, a playground, baseball fields, tennis courts, a basketball court, a kayak launch, a place for a picnic, frisbee and many other activities free to the public. Bike/walk to the beach and walk one block into historic Lewes with its amazing atmosphere - beachy, safe, clean, romantic, great for foodies.
description.space:
Our family has long enjoyed all that historic downtown Lewes and its beaches has to offer.  We have lived here in town for many years and three years ago bought our dream home.  It took our breath away to be able to purchase and renovate this home.  It was like an HGTV moment when we were given a sledge hammer to open the wall to see if the old fireplace was there behind it (it was)!  During our renovation, Craftsman Tools even came and filmed a commercial here!  We are now excited to share our home.  

We have traced the history of our home back to 1849 but have been told it goes back much further.  Rumor has it, our home was called the “Stage Coach Inn” back in the day;  you will see the historical carriage house when you pull in the driveway that had stables in it until recent years.  We were told by the previous owners that is where the horses were fed, overnighted, etc. with the carriage pulled right into the driveway area.  We have a historical carriage house on our property for you to store your water toys and the driveway is large enough to bring your boat and park. 

In addition to location, here are some things we are pleased to offer:

•	Sleeping for 8 in 5 bedrooms with 4 bathrooms 
•	A kitchen upstairs and another downstairs which is great for multiple families, a break from one another if needed and or just some quiet time to enjoy early coffee before everyone else is up - general pantry items/spices available.
•	Keurig coffee pots in both kitchens
•	Washer and dryer
•	Parking for 4 in the driveway, on-street parking for compact out front and additional public parking across the street
•	The first floor of our carriage house is available for you to store your kayaks, bikes, beach stuff 
•	There are two bikes for your use; some games in case of a rainy day
•	Various beach chairs/toys are available to you (please wash them off with the outside hose when you are done with them)
•	Various balls for the courts/fields across the street will be on hand
•	Two different work stations (5G) for any who have to take a zoom call or work a day while here
•	An amazing outdoor shower that brings nature right to you
•	We put up a clothes line because we like to dry our beach towels and bathing suits in the sun after our beach day
•	We are leaving our baby grand piano to enjoy for any who play the piano 
•	A Weber gas grill is available 
•	We live locally so quick support is available for questions/concerns

We do ask that you:

•	Not smoke in our home
•	Not sneak pets in 
•	Help keep sand out – two levels of our home are hardwood floors
•	Leave shoes outside whenever possible – when we stay here we go shoeless 
•	No wet bathing suits on the furniture
•	No parties – we love our neighbors and hope they love us back (and continue to)
•	Keep the house/carriage house locked when you are gone

We love our home and enjoy time in it also.  Thank you for treating it kindly while you are here. 

We look forward to welcoming you!

Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
description.access: The entire home will be yours during your stay.
description.notes:
Perfectly situated on the Canal Front Park and the Lewes/Rehoboth canal!  Pleasure boats, fishing boats, water taxis, and the Overfalls Lightship will excite your nautical desires and can be seen from any room on the front of the house and of course, from the Adirondack chairs on the front porch!  Grab coffee and watch them start their early mornings, or a glass of wine and watch them return from their day at sea.  And, if your timing is right you will be able to watch the ospreys in their nest high above the water's edge, often flying about for food.  

Walk inland from our home one block to the quaint shops, many excellent dining options, our local Lewes bakery/coffee shop, toy store, ice cream parlor and Historical Society. Lewes has an amazing atmosphere, it's sunny, beachy, safe, clean, romantic, great for foodies and has a little something for everyone. 

From our home you will have amazing fun in the sun and when the sun goes down you can walk to everything!!! We feel sure you will enjoy our location, location, location! 

As for our beaches, you have many options.  Closest is Lewes Beach (3/4 mile) - sidewalks allow for you to walk it easily or even bike it.  Lewes Beach is on the Delaware Bay so more calm than the ocean which you can enjoy at the Cape Henlopen State Park.  Lewes Beach is perfect for families with younger/older ones who worry about getting knocked over with waves.  Cape Henlopen State Park is approximately 3 miles from our home, its beautiful beaches with fun waves to jump and awesome bike trails you can even take to the Rehoboth boardwalk. You can pick your beach preference or try them both during your stay.  

We are also directly down the street from a public boat ramp that leads right out to the Delaware Bay and Atlantic Ocean.
description.neighborhood: We feel that Lewes is a quiet a gem along the Delaware Beaches where families can truly get away from it all for some rest and relaxation, coupled with wonderful time together creating memories.  Lewes Beach is wonderful for youngsters and older ones amongst us as the bay allows for some to enter the water that might be fearful of the waves at other beaches.  Our downtown is very charming with parks, shopping, museums and the ability to walk to many restaurants after you enjoy your beach time.  Canal Front Park across the street has events throughout the summer.  We hope you take time to stroll along the water and watch the boats come and go – some you can see from our home in the mornings as they set out for the day.  The Historical Society behind us often has festivals such as the Annual Sea Glass Festival.  Whatever strikes your fancy while you visit Lewes, we hope you enjoy your time together as a family.
description.transit: Perfectly situated on the Canal Front Park and the Lewes/Rehoboth canal!  Your view of pleasure boats, fishing boats, water taxis, the Overfalls Lightship that satisfy your nautical desires can be seen from any room on the front of the house and of course, the front porch! Our home is one stop light from the beach or you can walk there or bike if you like (3/4 mile)! The Canal Front park offers outdoor movies, bands, festivals, a playground, baseball fields, tennis/pickleball courts, a basketball court and other activities free to the public. Our home is one street over from quaint shops, many excellent dining options, our local Lewes bakery/coffee shop, toy store, ice cream parlor and Historical Society.  Our driveway easy fits 4 vehicles; across the street is overflow parking.
description.interaction: We live locally if something urgent is needed.

•	Keep the house/carriage house locked when you are gone
•	No smoking at all

description.summary:
This home is centrally located in Lawrenceville - the most popular neighborhood of Pittsburgh! 
- Only a 5-minute walk to Butler Street - featuring many excellent restaurants, shops and entertainment venues. 
- Conveniently tucked away on a quiet street w/ easy to find free street parking.
-  A short drive to main highways, Pittsburgh downtown, major universities and hospitals.
- Within a walking distance from the riverbank, Three Rivers Bike Trail & historic Allegheny Cemetery.
description.space:
- Eclectic and ambient, this artist home was originally conceptualized for creative brainstorming and contemplation, as well as to hold music rehearsals. 
- The property comfortably accommodates 2 guests ( & can cozily squeeze additional 2 guests in the "Daydreamers Nook" / Living Room 2)
- This traditional Pittsburgh row-house was built during the industrial era, and it's interior and amenities reflect the retro vibe.
- There is no TV on the premise and THERE IS an overhead projector (in the main Bedroom) that easily connects to a laptop (with cables provided). 
- I do live in this home and open it to guests during my travels -- You can expect to have more of an organic experience here, rather than a traditional hotel stay!
description.access: First & Second Floor + Backyard / Patio
description.notes: This city neighborhood is close to the Allegheny River and abundant with natural fauna, especially during the spring/summer/fall months. It's best to always keep the screens on windows & doors closed!
description.neighborhood:
LAWRENCEVILLE
It's the city's biggest and hippest neighborhood.

Home to many artists and designers, this trendy 'ville hosts some of the city's biggest arts events. It's a neighborhood on the rise with affordable properties, first-rate, one-of-a-kind shops and an awesome dining scene. The neighborhood has undergone such a revival that it's called a "go-to" destination by The New York Times. Located less than three miles from Downtown, it's a neighborhood with deep roots too. In fact, composer Stephen Foster's father charted the street plans in 1814.

The Vibe
Walkable and welcoming. Entrepreneurial. Unique and distinct. Old-world charm, modern-day edge.

The List
Go on an Allegheny Cemetery tour with the Office of Public Art
Take a spin at Arsenal Bowl, where cool meets retro
See and be seen at Art All Night
Visit the Great One's legacy at The Clemente Museum
Shop and eat at the Annual Joy of Cookies Cookie Tour

The Name
Named for Captain James Lawrence, hero of War of 1812 and famous for his dying words, "Don't Give Up The Ship!"

One More Thing
Stephen Foster was born here. Every July, this composer of America's first pop songs like "Oh, Susanna" and "Camptown Races," is honored at "Doo Dah Days," a music festival held at the historic Allegheny Cemetery, where Foster is buried alongside other Pittsburgh celebrities.
description.transit:
- Easy to find free street parking.
- Many great restaurants and shops within 2 blocks.
- A close drive to Pittsburgh Downtown, major universities and hospitals.
- Easy connection to major highways. 
- 25 minute drive to the Airport.
- Public transportation within a short walking distance.
- Bike and scooter rentals easily accessible in the neighborhood.
- Easy access to river bike trails.
description.house_rules:
FRONT DOOR - KEY LOCK BOX
1. Pull open the black casing.
2. Enter the code into the keypad. 
3. Pull down the black button at the top, and the box should open.
4. Re-enter the code to close the box. 
5. Please remember to place both keys back and lock the box upon your departure.

Wi-Fi and OTHER ELECTRONICS
-	Network and password information is on the whiteboard in the dining room.
-	You may connect your laptop via USB C and HDMI to the overhead projector in the bedroom and to the computer monitor in the living room. 
-	You may connect to the wireless speaker and printer located in the dining room. 

HEATING / COOLING
-	The heat is set to 68 degrees - you may set it higher during your stay. Please remember to turn it back to 68 degrees upon your departure. 
-	The thermostat is located at the bottom of the stairs in the dining room.
-	There are two additional space heaters - one in the bedroom and one by the living room window. You may use them for additional heating - please remember to turn them off when not using the space.
-	The window AC units are available for use in conjunction with the window fans and ceiling fan, during the hot summer months. Please make sure to turn them off when not using the space. 

GARBAGE
-	Leave garbage in the trash bins – we will dispose of it upon your departure. 
-	Additional trash bags (regular and blue recycle) are under the kitchen / bathroom sink.
-	Depending on the dates and length of your stay, you may place excess garbage bags on the sidewalk in-front of the house on Thursday evenings. 
-	There is also a trash can and a recycling bin located in the back yard (in case you are not here on Thursday evenings).

LAUNDRY 
-	Located in the far-left area of the basement.
-	Watch your step! Use handrail and wear shoes (this is an old-school “Pittsburgh basement”).

KITCHEN 
-	Both shared and private cabinets (see LABELS).
-	Cleaning supplies are under the sink. 
-	For extra ventilation use a window fan located in the back hallway (EXHAUST OUT). 
-	Additional cleaning supplies are in the back hallway.

BATHROOM
-	For extra ventilation use a window fan located below the sink (EXHAUST OUT). 
-	Please do not flush any products other than toilet paper.  
-	Cleaning supplies are under the sink.
-	First aid kit is on the shelf.
-	Towels and complimentary toiletries are on display for your use. 
-	Additional toilet paper is in the side cabinet.

BEDROOM
-	Additional bed sheets and iron are on the shelfs.

PIANO 
-	You may play the piano (noise curfew is 10 pm).
-	Please do not place any objects on top of it.

BACKYARD
-	Please be mindful of the noise level due to the neighbors (10pm noise curfew).
-	Do not use the fire pit. 
-	You may use the tiki torches.
-	The gas grill is to be used at your discretion. 
-	Keep the backyard fence-door closed. 

STAIRCASES ARE STEEP!
-	For your safety, please watch your step and use handrail.

NO PARTIES 
-	No more than the registered number of guests per booking are to be present at the property at any given time.
-	The noise curfew is 10pm.

FREE STREET PARKING
- To avoid potential fines -- pay attention to the street cleaning days that are posted on the street signs on both sides of the street.

FLORA AND FAUNA
- This city neighborhood is close to the Allegheny River and therefore abundant with natural fauna, especially during the spring/summer/fall months. It's best to always keep the screens on windows & doors closed.
If you notice that any of the plants are wilting you may water them, THANK YOU!

name: Walnut Run Farm - Private & Quiet - Sperryville
title: Woodville, Virginia

gallery.caption:
Walnut Run Farm -
The 1880 farm is intact with a barn, smoke house, spring house and corn crib.
The farm from the back pasture.
The Studio - the studio leads out onto a fifty-foot screened porch.

The old wood stove in the kitchen. It has been here since the 1920's and I don't have the heart to get rid of it. There is also a modern stove and the kitchen is fully-stocked. I like to cook and have all the pots, utensils, and serving ware you might need.
The Kitchen - I provide good coffee and teas and all the simple goods and condiments you might need.
The porch is the perfect spot to just sit and take in the quiet.
Rocking chairs and a hammock on the porch
The large screened porch is perfect for the summer.
The Barn, Corn Crib, & Tool shed. A good portion of the wood in these structures is extinct Chestnut Oak.
A wild cherry in full bloom.
Looking out from behind the barns.
My guest Allison took this photo. Thanks Allison!
Through a grant from the USDA, the NRCS (Natural Resources Conservation Service) and the Friends  of the Rappahannock, 8,100 trees have been planted. In ten years there should be "canopy" - a forest.
This was the first day of spring 2018!
Looking down towards the farm from Red Oak Mountain. The roofs of the farm are just visible.

hosts.about: I am retired age 67 man who previously owned multiple businesses.   My wife passed away in 2003.  I remarried a Chinese National in 2016.  We own an apartment in China and a house in Orlando, Florida.    My wife came to the USA for the first time in June, 2018.  We met while I was doing business in China 4 years ago and I have been to China 15 times since June, 2014.  She is fluent in 3 languages including English in which she holds a BA.   I was an Assistant Manager at Walmart before I opened my own business in 1998.  I was born in the suburbs of Detroit, Michigan and went to college at Boston University.  I have resided in London, Montreux, Switzerland, Los Angeles and NYC for over 20 years until I settled in Orlando in 1993 to raise a family.  I moved to Beverly Hills, California in October of 2014 to live with my daughters who were getting started in the music industry.  I relocated back to my home in Orlando in January of 2018.   I purchased my home in Orlando in 1994.

Great stay near Sperryville for our family!
The farm house is beautiful and private. I love every visit to this special place.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at John’s. The place is extremely clean, spacious, well decorated, and quiet. The place is about 15 minutes drive to Shenandoah NP and nearby town, Sperryville, is so quaint and has a lot of fun things to do. 

The kitchen is fully equipped with everything we need to make a simple meal. We especially enjoyed hanging out by the piano and walking around the farm. It was truly an escape! Thank you!

A beautiful, seclude, historic farm house in Rappahannock county.  Well appointed kitchen with every pan and utensil you could need for cooking in. A short drive to Sperryville and the Shendandoah NP.  Will look to return for another relaxing weekend!

The place is old but still in good shape.  My daughter likes the decor and displays and said it felt like walking into a museum.  My husband likes the big stove in the kitchen and learned how to make coffee without a coffer maker.  Our dogs like the big open area to run without a leash the first time. The location is so isolated and quiet except a dove (we think) made a lot of noises.  Also, the window was open the first night and there were a lot of bugs flying around.  Luckily, there was a bug vacuum to use to take care of them.  The second night was better since we did not open any windows.  We enjoyed our time in the farm and will rent it again.

description.summary:
A beautiful old farm in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.  The 1880 farmhouse sits on a small stream that runs through the entire fifty-five acre property. The house is  clean, minimally decorated, with pasture views out of every window.

The farm is located 80 miles from Washington DC and just down the road from Sperryville, Old Rag Mountain, Skyline Drive and other local attractions.

(Please contact me if you would prefer a one-night booking. I can usually accommodate you.)
description.space:
A beautiful old farmhouse nestled in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains on a small stream called Walnut Run.

The house is clean, spacious and comfortable.

The property is fifty-five acres of secluded rolling hills that are open for guests to explore.

Walnut Run Farm is a one-man operation. I am doing my best to hold on to this truly unique and beautiful property. There are financial pressures to sell and or subdivide but what makes the farm special is that it is intact and retains its sanctuary-like privacy. 

The farm is perfectly sited along a little stream (Walnut Run) and sits in a bowl surrounded on one half by trees and views off to the pastures in other directions. There are the original outbuildings, including a spring house with pump, a smokehouse, a corn crib and a Virginia-styled barn.

Work needs to be done everywhere around the farm. Everywhere! Each stay helps so much in preserving this truly special old farmhouse and property. 

Thank you -

John
description.access: If I am not there to greet you personally I will leave the doors to the SCREENED PORCH open for you. I will leave the key for that door you just entered on the table in front of you.
description.notes:
Dogs are allowed. There is a $35 fee for each dog. Dogs must be perfectly house trained and are NOT allowed on the beds or furniture. Guests are responsible for any and all damages.

Cats are allowed only if we discuss it beforehand and I am fully assured that there will not be an issue. Unfortunately, I have had problems every single time I have allowed cats. Don't get me wrong, I am an animal lover and like cats but I must protect the property.

 Please notify me in advance if you are bringing a pet. Thanks.
description.neighborhood:
The farm is very close to Thornton Gap, an entrance to Shenandoah National Park and Skyline Drive. 

From the farm there is quick access to many of the noted hiking trails in the park, most notably Old Rag Mountain and White Oak Canyon.

Continuing on past the entrance to Shenandoah National Park is the city of Luray, known for Luray Caverns, a national landmark. A bit further on is the Shenandoah River where there are river outfitters for rafting and canoeing.
description.interaction:
When you arrive at the house I will have a sheet in the bedroom that provides all the information you will need to know during your stay. 

I will leave a couple contact numbers for me and also my email address. Email is probably the most efficient way of getting a hold of me as I check it often.
