Possum Trot is an idyllic place with tons of character.    Our extended family of fifteen, (with ages ranging from 75 to 3 months) spent a happy and comfortable week there.    The hosts are kind and incredibly responsive.   Lots to do in the surrounding area.    We especially enjoyed blueberry picking right down the road!

We had such a wonderful stay at Possum Trot! Judith was the house mom we couldn’t have dreamed to ask for. She was so knowledgeable about the surrounding area and made us feel right at home. Do not hesitate to book Possum Trot and ask Judith about chef Meredith’s cooking - you’ll thank me later :)
Can’t wait to come back to Possum Trot!

description.summary:
Less than an hour south of Charlottesville, Possum Trot offers a beautiful entertainment/sleeping lodge along with a 1929-vintage 3 Bedroom Farmhouse on Possum Trot Creek.  We can sleep 16! There's a swimming hole along with plenty of places on the grounds to celebrate and roam.
Rent the entire property with two buildings and gardens or choose a room or two.  We can serve breakfast or help plan your wedding or other event at Pharsalia, nearby or on our property  ... the possibilities !

name: Cheerful Queen-Bd, in Beautiful Eastern Shore, MD
title: Hurlock, Maryland

hosts.about: I am currently working as active duty Navy and am stationed in the Washington D.C. area! I also travel for work and understand the grab-and-go lifestyle. I love spending time with friends and family and always appreciate a warm campfire, trying new cuisine, and a good read.

recent.comments: Super nice and very responsive. Flexible especially during a special time in their life and very appreciate their hospitality. Blessed space and pray they continue to be blessed!

items.comments: Super nice and very responsive. Flexible especially during a special time in their life and very appreciate their hospitality. Blessed space and pray they continue to be blessed!
Fantastic host
Very responsive and flexible as a host. If I ever needed anything they would make sure to accommodate as best they can. Truly appreciate the hospitality shown towards me.

This was exactly what I was looking for at a very fair price point. Loren is a great host to a wonderful quaint location. She was responsive through my entire experience, and I plan to return here when back in the area. Thank you!

Loren's place is absolutely beautiful.  The pics do not show the true gem this property is.  As I entered I was in awe of the spaciousness and cleanliness.  The property is set in a quaint rural farming town.  The home is well organized and tastefully decorated.  Communication with Loren was very easy and expeditious.  The bedroom was very spacious and bright with comfortable bedding. There was ample closet space and a work area.  I look forward to staying there in the future.
fast wifi, very clean and up to date, minutes from everywhere,  miss Loren is a great host and has been every time I stay.
Comfortable and lovely, 10 stars are not enough to rate our wonderful stay with Loren 💖 Highly recommended for professional adult travelers. 🌟

description.summary:
Soak up the artistic charm of this fully remodeled Colonial home located among the beautiful farmlands of Eastern Shore, MD. Enjoy the eclectic pieces; such as the vintage baby grand piano, the collection of artwork, and shared book nook. 

*Free parking on premises
*Full kitchen usage w/ stove/microwave/air fryer/oven/Keurig and coffee pot/fridge/dishwasher
*Washer and dryer on premises
*Electric Vehicle Charging stations less than a mile from the home

name: Luxurious southern mansion outside of Farmville VA
title: Farmville, Virginia

gallery.caption: Back porch chiminea for cozy evenings

Compliments of guest-
Photographer, Mr Steve Grey.

“Nighttime Bliss”
Compliments of Mr Steve Grey

hosts.about:
Hello- my name is Laura Lee. I go by Leela. I enjoy moonlight strolls, flowers by the bucket full and creation itself. My friends would describe me as a wild spirited being. I won’t tell you what my foes say. 
I enjoy the aesthetics and good company.  I also enjoy hosting guests at my estate. It gives me contentment to know that you, my guest, are deriving pleasure while staying at the White House.

recent.comments:
This was an outstanding home to stay in, especially if you have a crew of friends or family. You’re immersed in nature, able to see the stars and enjoy a nice campfire.

They are a litany of amenities that make this place special. Having a sauna and dedicated entertainment room offers both great ways to play and relax. The surrounding nature really takes me back to my summers spent in central Virginia. 

I highly recommend to anyone looking to stay in the area

items.comments:
This was an outstanding home to stay in, especially if you have a crew of friends or family. You’re immersed in nature, able to see the stars and enjoy a nice campfire.

They are a litany of amenities that make this place special. Having a sauna and dedicated entertainment room offers both great ways to play and relax. The surrounding nature really takes me back to my summers spent in central Virginia. 

I highly recommend to anyone looking to stay in the area

Phenomenal host and absolutely would recommend for weddings, photo shoots and just a peaceful retreat from the city. Absolutely gorgeous, cannot express this enough and a very kind and accommodating host.

The White House was great. A couple friends caught up and visited our Alma mater, Longwood University and this was a great quick getaway weekend trip. Laura was very responsive the entire time and let us know early of an power outage in the area. Everything came back on, on time and we enjoyed ourselves.
Absolutely beautiful!

description.summary: Forget your worries in this spacious and serene space. Perfect for recouping from the daily grind. This well appointed estate has all you need to rewind with loved ones or friends while enjoying this charming home that includes a jacuzzi & a sauna.
description.space:
This William Poole design is a very opulent design. Downstairs consists of the marble foyer, a formal dining room w/fireplace, a gentleman’s room w/fireplace, the chic sitting room w/fireplace, the cathedral ceiling spacious kitchen, the master king suite with ensuite jacuzzi, walk in shower, water closet and ladies boudoir. 
The upstairs holds the rec room with theater chairs & pool table, 1 bath, 1 bedroom, a meditation room & sauna. 
The adjoining bedrooms are also upstairs with a jack and jill bath.
description.access: The entire house is yours.
description.neighborhood: PLEASE NOTE:  This house is located on 100 acres OUTSIDE of Farmville VA approximately 22 miles south of the town.
description.transit: You must have a vehicle. This location does not support Uber or Lyft.
description.interaction: I’m happy to help if you have any questions.

name: Little home, big welcome.
title: Cambridge, Maryland

gallery.caption: I appreciate folks leaving shoes at the door.   barefoot is best!
The kitchen is available always.   Likely room in the fridge, too, if needed.
Tub and shower, plenty of towels, washcloths.   Likely have items you may have forgotten if needed (soap, toothbrush, etc.)

Back yard on a summer day..
Love flowers and such...
I have some fun art work...
Skipjack under sail.   You could be there..........

hosts.about:
I enjoy conversation with guests, but I also respect privacy and the need for rest. My home provides comfort and convenience, and I "keep a clean house", as my grandmother would say.

Providing a satisfying experience for travelers is my goal.   I will provide information about dining, outdoor spaces, museums, etc., when asked.

Come on in, kick off your shoes & rest, or drop off your gear and go!

recent.comments: Ann is super hospital and makes you feel at home. Highly recommend.

items.comments: Ann is super hospital and makes you feel at home. Highly recommend.
Cute little place. Private bathroom was a plus. Bedroom was very clean and bed was comfortable
Great place. Would stay again.
Very welcoming and comfortable stay.

Ann is a very dedicated host. I arrived later than expected which she handled with aplomb. Rooms are immaculate, parking was easy. Wish I’d had more time to take in the surroundings or play the piano!
Great value, amazing host, and perfect for Ironman races

We had a lovely stay at Ann's home.  The whole house is clean and tasteful, and the bed and bedroom were very comfortable and we had plenty of space in the private bathroom.  Ann was so friendly and the perfect host.  I always feel a little awkward staying in someone's house, but Ann made us feel at home.  She was available and responsive when we needed her, but respectful of our privacy when we wanted time alone.  She is very dog-friendly and our pup took to her right away, which made our stay all the better.  The neighborhood is quiet and an easy place to get in a quick dog walk.

description.summary:
A clean comfortable home with a queen sized bed with its own private bath.    
 The neighborhood is pet friendly, as is my home.
Smoke-free home always.
description.space: Small home with all the traveler amenities.    Your room has a comfortable queen sized bed with bathroom attached, so both rooms are private from the rest of the house.  Of course, feel free to enjoy the living room and kitchen too, as you like.   Weather permitting, the deck is a spot to enjoy also.
description.access:
Paved driveway, small deck to enjoy outdoors, storage if needed for bikes or similar items.   I will leave a space for guests in the driveway.
Washer and dryer in the home if needed.
description.notes: Feel free to let me know how you hope to experience your time here.     You may want my advice about dining, shopping, sightseeing, etc., or you may need to just shower, change, and/or rest....just let me know what you need and I will do my best to accomodate.
description.neighborhood: I live in a mobile home park, which is convenient for me with my work and other pursuits.   It's a comfortable home and well built, and I have great neighbors!   It's close to shopping, dining, and feels like a bit of country living, which I enjoy.
description.transit:
Travel by car or bike.   Lots of country roads, and I am familiar with them all.
I can also help guests get bus, taxi, or Uber transportation.   Please keep in mind that bus, taxi, Uber, and/or Lyft resources are very limited here.
description.interaction:
I am available via email, text, or calling with any questions or concerns.
While I enjoy interacting with guests, I also appreciate the need for privacy.
Sometimes I have activities that keep me busy so guests are not bothered much at all.
Sometimes we can get to know each other when there's opportunity.     
I have enjoyed meals with guests, shared ideas, even had a few music jams!    Music is usually playing, sometimes  live....feel free to play the piano.  
I do make it quiet for guests, though.
description.house_rules:
Try to not track in mud, please.   I always remove my shoes on arrival; would appreciate guests doing the same.
Just put dishes in the sink, please.  Eat and drink in the kitchen only.

name: Tres Thomas
title: Thomas, West Virginia

gallery.caption: Bright and trendy Full Bed Private Room
Guestroom in my large home in a quiet comm7njty just 4 blocks from the Purple Fiddle
Parking for 4+cars in driveway in front of garage plus overflow parking above the retaining wall
Gas/charcoal grill with outdoor dining by the garden
Niko & Kaya, The friendliest Border collie and Border husky you’ve ever met! Love to greet for furry and a non-furry guests alike.
Dance the night away at the Purple Fiddle
An autumn walk along the rail trail
Ski & Board at Canaan Valkey & Timberline

hosts.about:
HelloHost Short Term Rental Management, Host & Traveler. 

Native to Wild & Wonderful West Virginia, I am a seeker of the simplest sublime, experiencing nature and humanity to its fullest. This quest takes me to the depths of the forest and the heart of community. Give me real people, real food, and real experiences and I am fulfilled. As a Mother, Short Term Property Manager, Natural Product Crafter, and Airbnb Host, I am blessed to live a life of purpose in a fabulous community and incomparable natural environment that is truly Almost Heaven.

recent.comments: Stayed at Alison's place once before and it was just as nice as before! thanks!

items.comments: Stayed at Alison's place once before and it was just as nice as before! thanks!
Alison's place was a great place to stay for our busy weekend.
Thank you so much for everything! A great stay!
Within walking distance to local, downtown area.
Great for the money and the region. Alison's house is comfortable, well-appointed, and welcoming. Looking forward to my next stay.
(blank)
I've stayed here multiple times and I'm always satisfied. Allison makes the experience very simple.

description.summary: Bright and comfortable room is just a short walk away from the art, music and culture of Front Street, and ride away from wild and wonderful. Double bed, bathroom shared with other guest rooms, access to large modern kitchen and living space. Enjoy a cookout on the large patio. Three blocks walk from the Purple Fiddle, shops & Art Galleries of Front Street.
description.space: This cozy room is in a large clean & eclectic guesthouse, reminiscent of an international travel hostel. Feel free to make yourself at home in the shared spacious living space, including a large yard and patio with grill.  When we are not traveling, the hosts are on-site and reside in the attached Inkeepers Suite.
description.access: Guests have access to all shared space, including kitchen, living room, dinning area, patio, outdoor bar, laundry room, parking
description.notes: Pets are allowed! You may have the opportunity to meet our friendly husky mix dogs or sweet kitties, who live in the inkeepers suite, but enjoy making their rounds to meet guests.
description.interaction: I am an on-site owner and host, and love sharing my home and providing tips for how to best enjoy your stay in this amazing area! Interaction is highly likely since this is my personal home, but I will also honor your personal space. I am out of town for periods of time but am always easy to reach by text, or a phone call if necessary.
description.house_rules:
Leave shoes at door
- Quiet between 10pm-10am
-come & go as you please but with respect 
-clean up after your pet (cleaning supplies available) 

Pet Policy: 
-Friendly Dogs only, not suitable for cats, unless under certain agreed upon circumstances. 
-guest must describe dog and their behavior to host when booking. 
-be aware that there are dogs and cats on the property and there may be other guests with dogs. 
-Dogs may not be left unattended and are not permitted on furniture/bed (bring a clean blanket if your pet must sleep with you, or to join you on the couch.

name: Welcome hOMe (3)
title: Baltimore, Maryland

gallery.caption: Guest room with a comfy single bed.  Memory foam mattress topper on this bed.
Queen room in same house listed under Welcome hOMe.
Spacious modern kitchen with granite countertops and island
Kitchen opens up to dining room with beautiful deck and screened in porch overlooking pond and 1/2 acre of lush backyard.
Front foyer as you walk in with Grandma's antique hats on the walls and a large staircase heading up to the bedrooms.
Living room with baby grand piano and a gas fireplace that blows out lots of heat in the winter
Another view of the living room with mural on the wall painted by the owner
New screened in porch that opens to the deck in the backyard
Owner (and snowman enthusiast) Jayne in her front yard in December.
Guests can come take a free yoga class at Yoga On York. www.yogaonyork.net
Street view: Our house is green with white shutters and porch swing.

hosts.about: Aerial dancer/choreographer, yogini,  author, professor of dance at Towson University.  Love to travel and hear about others traveling through.   My roots are in Vermont but have lived in Manhattan, Philadelphia, and Boulder, Colorado.

recent.comments: Jayne is a wonderful host.  I loved the house and the location was perfect for my needs in Baltimore.  Parking was easy.

items.comments: Jayne is a wonderful host.  I loved the house and the location was perfect for my needs in Baltimore.  Parking was easy.

Welcome hOMe lived up to the name! Jayne provided a welcoming, calm and quiet space for me to call home base while visiting old friends in my old neighborhood. A room without a tv is perfect for me and the shared bathroom worked out fine. There was a bit of traffic noise, but for the most part it was really quiet. Being surrounded by so many old trees felt like a nature retreat, even so close to the city. This is a one of a kind place that I hope to return to frequently in the future.
I enjoyed staying here.  Jayne is friendly and helpful.  The yard is beautiful and the room worked really well for me.  I would definitely stay here again.

I am a student and was rotating at GBMC for 5 weeks, I stayed in Welcome hOMe 3. There was enough space for all of my clothes and personal belongings. There is a lounging chair on the side of the room that is not pictured. The room is nice, sunny, and very nice.  The bathroom is shared between 2 other guests (if the rooms are occupied) but I never had an issue. Jayne cleans it regularly and before a new guest so it was always very clean.  The kitchen can feel crowded if everyone is preparing food at the same time. The fridge is shared between everyone and can get crowded so I ended up going to the Giant (less than a 5 min drive) every other day or so to get food instead of doing weekly shopping trips. There is more than enough parking spots, so that is not an issue. It's very close to GBMC (about 10 min drive) and Towson University's library (10-15 min) which is open to students from all universities.  The neighborhood is nice and I felt safe running outside.   There is a washer and dryer in the basement. The basement is the only place in the house where you can smell that cats live there (litter box is in basement).  Other than that, it is very clean everywhere.  The cats are very cute and although I have been allergic to cats in the past, I kept them out of my room and had no problems. Jayne's boyfriend, Dallas, is friendly and made me feel comfortable while sometimes I felt like I was in the way with Jayne. I worked 12 hour shifts 3-4 times a week so on my days off, I often felt like I was in the way and not welcome to study at the table (there is no desk in room 3). There is a nice screened in porch area that was nice to eat in and a nice patio, as well.  Overall, it was a good stay but for longer trips/students/weird work hours, I would recommend one of the bigger rooms.

Nice house and nice room.  Jayne is very hospitable and accommodating. House also includes the cutest cat who may greet you on arrival. Would definitely recommend and stay again. 
Had plenty of parking which is convenient.
I stayed with Jayne when I was training at her studio. She really made me feel welcome and at home. She made sure that I had everything I needed and went above and beyond for my stay in her home!

This was one of the best experiences I ever had. Jayne was simply AMAZINGGGG! She was really helpful and friendly. She made me feel home, dropped me at the Towson university (as I had a conference there) and let me stay for some extra hours. The house is located at an ideal location and everything (all kind of restaurants) is located within one mile distance. I would definitely choose to stay here if I am ever visiting Baltimore again.

description.summary: Twin bed in 4 bdrm home, 1.5 miles from TU.    (I teach at TU & owner of a local yoga studio). Screened in porch overlooks pond w/ 1/2 acre yard.  Huge kitch/din area.  Screened in porch overlooking goldfish pond.  Also have two other rooms for rent with queen beds on Airbnb listed under Welcome hOMe and Welcome hOMe 2.
description.space: This old house (build in 1924) with many updates belongs to an artist (URL HIDDEN) dancer/yogini…. and a dance professor at TU and owner of local yoga studio.  All the walls are different colors with hand painted tiles in the kitchen by owner and owner's kids, family and friends.  Must like cats.
description.access: Limited kitchen use  laundry available for long term guest (over 1 week), parking pad on first come first serve basis.  I park on the street next to house, large back yard (1/2 acre).
description.notes: We have a baby grand piano that you're welcome to play (providing no one is trying to sleep).  I ask that you please be respectful of my home and ask before you help yourself to things in the kitchen.
description.neighborhood: It's centrally located and close to Towson University and Goucher College or Johns Hopkins University.  Great neighbors.
description.transit: If you walk to York Road you can catch the bus.  It's about a mile walk.  Better if you have a car to get around.  On street parking or a parking pad for one car.  I typically part on the street next to the house.
description.interaction: When I am home, I enjoy conversations with guests.  I work 7 days a week so I am quite busy.  I'm an early riser for a morning yoga & meditation practice.
description.house_rules:
House has a keyless door.  Press:  Schlage then 2021.  Please shut the door so that it seals shut, (usually takes a second push to seal it) otherwise the lock will mis-align and not work.  Guest have been locked out from not paying attention to this detail.

Guest need to respect the owner's property and clean up after themselves. I clean the bathroom weekly, so it's up to the guest to keep the bathroom drain clean and squeegee the shower glass doors. I will supply toilet paper for the first week, then guest can buy their own after that if staying longer.   Please ask before taking any book or property from the house.   Also, no smoking in the house.

name: Cope Foster - King Room Downtown Cville!
title: Charlottesville, Virginia

hosts.about:
Guesthouses is a locally owned and operated short-term rental company based in Charlottesville, Va. We currently manage over 60 unique listings ranging from entire homes cottages and apartments to boutique hotel rooms throughout the greater Charlottesville/Albemarle/Nelson area. Our goal is to provide quality accommodations in great locations and ensure you have a seamless stay that will make lasting memories. Feel free to inquire about other properties in our portfolio if the one you are interested in is not available! We are also happy to assist in arranging multiple properties for larger groups. 
First established in 1976 - you could say we are the original "Hosts" of Charlottesville :) Though our company has evolved over the years alongside the latest trends and offerings of the vacation rental industry - we maintain the same values as the original owners who started this business in 1976 - provide quality service and accommodations in excellent locations so that our guests may experience a true taste of Charlottesville. We look forward to hosting you!

recent.comments: Sue was a wonderful host. Great BnB style experience! Perfect location for walking to downtown mall and driving to local wineries and breweries. Would definitely recommend.

items.comments: Sue was a wonderful host. Great BnB style experience! Perfect location for walking to downtown mall and driving to local wineries and breweries. Would definitely recommend.
Sue is delightful and friendly.  The breakfasts served were wonderful.
Great stay. Friendly owner . The accommodations were nice. All our needs “met”!  Location was great too. We will return !
You’ll love everything about this perfect guesthouse experience.
We stayed here while seeing a show at the ting …that is in walking distance.Charlottesville is a wonderful place to visit.

Sue was so sweet! She was incredibly kind, courteous, and made us feel at ease. She made the most amazing muffins every morning. The house was central and within walking distance to everything In downtown Cville. We even bonded with the neighborhood cat Bud during our four days there.
Had a great stay at Cope Foster. Can't beat the location and the house is full of historic charm. The host makes you feel right at home. Hope to visit again!

description.summary: This beautiful Virginia home is located in the historic part of Charlottesville. It is in walking distance to The Paramount theater, restaurants, and shops on the downtown pedestrian mall, making the house's guestroom perfect for anyone looking for activity in Charlottesville. The elegantly furnished primary suite has a KING bed and an adjoining private bath. This is a B&B style accommodation. Your hostess, Sue, stays in the home and serves continental breakfast each morning.
description.space:
This beautiful Virginia home is located in the historic part of Charlottesville, right near Thomas Jefferson's court house. It is in walking distance to The Paramount theater, restaurants, and shops on the downtown pedestrian mall, making the house's guestroom perfect for anyone looking for activity in Charlottesville. The elegantly furnished master suite has a KING bed, and an adjoining private bath. Amenities include A/C, TV in a shared space, and WiFi. This is a B&B style accommodation. Your hostess, Sue, stays in the home and serves continental breakfast each morning.

Walking distance to the Downtown Mall, the Corner, and McIntire Park. Just a short drive away from Monticello and golf courses.
description.access: Guests will have access to their own private area and any shared sitting areas.
description.notes:
Continental breakfast served.  
Price includes Charlottesville and VA state sales and lodging taxes.
Property managed and listed by Guesthouses Reservation Services.
description.neighborhood: Downtown Cville
description.transit: A car is not necessary, the downtown pedestrian mall is within walking distance and provides restaurants and shops. There is also a free trolley that travels from the downtown mall area to UVA's campus.
description.interaction: Your hostess, Sue, stays in the home and provides a continental breakfast each morning.
description.house_rules:
License Agreement for the Reservation

By agreeing to the following terms and conditions, the licensee (the “Guest”) is entering into a license agreement  (the “Agreement”) with licensor, Cvillas and Estates, LLC dba Guesthouses (“Guesthouses). In consideration of the mutual promises contained herein, both parties agree that Guesthouses shall grant to Guest a non-transferable and revocable license (the “License”) to use the real property and such buildings and land thereon (collectively the “Premises”) for the duration of time as set forth in the rental contract executed between the parties subject to the Terms and Conditions herein set forth (the “Contract”). (Look into the duration fields in agreement)

Violation of License Agreement:

Upon violation of the following term and conditions, specifically any occupancy limits, substantiated parking, noise and trash complaints in violation of the Good Neighbor Policy (herein defined), the license is subject to immediate revocation, and the Guest is subject to immediate removal from the Property, a minimum $500 fine and cleanings fees.  Additionally, Guest acknowledges that they may be subject to consequential damages as a result of their violation, including, but not limited to, damages associated with the Guesthouses inability to conduct short term rentals of the Premises due to any permit revocation or suspension that may result from Guest’s use thereof.







Guesthouses Reservations Policies

Booking Policy:
To make a reservation, Guesthouses requires a 50% deposit of the total balance, which is applied to the total rent. All balances are due within 7 days of the Arrival Date and will automatically be charged to the credit card used for that deposit. A reminder email will be sent out, from our credit processor Vacation Rent Payment (VRP), prior to the due date alerting the Guest that their credit card will be charged. If a different credit card is to be used for the remainder balance, please contact Guesthouses to coordinate prior to the 7 days. A lodging tax (8% City of Charlottesville (“City”, 5% Albemarle County (“County”)) and a state sales tax of 5.3% are assessed on the rental total and 5.3% on the respective cleaning fee. A credit card will be held on file and Guests authorize Guesthouses to charge the card on file in the event of excessive damages, cleaning or any other violations of the terms below.

Age of Guests: 
Guesthouses only permits persons of 25 years old and older and must have someone of that age present at the Premise at all times.


Online Reservations: 
Online confirmed reservations constitute the valid and binding Contract Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth. 

Trust Account:
The deposit, final payment and any other fess, will be deposited into Guesthouses interest bearing account at Wells Fargo bank. Guest agrees that such deposit payments may be deposited into an interest bearing account and that any interest thereon shall accrue for the benefit of and shall be paid to Guesthouses as often as permitted by the terms of the account. 


Cancellation Policy 

Upon Reservation:
A 50% deposit (“Deposit”) of the total booking amount (including taxes and any additional fees) is made on all Short- Term Reservations. Short Term Reservations defined as 30 days or less. Guest may cancel within 24 hours of booking without loss of deposit, with the exception of reservations made within 7 days of the Arrival Date.  

Full Refund Timeline:
Cancellation within 1 month of the Arrival Date, Guest is entitled to receiving a full refund of the Deposit with the exception of UVA Graduation Dates. 

Cancellation within 30 – 15 days: of the Arrival Date will result in a forfeiture of  50% of the Deposit
Cancellation within 14 – 8 days of the Arrival Date will result in forfeiture of 100% of the deposit.

Cancellations within 7 days of the Arrival Date: Guest will not be entitled to a refund. Guest will be responsible for paying the entire Accommodation Rate 7 days prior to Arrival Date, as agreed. 

Guesthouses will do their best to rebook the property for the applicable dates, in the event Guesthouses is successful in rebooking the property for any overlapping date, Guesthouses will issue a refund at their discretion. 

UVA Graduation Reservations:
UVA Graduation requires a 3 night minimum and requires cancellation 90 days prior to the arrival date. Cancellations within 90 days will forfeit the deposit collected at the time of reservation.



Licensee/Guest Terms and Conditions


1. Max Occupancy Policy 
Each Premises has a Max Occupancy limit, listed above, that is in accordance with city and county ordinances, thus should never exceed this limit, unless otherwise agreed upon or in accordance with terms below. 

a)	Guests of Guest Policy: Guests are allowed double the Max Occupancy during the hours of 8:00 am – 10:00 PM ONLY with the permission of Guesthouses. Outside of said hours Guest agrees only the Max Occupancy will be present at the property.  Violation of this policy can result in immediate eviction of Guest with no refund.  

b)	Number of Vehicles: the number of vehicles at the Premise should not exceed the number stated in the arrival instructions for the Premise and shall never be over the Max Occupancy at any time unless otherwise agreed upon and authorized by Guesthouses.  Violators of this policy will be considered breach of Max Occupancy terms and conditions and subject to the same penalties.



2. Pet Policy: 
Domestic or commercial animals are not allowed on the Premises at any time unless approval has been given prior. Any sign of a pet onsite associated with the Guest’s group will be caused for immediate eviction and forfeiture of all rental fees. Additional cleaning fees starting at $500 may also be assessed.


3. No Smoking Policy: 
All Guesthouses properties are smoke-free properties.  There is no smoking permitted on the Premises. Violators of this policy are subject to a minimum of $500 fine and any other costs associated with removing smoke from the property. 


4. Check-In and Check-Out Policy:

·	Check-In: check-in time is 4:00 PM.  Early Check-In’s may be available for an additional charge and must be coordinated with Guesthouses prior to arrival.
·	Check-Out Policy: Check-Out time is 11:00 AM,  If it has been determined Guest has not checked out by 11:00 am, it will result in a late check-out penalty fee applied to every hour past the Check-Out time. 
a.	TRASH: all trash on Premises must be bagged and disposed in the trash bin located in the area  described in the “Check Out Instructions” provided. 
b.	DISHES: all dishes, pots, and pans must be put away. Any remaining dirty dishes must be placed in the dishwasher and run prior to departure.
c.	SECURE PROPERTY: please be sure all windows and doors on Premises are properly closed and locked upon departure.

i.	Keys: any keys provided to Guest for access to property must be placed back in the same place it was found upon arrival.  Any missing or lost keys, will results in a $50 replacement fee.
d.	Failure of following the Check-Out instructions can result in additional cleaning fees based on each hour spent cleaning with a minimum of $50.

5. Behavior/Damages: 
Guests may not permit any acts on Premises that violate any state law, Good Neighbor Policy, or other rules that may be established by Guesthouses and/or Owner of the respective property. Guests may not destroy, damage, deface or remove any contents or permit any person to do so. Guests are liable for all damages to furnishings and/or any personal or real property located on the Premises.  
a)	Guests must report any damage found at property within a reasonable timeframe of Check-In and provide supporting documentation i.e. photos. name: Luxurious Keswick estate with pool
title: Keswick, Virginia

description.summary: Welcome to La Fourche! This historic Keswick estate with pool was exquisitely renovated and professionally decorated in 2021 to provide comfortable elegance in a quiet country setting. Located at the epicenter of early American history, it is just 15 minutes from downtown Charlottesville &  UVA, and near Virginia’s presidential homes, multiple vineyards, and the acclaimed Jean Georges restaurant at Keswick Hall. Enjoy quiet seclusion and luxury with easy access to all things Charlottesville!
description.space:
This elegantly renovated estate includes a mix of antiques and modern furnishings thoughtfully chosen for elegance and comfort. 

Highlights include:
- 6 bedrooms (2 with king sized beds, 3 with queen sized beds, and a room with two singles and a crib)
- 5 full baths and 2 half baths
- Black out curtains and sound machines to ensure the best night sleep for all!
- Fully equipped kitchen
- Newly installed 15’ x 60’ swimming pool with 15’ x 15’ tanning shelf for shallow splashing and sunning
- High Speed Wi-fi throughout property (speed tests at 428.1 Mbps download, 39.1 Mbps upload)
- Smart TVs in two bedrooms and first floor library
- Large patio with 2 grills (one gas, one charcoal) and firepit

More about the space:
The first floor of the estate includes a formal living room with oversized windows and pastoral views, an elegant library, a stylishly designed dining room with seating up to 12, kitchen with eat-in breakfast table for 4, a formal entry hall, an oversized half bath, and a screened in porch with seating for 8.
The second-floor features 4 bedrooms. The oversized master suite includes a California king bed with smart tv, a large seating area, a walk-in closet (with washer and dryer), a spacious and newly renovated bathroom with double sinks, a large tub, and a walk-in shower. Down the hall is a well-appointed guest room with grandiose windows and pastoral views contains a king-sized bed and an en-suite full bath. The third bedroom contains a queen bed and a Juliet balcony, while the fourth bedroom contains two single beds and a crib (perfect for kids and adults alike!). These bedrooms share a newly renovated full bath in the hall. The third floor opens to an oversized office with three desks and breathtaking views of Brown’s Mountain/Monticello. Off the office is a walk-in laundry room, a fully stocked linen closet, and two beautifully appointed bedrooms. Both contain queen beds and en-suite bathrooms.
The newly landscaped and meticulously maintained grounds are on 3 acres of property. Features include an oversized patio with firepit and fenced in pool with an ample pool deck to host all guests staying on property. Seating at the pool consists of 8 lounge chairs, two dining tables (including seating for 6 and 4 guests) 6 oversized umbrellas to provide plenty of shade, and a lounge area and couch that seats 6. The pool offers the ideal space to relax and cool off in a private setting while enjoying the Virginia countryside.
La Fourche is listed on the National Register of Historic Places and the Virginia Landmarks Register. The property was originally developed in 1788 as a tavern/inn, and served as a center for regional travel, mail, and voting during America’s early days. Distinguished figures including Marquis de Lafayette stopped at the tavern on their way to visit Thomas Jefferson at Monticello. The property was expanded and converted to a
family home ca. 1860, with extensive renovations and additions ca. 1920, 1935, 2003,
and 2021. It is notable for its primarily Colonial Revival style with Italianate remnants
displayed in its prominent features such as Chinese Chippendale railings; Doric columns
rising from the foundation to the roofline and two-over-two window sash. The property
retains its rural character with neighboring fields and large residential parcels
immediately surrounding it.

Services Included:
-Cable TV 
-Free High Speed Wi-Fi cable
Equipment Included:
-Pool toys
-Board games
-Outdoor fire pit with wood
-10 pool chairs, 2 outdoor dining table and seating for 6 at 4 respectively at the pool. Outdoor couch for seating for 6, pool umbrellas, and outdoor beer/wine fridge for your use while you relax poolside!
-Pack and Play (available upon request)
-2 outdoor grills, one propane and one charcoal.
-Outdoor patio seating for four
-Spices, paper towels, trash bags, laundry and dishwasher detergent, toilet paper, shampoo, and cleaning products etc.
description.access: Guests will access to the entire private house and pool.
description.notes:
Other things to note:
Child Safety: There is a fence, and locked gate around the pool. Keys to access the pool will provided during your stay.
-Use of indoor fireplaces are not permitted for use during your stay.

Liability Waiver:
You understand that swimming in the pool is at your own risk and that special risks may be involved with swimming. You accept full responsibility for any bodily harm arising from swimming and hold the owner harmless. You understand there are potential dangers that swimming may present to children who are not carefully supervised, as well as the danger to any person swimming if a person has health risks, or if a person swims while intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medications, or while pregnant. You agree to be fully and solely responsible for any accidents you may incur. You understand the risk discussed above and agree that you will assume all responsibility for yourself and for the consequences of those in your party. You agree to waive any claim whatsoever against the owner for accidents or claims arising from swimming, All Airbnb guest in my party acknowledge and agree that they have read and understand this waiver and they acknowledge that confirming below constitutes a binding and enforceable contract me Airbnb guest and Airbnb host.
description.neighborhood: The property offers luxury, privacy and tranquility in an idyllic location. Less than a 2-minute drive (or a 10-minute walk) from Keswick Hall and the acclaimed Jean-Georges restaurant. It is also in close proximity to many nearby vineyards and attractions to include Monticello, Ashlawn-Highland, Keswick Vineyards, Merrie Mill Farm and Vineyard, and Castle Hill Cider.
